[b] > Be me
> Discover Kopanito All-Stars Soccer
> "It's like Super Mario Strikers met Sensible Soccer and decided to kick it up a notch!"
> Intrigued.gif
> Game boasts skill-based gameplay
> No hand-holding, just pure football mastery
> Luck? Nah, it's all about your precision and reflexes
> Realize I'm the stat sheet - move over, Messi
> Super-moves are legit
> Earn them by schooling opponents
> Magnetic ball, teleportation, windmakers â€“ it's like playing football in a Looney Tunes episode
> Freeze opponents? Yes, please!
> Try it with friends
> Up to 5 controllers, because friends are better than AI
> Create epic tournaments like a football overlord
> "You are the Boss here!" â€“ power trip intensifies
> Online multiplayer
> Duel, Doubles, Chaos, Complete â€“ options galore
> Create Party mode for customized mayhem
> Local friends can join online games â€“ game-changer
> AI wonâ€™t let you rest
> Four difficulty levels â€“ Child's play to "pull your hair out"
> Practice mode for basic moves â€“ perfect for scrublords like me
> Many competitions and teams
> 17 tournaments worldwide â€“ I'm the international football sensation
> 100+ national teams, even the exotic ones â€“ Bhutan, here I come
> 7 stadiums â€“ because variety is the spice of football life
> Goal replays and GIF generator
> Turn my epic goals into GIFs â€“ share with the world
> "Hey Twitter, watch me school these virtual fools!"
> Brings back memories
> Inspired by classics â€“ Nintendo World Cup, Sensible Soccer, and Kick Off
> Nostalgia hits like a curveball from Beckham
> Remembers Shaolin Soccer
> Cue Shaolin Soccer soundtrack
> Players kicking balls with kung fu moves
> "Kopanito All-Stars Soccer: Where Soccer Meets Shaolin Chaos!"
> Imagine bicycle kicks with flying kicks
> Opponents left stunned as I channel my inner Shaolin monk
> Game on point, memories flooding back
> Kopanito All-Stars Soccer, you've kicked nostalgia right in the feels âš½ï¸ðŸŽ® [/b]

[b] Title: "Persian Soccer Chronicles: A Royal Review"

[The scene opens in a grand, time-bending palace. The Prince from the Sands of Time game, Dastan from the Sands of Time film, and the Prince from the 2008 reboot are gathered with their respective leading ladies - Farah, Tamina, and Elika. They are all gathered around a mystical gaming console with Kopanito All-Stars Soccer loaded.]

Prince (Sands of Time Game):
So, they say this Kopanito game is a blend of fast-paced madness and soccer. Intriguing, isn't it, Farah? ðŸ˜

Farah:
Indeed. But can it compare to our epic time-traveling adventures, my prince? â³âœ¨

Prince (Sands of Time Film):
Well, it's not every day you get to play soccer with a dagger that can rewind time. Imagine if this game had that feature! ðŸ•°ï¸âš½

Tamina:
Time-bending soccer? Now that's a concept! â°âš½

Prince (2008 Reboot):
Hold on a sec. Did someone say "time"? Elika, do you think this game can undo the destruction of my kingdom? ðŸ°â“

Elika:
Prince, it's a soccer game, not a magical restoration device. ðŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸âš½

[They all grab controllers, and the game begins. Chaos ensues on the virtual pitch as they play.]

Dastan:
By the sands! This game is faster than a sandstorm! ðŸ’¨âš½

Tamina:
And these super-moves! Imagine having these during our adventures, Dastan. ðŸŒªï¸ðŸ’¥

Farah:
Careful, Prince (Sands of Time Game). You might accidentally activate a sand portal in the game. ðŸ°ðŸ”„

Prince (Sands of Time Game):
Laughs Imagine trying to rewind a goal. "Sorry, folks, let's take that kick again." âš½ðŸ”„ðŸ˜„

[Elika and the Prince from the 2008 Reboot score a goal using a windmaker super-move.]

Prince (2008 Reboot):
I must say, this windmaker move is impressive. If only I had it when Ahriman attacked. ðŸ’¨âš½

Elika:
I doubt a windmaker would stop the corruption, my prince. ðŸ¤”âŒ

[Dastan and Tamina showcase their skills, with Dastan scoring a goal using a teleportation super-move.]

Dastan:
Imagine using this in the fight against Nizam! Teleport, strike, goal! ðŸŒ€âš½ðŸ¥…

Tamina:
That would have made our battles much more entertaining. ðŸ˜…ðŸ¤¸â€â™€ï¸

[The Prince (Sands of Time Film) and Farah pull off a dazzling combo move to score a goal.]

Prince (Sands of Time Film):
Now that's how you score a cinematic goal, Tamina! ðŸŽ¬âš½

Tamina:
Just like our acrobatic escapes, my prince. ðŸ¤¸â€â™€ï¸ðŸ°

[Elika and the Prince from the 2008 Reboot use a freeze super-move to halt opponents in their tracks.]

Elika:
Freezing time in the game, Prince? That's a bit redundant, isn't it? â¸ï¸â„ï¸âš½

Prince (2008 Reboot):
You can never have too much time manipulation. â³ðŸ”„âš½

[The game ends with laughter and banter.]

Prince (Sands of Time Game):
Well, that was a royal match. I must say, this Kopanito All-Stars Soccer has the speed of a sand dagger strike. âš”ï¸ðŸ’¨âš½

Prince (Sands of Time Film):
And the chaos of a sandstorm! Not bad at all. ðŸŒªï¸âš½

Prince (2008 Reboot):
I suppose soccer is a decent distraction from saving kingdoms and undoing world-ending curses. ðŸ‘‘âš½

Farah:
It's a fun diversion, but nothing beats our timeless adventures, my prince. âŒ›âœ¨ðŸ°

[They all laugh, enjoying the camaraderie and the chaos of Kopanito All-Stars Soccer.] [/b]

[i] In the world of soccer, wild and free,
There's a game that brings hilarity.
Kopanito All-Stars, oh what a sight,
Where soccer meets pure dynamite!

With heads for feet and limbs that bend,
Players chase the ball 'round every bend.
Goalkeepers leap like acrobats,
Trying to block those crazy shots!

No offside rules, no fouls to heed,
Just pure chaos at lightning speed.
With power-ups and tricks galore,
This game will leave you begging for more!

So gather your friends, it's time to play,
Kopanito All-Stars, come what may.
Laugh until your sides are sore,
In this soccer game like never before! [/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561199184930490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1689598174}
review:
[h1] Fantastic Football Fun: Kopanito Delivers the Ultimate Virtual Soccer Experience[/h1]

Graphics: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†
The game's graphics are vibrant and visually appealing. The player models and animations are well-designed and smooth, with colorful and dynamic stadiums that enhance the overall gameplay experience.

Gameplay: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†
Kopanito All Star Soccer offers fast-paced and addictive gameplay. The controls are simple and intuitive, allowing for easy and seamless navigation on the field. The game mechanics are well-thought-out, making each match exciting and unpredictable. The ability to perform skill moves and execute powerful shots adds depth and strategy to the gameplay.

Sound: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†
The sound effects in Kopanito All Star Soccer are satisfactory, with realistic crowd noises and impactful audio cues for goals and fouls. However, the game lacks variety in its soundtrack, which could have enhanced the overall sound experience.

Features: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†
The game offers a range of game modes, including single-player tournaments, multiplayer matches, and a challenging career mode. The multiplayer option provides an engaging and competitive experience for players to showcase their skills against friends or online opponents. Additionally, the career mode adds depth and longevity to the game, allowing players to progress and improve their team over time.

Replay Value: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†
With its addictive gameplay and various game modes, Kopanito All Star Soccer offers significant replay value. The multiplayer component ensures endless hours of competitive fun, while the career mode provides a satisfying long-term goal for players to achieve. The unpredictable nature of the matches and the need for strategic decision-making make it highly replayable.

Overall: â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†
Kopanito All Star Soccer is a visually appealing and addictive soccer game that offers a satisfying gameplay experience. With its intuitive controls, exciting game mechanics, and various game modes, it provides a well-rounded package that caters to both casual and competitive players. Although the sound could have been improved, the game's replay value and overall fun factor make it a worthwhile choice for soccer enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123840352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1697306002}
review:
Kopanito, a delightful indie gem, is a shining example of how simplicity can lead to incredibly entertaining gameplay. This zany and fast-paced soccer game delivers endless laughs and addictive fun, making it a must-play for fans of both sports games and casual gaming experiences.

One of the standout features of Kopanito is its hilariously funny gameplay. The game takes a lighthearted approach to soccer, embracing over-the-top moves, outrageous power-ups, and comically exaggerated player animations. From performing gravity-defying bicycle kicks to launching absurdly powerful shots, every match is filled with laugh-out-loud moments that will keep you entertained from start to finish. The sheer joy of witnessing your players execute ridiculous moves and witnessing the unexpected outcomes adds a level of unpredictability that keeps the game fresh and exciting.

The simplicity of Kopanito is another aspect that makes it so accessible and enjoyable. The controls are intuitive and easy to grasp, allowing players of all skill levels to jump right in and start having a blast. The straightforward gameplay mechanics ensure that matches are fast-paced and action-packed, with no unnecessary complications or steep learning curves. Whether you're a seasoned gamer or a casual player looking for some quick fun, Kopanito strikes the perfect balance between simplicity and engaging gameplay.

Moreover, the game's charming pixel art style adds to its appeal. The vibrant and colorful visuals bring the soccer pitches to life, creating a lively and energetic atmosphere. The character designs are quirky and endearing, adding to the game's overall charm. The attention to detail in the animations and environments further enhances the immersion, making each match feel like a lively and animated playground.

Kopanito also offers a variety of game modes to keep players engaged. Whether you're enjoying the fast-paced excitement of a quick match or diving into the challenging tournament mode, there's always something new and exciting to try. The multiplayer option, both local and online, adds a competitive edge, allowing you to go head-to-head with friends or players from around the world.

In conclusion, Kopanito is an absolute gem of a game that effortlessly combines hilarity and simplicity into an addictive and enjoyable experience. The funny gameplay, intuitive controls, and charming visuals create an atmosphere of pure fun and entertainment. Whether you're a soccer fan or simply looking for a game to put a smile on your face, Kopanito delivers in spades. Get ready to dive into the zany world of Kopanito and experience soccer like never before. It's an absolute joy from start to finish!

author: {'steamid': '76561199005084400', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1704140708}
review:
The player switching is so braindead, I feel like they never even got it to work at all but didnt play the game enough to notice that a core feature was entirely dysfunctional. There are a lot of other glaring problems with the controls (especially the terrible, terrible defaults) and I feel like the developers barely played this.
"Four different difficulty levels. The easiest one is a child's play, while the last one... you'll pull your hair out trying to beat the game."
oh really? how come the legend ai keeps shooting at nothing and missing the goal by a mile? sometimes it even shoots at the sidelines... And on the goal kicks, it passes the ball through the intended recipient, right to me. Pretty sure those aren't on purpose. This game is not finished and never will be.

also why did they make the noses green ... it makes the otherwise fine art style just weird and ugly

Varios equipos que seleccionar dentro del juego, tanto asi como algunos equipos "ficticios" como por ej; calabazas  o muÃ±ecos de nieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435580552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1690766808}
review: For me the game was busted. For some reason on the team select screen I get a HUGE FPS drop and it is impossible (not exaggerating) to pick a team. 20 minutes, at 50% resolution, fullscreen off, just to get to the S's to select Spain. Requested a refund. Too bad because the game is quite fun but the whole point was to beat my Spanish wife with the US team and I can't do that without being able to pick teams! Random select worked by just avoiding team select altogether...

author: {'steamid': '76561197983843516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1675102587}
review:
I can play Vatican there, what else do you want?

Horrible framerate while choosing teams is probably the biggest issue. I also don't like unrealistic results between ai games (seems like Kopanito simulates those matches on 6 minutes settings, without taking into consideration 2 or 4 minutes games), lack of place to spend earned coins and maybe better progression system.

Team editor would be nice thing to have (strange that there's exotic nation like Monaco, but no Azerbaijan or Mongolia) and with that maybe option to add attributes for players to make stronger nation in theory stronger than the worst one (big guys are only locked behind progression/difficulty wall, but there's no player stats here).

author: {'steamid': '76561199183025870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1709225469}
review:
Consejos para hacer milanesas clÃ¡sicas
Â¿Cual es la mejor carne para milanesas?
Los cortes que se suelen usar son cinco o seis que varÃ­an en precio y caracterÃ­sticas: La Cuadrada  y por el mismo precio, con buena proporciÃ³n de carne y grasa, la Bola de lomo son las mÃ¡s populares. Un poquito mÃ¡s cara estÃ¡ la Nalga y el que nunca falla salvo al bolsillo es el Peceto.

La nalga se caracteriza por cortes grandes de una sola pieza. En cambio, el peceto, por ejemplo, ofrece cortes mÃ¡s pequeÃ±os y redondos. Lo que sÃ­ es bastante mÃ¡s magro. Suele ser una carne tierna y sin nervios.

La bola de lomo, si bien es muy jugosa, como estÃ¡ compuesta por dos mÃºsculos, sucede que si se la corta muy fina a veces se desarma un poco. La cuadrada en cambio da un bife de una sola pieza pero mas suele ser una carne mucho mÃ¡s fibrosa.

Para ablandar la carne para milanesa: Si te toca una carne muy dura, podÃ©s darle unos golpes para que se ablande un poco.

review:
Casi el 100%, solo puedo decir: Kopanito no tiene nada que envidiarle a FIFA.
Tiene trofeos, selecciones, multi (creo que perfectamente puede ser 5 vs 5 en linea),
tablas de puntuaciÃ³n online, logros, cromos, etc.

Muy divertido, muy agradable, es desafiante con sus 4 dificultades. 
Un must buy si te gusta el genero. No decepciona, para nada.
Gracias Davuti por el juegazo â™¥

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1671841744}
review:
"Kopanito All-Stars Soccer" ist ein Arcade FuÃŸball-Spiel.

Das Spiel ist alles andere als eine Simulation. Jede Mannschaft hat nur fÃ¼nf Feldspieler und einen Torwart, Strafen gibt es nicht und so kÃ¶nnen wir problemlos Gegner mit einer BlutgrÃ¤tsche im Strafraum niedermÃ¤hen. Hin und wieder erhalten wir auch einsetzbare Power-Ups wie zum Beispiel einen riesigen Ventilator, der den Ball eine kurze Zeit lang vom eigenen Strafraum fernhÃ¤lt. 

Wir spielen als National-Mannschaft (mit der Ausnahme von Spezial-Mannschaften wie WeihnachtsmÃ¤nnern), dÃ¼rfen aber zunÃ¤chst nur als ein kleines Land starten. Und so wird die erste Partie im Pokal der winzigen LÃ¤nder dann zum Beispiel zwischen den Cook-Inseln und dem Vatikan ausgetragen. Im Laufe der Zeit schalten wir neue Nationen und neue Pokal-Meisterschaften frei. 

Die KI ist allerdings zwar ganz okay, aber auch nicht die hellste. Partien gegen echte Gegner bieten naturgemÃ¤ÃŸ einen hÃ¶heren Unterhaltungswert. 

Mechanisch ist das Game relativ simpel. Es gibt nur wenige zu bedienende Tasten und die funktionieren auch relativ intuitiv. Sind wir vor dem gegnerischen Tor kÃ¶nnen wir durch Tastendruck, der die Zeit kurzzeitig verlangsamt, die Flugkurve fÃ¼r unseren TorschuÃŸ beeinflussen. 

Das Spiel ist auf SpaÃŸ ausgelegt, das wird allein schon durch die comichafte Grafik deutlich. Die Sounds sind erwartungsgemÃ¤ÃŸ simpel, aber passend. Das Spiel hat keinerlei taktische Tiefe. Es geht nur darum, in kurzen Partien unkomplizierten SpaÃŸ zu haben. Und genau das erreicht das Spiel auch recht souverÃ¤n. 

Als kleinen Kritikpunkt kann man noch anbringen, daÃŸ die Steuerung manchmal etwas trÃ¤ge wirkt und man nur in die NÃ¤he des Torwarts kommen muÃŸ, um den Ball gleich an ihn zu verlieren. Das sind aber nur Kleinigkeiten. Ansonsten ist das Spiel sehr unterhaltsam und genau richtig fÃ¼r den unkomplizierten Kick zwischendurch.  

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
-/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
7/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Fun-Kick.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

review:
So many Andes Escobar moments.

Fun little casual game,  the controls are very easy to pick up and it seems that most of the game skill relies on sliding. 
There is no stamina, no fouls, a lot of violence and some pretty damn funny own goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080493208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1489863952}
review:
I'm always ready for some fun and quirky arcade sports, and soccer is such a beloved sport for me personally that I was eager to give Kopanito All-Stars Soccer a try. In terms of what it does well, I have to praise it for the responsiveness of its controls. Everything is tight and quick and you feel like success or failure hinges on your execution. I also love international soccer, so having so many international teams and tournaments to choose from was particularly exciting for me. The FIFA World Cup is probably my favorite singular sporting event in the entirety of the wide world of sports, and I just love the nature and concept of competitive multi-national soccer tournaments. There were also some fun power ups - things like a giant fan that you can use to blow back a shot from your opponent and a freeze ability that puts any opponents in your vicinity in a block of ice for a period of time, among others. 

On the other side of the coin, I was disappointed that there was no unique flavor to any of the squads. The only differences were cosmetic in terms of their flag and uniforms, along with their appearance on the pitch. Playing one team is the same as playing any other, and that was a very big negative for me. It would have been nice to have unique rosters/players/attributes so that there would have been some personality and flavor to the various opponents. It would have also been nice to have special moves associated with unique players, giving even more added flavor to everything, rather than the meter that opens up a power-up for whoever you want to use it. Everything feels pretty bare-bones because of these omissions. Additionally, despite things being mechanically responsive, the actual nuts and bolts were too simplistic for my liking. Everything boils down to an endless succession of slide tackles, looking to open up a bit of space to unleash a shot. Just because you are an arcade sports title does not mean that you have to lack depth - just look at Super Mega Baseball, for example. Kopanito really lacked the finesse I was looking for, but it also was lacking in the pick-up-and-play-fun department in comparison to many of its genre siblings. Finally, online seemed to be non-existent. With seemingly no community, you're left playing the A.I. I really wanted to love this game because, in concept, it's right up my alley. Unfortunately the flaws detract too heavily for an emphatic recommendation. It's certainly not bad, but it misses the mark in too many areas to warrant significant attention. It's one of many ordinary 3/5's for me.

review:
El fÃºtbolâ€‹ (del inglÃ©s britÃ¡nico football, traducido como balompiÃ©)3â€‹ es un deporte de equipo jugado entre dos conjuntos de once jugadores cada uno mientras que algunos Ã¡rbitros que se ocupan de que las normas se cumplan correctamente. Es ampliamente considerado el deporte mÃ¡s popular del mundo, pues lo practican unas 270 millones de personas.4â€‹ TambiÃ©n se le conoce como futbol asociaciÃ³n o fÃºtbol asociaciÃ³n, nombre derivado de The Football Association, primera federaciÃ³n oficial del mundo en este deporte y que utilizÃ³ ese nombre para distinguirlo de otros deportes que incluyen la palabra "futbol" o "fÃºtbol".5â€‹ En algunos paÃ­ses de habla inglesa tambiÃ©n se le conoce como soccer, abreviatura de association, puesto que el nombre de football en esos paÃ­ses se asocia mayoritariamente a otros deportes con esa denominaciÃ³n (principalmente en Estados Unidos, donde el nombre football aplica para el fÃºtbol americano, un deporte totalmente distinto).

El terreno de juego es rectangular de cÃ©sped natural o artificial, con una porterÃ­a o arco a cada lado del campo. Se juega mediante una pelota que se debe desplazar a travÃ©s del campo con cualquier parte del cuerpo que no sean los brazos o las manos, y mayoritariamente con los pies (de ahÃ­ su nombre). El objetivo es introducirla dentro de la porterÃ­a o arco contrario, acciÃ³n que se denomina marcar un gol. El equipo que logre mÃ¡s goles al cabo del partido, de una duraciÃ³n de 90 minutos, es el que resulta ganador del encuentro.

El juego moderno fue reinventado en Inglaterra tras la formaciÃ³n de la Football Association, cuyas reglas de 1863 son la base del deporte en la actualidad. El organismo rector del fÃºtbol es la FederaciÃ³n Internacional de FÃºtbol AsociaciÃ³n, mÃ¡s conocida por su acrÃ³nimo FIFA. La competiciÃ³n internacional de fÃºtbol mÃ¡s prestigiosa es la Copa Mundial de FÃºtbol, organizada cada cuatro aÃ±os por dicho organismo. Este evento es el mÃ¡s famoso y el que cuenta con mayor cantidad de espectadores del mundo, doblando la audiencia de los Juegos OlÃ­mpicos.6â€‹

author: {'steamid': '76561198256098710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1662321573}
review:
Hermoso juego de fuchibol, 1000 veces mas divertido que el Fifa y el Pes, vale lo mismo que un alfajor y te da horas infinitas.
Jugarle a la maquina en maxima dificultad es como tratar de ganarle una carrera a usain bolt cuando no tenes piernas. Lo jugas con tus amigos para cagarte de risa. Es bastante facil de entender los controles pero dificil de perfeccionarlo. Aca no existe selecciones mejores que otras por eso preparate para jugar con angola o Lesoto. Si sos el cagon que elegia el barca-real madrid en el fifa no te recomiendo esta joyita

author: {'steamid': '76561198067581857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1704088656}
review:
This game is super fun to play, from casual to hardcore. It's a football game within the Mario Kart verse. Everything is bonkers and the usual rules (fouls, offside, and even throw ins and corners, depending on the stadium) doesn't exist. Steal the ball with a giant magnet (that for some reason attracts the ball (?)), have a giant fan be your goalkeeeper for a couple of seconds, or even freeze (literally) the opposition players (and your team mates!!!).

It's a ton of fun, easy to learn game. Specially fun to play co-op/versus. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097800107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1621863400}
review:
This is a small cute game that strips digital football mechanics down to a primitive arcade level. Yet, don't take it as something necessarily bad: Kopanito is really fun to play, especially when you START to dig the controls and have the general pattern of the game's AI. The bad thing is that the game gets too old very quickly AFTER you master the technical side. You either destroy every thing alive on lower difficulties or drip with blood and sweat on the higher ones. Maybe I'm not the best player (which is possibly the case), but after 5 hours in the game I rip and tear any team on amateur and quite suffer on the professional difficulty. The bad thing is that I just don't want to continue the learning curve, because winning on harder difficulties simply requires doing the same things but quicker. The game totally lacks the strategic aspect, it's all about the tiki-taka, constant ball movement and quick reaction (actually, the things you really expect from an arcade). It's not a bad game per se, just becomes old very quickly.

I'll sum it up
PROS:
- The game's mechanics are really fun. Don't expect you'll beat a lot of teams right from the start, there's a learning curve here that can be mastered in 1-2 hours.
- The graphics are pretty much okay, the visual style is comic and funny.
- I like the arcade-ish bonuses and abilities that you can activate during the match: launch a flaming ball that sweeps away anyone on its way, freeze or shock your opponents, teleport with the ball. Anything goes!
- No referees, free kicks, offsides or cards. Do the two-leg sliding tackle on a player off the ball and watch 'em suffer!

CONS:
- Becomes too difficult (at least for me) on higher levels. No appeal in improving your skills, because you actually do the same thing but faster.
- Some of the bonus effects in the game are bad, I think there is more room for imprement here.
- Goalies are pretty much stupid and absolutely dominate in one-on-ones. Basically, the only way to score is a long shot after a web of passes.
- The game could use some personalisation like player names, goal statistics etc. I know it's an arcade game, but all teams are absolutely equal and there is no difference between the Cook Islands and Argentina, for example. 
- Tactics, anyone?! At least I want to send my lads all forward when I'm losing one goal on 88:15!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972418400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1615232280}
review:
A fun wee football game in short bursts but i mean short bursts, play it for much longer and it becomes very grindy and there's a lot of achievements that you would have to grind for a long, long time to get.

I wish there was a little bit more to it as every game feels the same but play against a friend and it comes into it's own.

So saying all that and  it's still recommended especially at sale prices

author: {'steamid': '76561198059825119', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 2270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2270, 'last_played': 1612548198}
review:
I will recommend this game because of its positive sides: 
- It's very fun to play ( but only for a while! ),
- It's a good arcade football game with humoristic elements, 
- The graphics and sound are ok,
- It has some original elements like the super moves. 

However, this game could have been much better IMO, if it didn't have some obvious flaws like: 
- First of all, this game doesn't even try to be a football simulation, and doesn't try to emulate the real life football situations. This will probably frustrate those who played only PES and FIFA so far, so they are not used to football arcade games. I will give you a few examples of what I'm talking about. In this game, there are only a few ways of scoring a goal ( by making a power shot - which means holding the shoot button and releasing it just in the right time, by a header from a corner, and by a volley from an air pass ). The shoot button per se is useless if not in the aforementioned modalities. That means it's impossible to score a goal by a quick shot, or if you are too close to the goal, which is contrary to real life of course. 
Furthermore, something that really bugged me about this game is that you can sprint only withouth the ball, and not with the ball!! What does this mean? This means that while playing against the computer, the AI players will ALWAYS BE FASTER then you. While having the ball, you will not be able to construct some good passing actions, because you will always be in a hurry to shoot the ball, before the AI players quickly steal the ball from you. So keep in mind that the matches will always be chaotic and super fast.
And more, this game doesn't have any foul system, so it is encouraged to always slide tackle at the opponents, which doesn't leave any consequences for you. So basically, this is Kung Fu Fighting Football. 

- There are too many commands. For example, why making a button for "header-shot"? In all other football games, the "shoot" button is at the same time the "header-shot" button. Why making a button for slide tackle? In all games like PES and FIFA, the air pass button is at the same time the tackle button. Also in this game the "select player" button is an extra button, why not make it the "pass" button when you don't have the ball?. So, at the beginning, you will need time to master the commands, and by all means it's better to customize the commands in a way that best suits you. 

- As I said already, Kopanito is fun to play, but only for a relatively short period of time. And then it gets dull and repetitive. Unfortunately this is a matter of fact. The game lacks something to hold you for longer time. This game has 4 difficulties and each difficulty has like 16 tournaments, but all the tournaments feel exactly the same! The colors of the pitch change and that's it. Also - ALL TEAMS ARE THE SAME IN REGARDS OF STRENGHT AND QUALITY! That means it will be exactly the same to play against America Samoa Islands and playing against Brazil! So, when you start playing, you will do a few friendly matches to learn the commands, and then you will start with the first cup on beginner. You will win it. Great, but then you will realize you will have to repeat the same thing 15 times on beginner, then on amateur, then on professional and then on legendary difficulty. Of course, you don't have to ( the achievement hunters will feel compelled to though ), but I think I gave you the idea of the copy-paste feeling that the tournaments emanate in this game. 
So, this game lacks variety, something like a career mode with extra elements like newspaper articles or fans comments that keep track of your results and achievements. 

- This game has an online mode but it doesn't work well. There is no one at the servers, so you will be able to play online only when you arrange with your steam friends. Also, you cannot play the tournaments with your steam friends online, only friendly matches ( why??).  

In conclusion, this is an ok arcade game that will entertain you for a while, but it could be much better with some improvements!

author: {'steamid': '76561198316800721', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1610904370}
review:
Kopanito Ã© um jogo divertido de futebol, ficando muito barato na 'sale'. Tudo muito rÃ¡pido, violÃªncia pura, nÃ£o existe faltas, pode dar carrinho a rodo, com bola e sem bola. Existem quatro dificuldades; Beginner, Amateur, Professional e Legend (precisa ser desbloqueado), de primeira play, a primeira dificuldade jÃ¡ parece ser difÃ­cil, ainda mais jogando pelo teclado. Com o tempo e vÃ¡rias partidas, aprende a mecÃ¢nica do jogo, comeÃ§a a fazer gol de longe, com o goleiro ou com curvas.

O multijogador estÃ¡ vazio, nÃ£o existe jogadores nas salas, ao menos que chame amigos para criar uma partida. Mas existe vÃ¡rias ligas e copas em single, sÃ£o elas: Oceania Cup, Pacific League, Microstates Cup, Asia Cup, Pan Arab League, North American Cup, Central American and Caribbean League, African Cup, Commonwealth, South American League, Pan American League, European Cup, Mediterranean League, World Cup, Continental League, World League e Indoor Cup.

Apesar de variados torneios, a repetiÃ§Ã£o Ã© a mesma, mudando apenas a cor do gramado, sempre jogando uma para desbloquear outra, nas 4 dificuldades, que o torna enjoativo. AlÃ©m de que vÃ¡rios times 'grandes', tambÃ©m estÃ£o bloqueados, precisando cumprir o objetivo estabelecido. Durante a partida, podemos usais itens especiais, como imÃ£ que atrai a bola, drone que pode eletrocutar adversÃ¡rios, um leve teletransporte no campo e um chute especial ala Super Onze.

Podemos acessar a ''sala de prÃªmios", que estÃ£o todas as medalhas e trofÃ©us que ganhamos nas competiÃ§Ãµes, ela estampa os melhores conforme a vitÃ³ria nas dificuldades elevadas. Existe um ranking geral de jogadores, com suas estatÃ­sticas e pontuaÃ§Ã£o. O jogo possui mais de 200 conquistas, de variados objetivos, para os apaixonados em quantidade. Jogo tem cartas, necessÃ¡rias 6 para fabricar uma insignia do jogo, podem ser compradas no mercado por ~20 centavos cada.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995890090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1638704601}
review: Played this in couch co-op and had many laughs.  Reminds me of games I played in the 90s but with a modern feel.  The game mechanics are a lot of fun, including ridiculous curl shots, the lack of a referee (slide tackles get out of hand), and super powers (e.g. placing an enormous fan behind your goal).  Recommend!

review:
I'm not a sports fan and have only played racing games. This game pulled me in with it's funny little characters and comedy trick moves. A great game to play with friends or a party that will keep you laughing.

The game has single and multiplayer so even if you don't have someone to play with you can still enjoy. Totally enjoyable for non and sports fans alike.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076910910', 'num_games_owned': 2203, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1677060310}
review:
A lot of fun vs. a friend (MP is dead). It takes a bit to get used to though, especially if you are used to play Fifa f.e.

The game has a few annoying things though. Slide tackles are OP, and that can make your own throw-ins a disadvantage, or your goalie kicks etc. But in the end both players have the same things to deal with.
Im only 4 hours in and i know i can still get way better.

I only played one test match on easiest difficulty vs AI, so i cant really say (yet) how much fun that is.
Again, if you like Football (games) its a lot of fun (at least with a friend).

One more thing, if your friend hosts you dont get any steam achievements during that session, if you host though you get them for both your own AND your friends actions.
For fame its the opposite, you only gain it if your friend hosts

Es un buen juego, graficamente se nota que es un buen trabajo. Lastimosamente no hay nadie con quiÃ©n jugar.

LogrÃ© jugar una partida y aparte que iba mal la conexiÃ³n de la partida, la persona que hosteaba la misma, se saliÃ³ y no pude continuar con el partido. VolvÃ­ a acceder a la cola de espera y no pude jugar nunca mÃ¡s. No se puede jugar contra la IA tampoco, solo en modo prÃ¡ctica o dos jugadores, creo.

Pienso que este es el tipo de juego que deberÃ­a estar gratis, ya que no vale la pena comprarlo y no lograr jugar con nadie online. A menos que lo compres con un amigo y poder disfrutarlo juntos, asÃ­ tal vez se podrÃ­a aprovechar, de lo contrario, no esperes jugar partidas seguidas con jugadores aleatorios que estÃ©n a la espera de unos buenos partidos.

review: I loved "Nintendo World Cup" on the NES with their crazy super shots, no penalties for fouls, small field and small number of players. Kopanito picks that game design up and transforms it into a modern game with new abilities, fun teams, and online multiplayer. Love it!

review:
Quite a fun game, specially when you are in need of just playing a game without having to think too much. I particularly love the fact that they added several leagues and cups for every continent (and even some special grouping of countries), as I do generally look for that in sports games â€“ don't really much care about the online side of things or playing friendly matches.

Would be fun if scenarios were added, such as having to come back from a 3x0 deficit against Germany, using a smaller nation team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047319777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1671898817}
review:
First and foremost: if you haven't played this game yet, shame on you. It's brilliant.

Second: if you're about to play it for the first time, prepare yourself for a good spanking.
That's right, this is exactly what will most likely happen when you'll play this game for the first time.

Let me get straight to the point, this game is so hard to master that it becomes frustrating more often than not (and believe it or not, this is its main strength).
Using manual passing (mandatory if you want to pull some acrobatic moves, more on that later), I got some heavy defeats at the lowest level before even being able to score a goal (if we don't count the ones scored thanks to the power-ups).

Here lies the good of this game: it's almost entirely skill-based.
There's no difference between teams, you could easily defeat Brazil/France/Belgium using Suriname. There's no difference between players: all of them run as fast, shoot as hard and pass as well, and none of them will ever get tired.
The only thing that matters is how well you control your players and how lucky you are with power-ups through the match (everyone would love to always have super shots, innit?).

Let's talk about gameplay: the ones of you who played Nintendo World Cup (I know I'm old) will surely find some of it in this game: super shots, no fouls of any kind, fast-paced arcadey action.
Is this something bad? Not at all.
Once you get used to the passing system and to how your players move/react (they're not glued to the ball path and this will make controlling passes a nightmare at the beginning), this game starts to shine: you can create some good looking (and definitely rewarding) moments of football with this, and I'm sure that when you'll see your first curled shot curve 'round the keeper, kiss the post and go in you'll jump off your chair, pumping your fist in the air like I did.
Add to this that with manual passing enabled (a thing which brings the game to a whole new level) you'll also be able to perform overhead kicks, diving headers and a variety of first-time shots that will more often than not result in the keeper being beat if performed within a reasonable range.

Soon you'll master the first-time controls and the special moves so well that you'll start consistently beating the AI, and that's the moment when you'll decide to raise the bar and move to the next level. Rinse and repeat, get ready for another good round of spanking.
As you progress further, you'll then realize that power-ups can be used in several ways: freezing your opponents during a corner kick so you could have open field for a counter or to stop a special shot, using the ball magnet to pull the ball from the GK's hands into the goal, using your opponents' tesla-copter at your advantage so it will electrocute them instead of you. Your fantasy is the limit here.

Several cups and leagues (including a World league in which your team will have to take on 31 opponents to be crowned World Champion) definitely add to the game's longevity and help you past the game's shortcomings (which I have to admit aren't that big).

Yes, you've read it right: this game has also some flaws.

First of all, keepers don't always react as they should, especially on curled shots: some shots that you'd expect to be easily saved go in instead, but it's by design (it's even stated in the manual that keepers 'do get confused' by swerving shots) and affects both your keeper and the AI-controlled one so it's definitely fair. It's not like the AI-controlled GK is superhuman and you're left with Loris Karius in goal. Every keeper has a Karius photo in their locker, here.
This adds to the game's over-the-top feeling, as it definitely helps the crazy scorelines which, again, are expected to happen by design. No dull 0-0 draws during a cold and rainy evening here (there's no rain whatsoever, anyway).
Another thing that I noticed and that I don't really like much is that the AI-controlled players seem to perform first-time shots from their half in situations that wouldn't require them to do so, and it happens way too often.

And well, I had a player of mine getting stuck in the net once and had to quit the game but it only happened once so I don't think it counts.

Other than that, trust me, this game is great fun against the AI, and it's a blast against friends.
Great value for the money, that's guaranteed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286302767', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1679189163}
review:
Sinceramente este juego me encanto, pero mas que nada en las primeras horas.
  Lamentablemente despues de un tiempo vas sintiendo que el juego se siente algo "Vacio" con detalles como que los estadios son todos iguales (a excepciÃ³n de 2) con la unica diferencia, el logo en el medio de la cancha, los espectadores de las tribunas estan completamente estaticos, al igual que las celebraciones de un gol. Pasa lo mismo con los poderes obtenidos son muy pocos y se tornan aburrido, como cuando ganas o perdes un partido, solo suena el pitido del arbitro y ya, una interfaz con puntos y sin musica. En el unico momento que se escucha el sountrack es en el menu principal
 Me encantaria que se agregase nuevas canchas con tematicas, distintos fondos, modos de juegos que prolonguen mas la vida del Kopanito, edicion de equipos donde puedas editar tanto su aspecto como el festejo de un gol.
 Este es mi aporte con esta reseÃ±a que no va a aportar nada seguramente, de igual manera me gustaria dejar algunas ideas:
Estadios en la playa, en un lugar nevado, con lluvias. cementerios o en una ciudad algo mas "futbol callejero" y en cada una habra "algo" que haga mas dificil el partido (autos en el futbol callejero, zombies golpeando a los jugadores si se acercan a las tumbas en el cementerio), me encantaria que se animaran a agregar mas contenido, seria un muy buen juego tan divertido y podria hacerse hasta bizarro inclusive. 
De igual manera es un juego muy recomendable pero esta es mi humilde opinion.

Not a big fan of soccer games but the special powers and more casual approach makes this a lot more entertaining, the games are shorter, crazier and just fun as a single player or party game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981593205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1623169560}
review:
For less than 1 pound its a brilliant little game. Picked it up on sale.
Plays a lot like an arcade game with toon style, but huge amounts of fun.
Has maybe the best banana shots in any football game to boot.
If your looking for a pro game like pes or fifa this isnt it. For gamer`s that mod or update pes or fifa though
you don`t have to jump threw all sorts of hoops and install dodgy tools to mod this.
Everything is moddable ;)

review:
Totally cute indie football game. This must be really fun in local multiplayer or online. Really simple and clunky movement, but that makes those funny moments. This has nothing to do with fifa so stay away if you looking smooth and realistic football experience. There is also these super moves that bring that extra spice to it. 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198073147247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2044, 'last_played': 1695752751}
review:
This is an excellent little indie soccer game!
It's fully skill based, meaning every team and player has the same stats.

That means the game is meant for cooperative or competitive play between friends. It will probably become boring very fast when played solo. Unfortunately, the game is pretty much dead online-wise, so you have to resort to local multiplayer. But that's where this game really shines anyway.

It can be played in any combination of cooperative and PvP, like 1 vs 2 human players.
Human players just assign their controllers to the one or the other team before the start of the match and then can switch between any of the players of that team during the match.
The other players will be controlled by the AI.
Controller support is excellent and it's even playable via keyboard.

The game allows for a great variety of passes, shots and effects which make it interesting and difficult to master. Basic handling is simple and intuitive though so it is easy to pick up.

Then there are the so called super moves which are available only once in a while during a match and let the player perform special moves that can't be defeated.
Some love them and say it's what makes Kopinatos stick out, others hate them because of their skill-defeating RNG component that often means a free goal for the team who applies them correctly.
Best and simplest would have been to enable or disable them via settings, but that isn't possible, so you have them in every match. You can of course decide to not use them during a match with friends.

You can select between a plethora of nations and even funny teams like Santas, Vampires, Zombies and such. However, most of the emblematic teams are unavailable at first and need to be unlocked by playing various tournaments which I didn't care to do.
So with friends, i still find myself playing such illustrious random encounters like "American Samoa" vs "Reindeers"! Lol

Oh, and personally, i love the cute visuals.

Pros
+ Skill based.
+ Easy to get into, hard to master.
+ Plenty of teams available. But many need to be unlocked first.
+ Great funny visuals.

Cons
- Super moves cannot be turned off.
- No more active development. Dev team seems dead.
- Online community is dead. You won't find people to play with other than your direct friends.

Verdict: Well worth the price! Great fun for local coop with friends.
A pity there aren't much players playing it online any more.

review:
Fun but some of the supposed skill seems to be just overcoming annoyances.
Unexplained super moves - that lighting rod always hits me no matter who summoned it.
Goalie is unable to pass the ball, just kicks it straight to the opponent.
Can never pass to the middle guy in formation, ball is always passed twice as far to another player if i try.
No indicator of who your next selected player will be.

review:
Kopanito All-Stars Soccer est un jeu qui ne paye pas de mine mais qui est franchement trÃ¨s Fun.

On s'y amuse rapidement, on rage parfois et c'est un excellent jeu pour des soirÃ©es entre potes qui nous rappel les jeux de notre enfance telle que Soccer Shootout, Nintendo World Cup ou encore plus rÃ©cemment Mario Smash Football ou Mario Strickers Charged Football.

La DA est franchement trÃ¨s sympa, le contenu est assez vaste au regard de son prix et surtout il y a pas mal de trophÃ©es Ã  faire (pour ceux qui aime Ã§a ^^)

Loin des standards des FIFA et autres PES, Kopanito All-Stars Soccer a ce petit goÃ»t de l'arcade et de Fun d'antan qu'on aime sortir de temps Ã  autre pour se refaire une petite partie en solo ou bien accompagner pour toujours plus Fun, de rage et de bons moments partagÃ©s ensemble 

Je vous le recommande chaudement

review:
Meh, para jugar media hora con los amigos no estÃ¡ mal, pero tiene poca profundidad y [b]como juego de fÃºtbol arcade hay otros que lo han hecho mucho mejor[/b], como los [i]Mario Strikers[/i], aparte de lo obvio: tira pa los FIFA si quieres jugar al fÃºtbol.

Por otro lado, [b]la mayorÃ­a de los equipos buenos estÃ¡n bloqueados[/b], y para poder usarlos tienes que jugar torneos completos, muchos de ellos en dificultad profesional, lo cual podrÃ­a hacer que todo el esfuerzo necesario para desbloquearlos haga que no apetezca jugar mÃ¡s una vez desbloqueados. QuÃ© manÃ­a con hacer este tipo de cosas y no dejar al jugador disfrutar de los juegos desde el principio.

AdemÃ¡s, tiene otros problemas, como la conexiÃ³n entre jugadores, que no es del todo sÃ³lida (a veces el juego harÃ¡ cosas raras, por ejemplo). De todas formas, hay veces que estÃ¡ tirado de precio, por menos de 1 â‚¬, asÃ­ que puede servir para alguna pachanga rÃ¡pida con colegas, pero eso no lo convierte en un buen juego. Repito, si quieres un juego de fÃºtbol arcade, juega a los [i]Mario Strikers[/i] (en las consolas de Nintendo o en ordenador con sus respectivos emuladores).

O jogo tem copas para cada continente, copas mundiais, desbloqueÃ¡veis e times de temporada tipo Vampiros e Aboboras pro Halloween, Papai NoÃ©is, Presentes e Duendes pro Natal e por aÃ­ vai, altas loucuras. review: Arcade style power-up soccer, with Avatar like bending abilities. High scoring makes for some nail biting comebacks. Really a joy to play against your friends. author: {'steamid': '76561197969745375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1587149494}
review:
Not a great football game (it's certainly not Sensible World of Soccer), and not a fun enough 'alternative' version of football to warrant a purchase. 

Fun for about half an hour against the CPU although games quickly become a predictable routine, and beyond that okay for couch co-op and games against friends - but there are countless other titles that would be better to spend your time and money on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994166327', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1601503618}
review:
This game is a fun little arcade soccer game. It's made even more fun when you can play with friends or even when you are able to find an online match. It's a simple game, but it's completely skill and timing-based so you never feel like you are being cheated by the AI.

It's fun to play through the tournaments in either single-player or local co-op and unlock all the teams, and it does provide a challenge as you progress through the difficulties. I've had no issues with controllers, was able to use Xbox 360 controllers plug-and-play. Detected right away, no problems.

Pick this one up on sale if you like arcade sports games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047577925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1608994949}
review:
Cool game for single player.
But absolutely garbage for offline local multiplayer. Controllers are totally messed up:
- joysticks are recognized as keyboard
- 2 joysticks often control one ingame character
- one joystick controls 2 ingame characters simultaneously

I bought the game to play with friend and as the result got ruined evening.
We hadn't play a single game because just stuck in selecting team stage.


UPD

All mess was on linux (manjaro with latest steam and updates), windows version of the game is OK.


UPD2

Further investigation gave new answers: to fix this misbehaviour you must turn off joystick identification in your steam settings 
Steam -> Settings -> Controller -> General Controller Settings => turn off all checkboxes


So, the game become awesome again!
Some info for developers of the game. Double input, as my research showed, is due to input form joystick is catched both by nwjs.io and steam. And than both steam and nwjs.io try to control ingame characters movements.

review:
not gonna lie, this game so addicting for me.

1. this game is seriously arcade and make happy
2. graphic is good, not trash
3. contain a lot of team, ALL COUNTRY(?)
4. you can play with 10 PLAYER ONLINE FRIENDS!!!
5. no dlc or something like that (totally good)
6. there is a LOT of achievement
7. CONTROL IS REALLY REALLY CUSTOMISABLE (some game like this cant customize the contol)
8. dope

but there is a downside too!
1.there is no training or some info for the new player but whatever this issue still make nonsense, people love this.
2. ping is not so good when play multiplayer with friend. (fix this please and this game super super fun)

very nice game and so worth it at discount. Go buy this game and make u fun!! 4/5

review:
Enfin un peu d'originalitÃ© pour un jeu vidÃ©o de football! Je trouve que l'aspect jouabilitÃ© et stratÃ©gie de jeu est encore Ã  travailler mais je donne une bonne note car c'est le seul petit jeu de football sur Steam qui me donne envie de rejouer: rapide, original et fun.
Il ne manque plus qu'Ã  amÃ©liorer les dÃ©placements (un peu trop saccadÃ©s et rectilignes) et peut Ãªtre ajouter des techniques de feintes ou de dribbles. Les reprises de volÃ©e de la tÃªte ou mÃªme au pied sont mal gÃ©rÃ©es, surtout en dÃ©fense, mais sinon, pour ceux qui veulent un jeu intÃ©ressant et original, je le recommande fortement, il ne prend pas de place Ã  l'installation et peut se jouer avec la manette (pas toujours le cas), il est possible de jouer Ã  plusieurs, 4 ou 5 joueurs je crois.

review:
If this game every goes on sale, GRAB IT. It's a great party game if you have multiple people (or even just two people) and also fun to play yourself. The bots can go anywhere from really easy to ungodly difficult, so if you are looking for fun or a challenge, this game is for you.
8.5/10 Can run on a potato

review: Nintendo World Cup was one of my favourite NES games, and this is the closest I've found yet. It's fun, quick to play, and the super-moves add a fun gameplay element. Some frame rate and slowness issues as others have pointed out, but it's not a serious game, so I don't find them seriously annoying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017526863', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1890, 'last_played': 1670147454}
review:
The Nekketsu soccer was my favorite when I was young so I like it too (I'm not a FIFA fan). 
Shortly: I love this game.

Pros:
- Good vibe
- GIF creator
- Many achievement
- Polished game
- Indoor stadium
- You can turn off the celebration
- Fantasy teams

Cons:
- Technical issues (fps drop sometimes, the indoor is slow, some small bugs - physics when there is a knocked out goalkeeper)
- The newly selected player remembers last pressed button
- There is no difference between teams
- Random superpowers (Perhaps only the weaker team would need - for balancing)
- You're vulnerable when you're in a corner kick
- There is no blood-pumping music during the match (like in N World Cup).

8 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198023134604', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1579389836}
review:
Highly recommended for couch play. Real good fun. 

Starts simple with 2-3 buttons but gets complex when you realize you can combine buttons for different shots. The game is extremely fun and intense if all 4-5 players have similar skill level. If any player is too skilled, or struggles with the mechanics, it can get a little annoying.

There are some powerups which are better than others. I wish there was a way to select powerups but you're stuck with a random powerup. 

It is definitely worth a buy especially if you play couch-competitive games.

Rozgrywka polega oczywiÅ›cie na strzelaniu bramek, jednak w przeciwieÅ„stwie do wiÄ™kszoÅ›ci gier tego typu, wszelkie faule sÄ… dozwolone. Kosimy przeciwnikÃ³w, uÅ¼ywamy na nich losowo trafiajÄ…cych siÄ™ umiejÄ™tnoÅ›ci specjalnych (np. zamraÅ¼anie okolicznych piÅ‚karzy), aby zdobyÄ‡ upragnione gole. DO NOT MISS THIS ONE!!

Here is a gameplay video with friends: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LlQKU1yRLMg

author: {'steamid': '76561198069565258', 'num_games_owned': 766, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1603019150}
review:
A classic styled- simplistic soccer/futbol game that is perfect for when playing with friends.

However, just like a classic game, do not expect crazy depth.

No power-ups do not break the competitive nature of game.

Yes, the AI will make some questionable plays and not understand when it is appropriate to do a header.

But if one can find this on sale, it is well worth the pricepoint.
If one typically plays games with groups of friends- this is a definite must-have

review: I recommend Kopanito All-Star Soccer. It reminds me of the 1990 Nintendo World Cup for the NES. And this childhood memory has led me to buy this game. The graphics and animations are very nice and there are many funny special tricks. In offline mode, there are many different teams and tournament variants. The online mode is unfortunately dead. All in all, a funny little football game, which does not take the sport so seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106654290', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1560596517}
review:
This Review is written as of 07/06/19 and could be subject to change in the future.

Kopanito is a skill based game where there is no individual difference of stats between any of the players or any of the teams and the outcome of the match is solely dependent on the player's skill. This may sound great but on the other hand it also means that there is no uniqueness between any of the teams, & they are all just re-skinned templates of each other.

Now to the gameplay. It is interesting at first, but gets very repeatative very fast. The game is a 5v5 football match (No I won't call it soccer) and whoever scores the most wins. There is no foul in the game which means you are gonna see a lot of slide tackles from both sides and I mean a lot. It spices things up with some super moves which you get at random which introduces some RNG to this skill based game. Now, this could be fixed if both sides get the same super move and it gets replaced if they don't use it for some time which gives it some more strategy factor but that remains to be seen. The offline tornaments feel like copy paste contents and feel like a chore after a few games and there is no "sense of pride or achievement" (*wink*) for beating it since you feel like you just beat the same team 8 times. Ironically this skill based game is more fun if you don't take it seriously and just try to screw around.

The repeatative nature could change slightly if you have 4 other friends and 4 other controllers to play with or you go online and play against 5 other players. which is probably what this game is made for. 5v5 player v player.

Overall the game has a lot to improve especially on the offline aspect which seems just sorta there to practice with the AI. Even playing with 2 other friends, it just felt boring after the first 2 matches. The gameplay loop needs to be overhauled or tweaked to make the games feel less repeatative and more unique.

With all that said the game scores a 5/10 for an average game but gets the recommend because of its cheap price which i got for 1 USD on sale. Get it if you have some friends and controllers and just want a football game (Not soccer) with super moves.

P.S. The slide tackles can affect your own teammate so you can already imagine the hilarity of playing with several friends and screwing with them.

review:
Fun little arcade soccer game. Still prefer the old Sensible Soccer games but I truly enjoyed the time spent on this one.

Gameplay is fun although a little bit repetitive once you've found reliable ways to score but that's not really different from the other arcade sport games there.

review: A casual 5 vs 5 soccer game, with superpowers. The game is very easy to play and is best enjoyed with a couple of friends. It does support online play, but the community is dead. Purchase only if you have friends to play with.

review: One of the best "hidden gems" on Steam. Arcade-y looking but tight play controls. A must for soccer fans looking for a fun game. I like how you can unlock every country in the world and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998957687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1585594029}
review:
My 6 year old son and I have played this for just a few hours and we already love this game. It took us a few minutes to grasp the controls and game mechanics, thankfully you can adjust the difficulty level of your computer AI opponents so it can be enjoyed by novice and veterans alike. No ref, so rough tackling is in! The funny animations, the cool looking hair dos and facial appearances of the players are refreshing. My son especially enjoys using the special attacks. 

Highly recommend for casual football play and laughter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039446285', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1558786055}
review:
Fun little game, reminds me of Hot Soccer from Sega.

Drawbacks - 
* Player switching is abit weird sometimes, it's hard to switch to the player that you want. I feel like it just selects randomly.
* We should be able to create our own teams.
* Would be fun if we could upgrade player stats with points, etc.
* Sometimes when pressing on a key, it registers that certain action and you cannot change it, like when pressing the S key to pass when you're getting a lobbed ball, we should be able to change our action. Something like how Fifa has implemented it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009918891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1558737115}
review:
This is a well made product, it has quality,thatÂ´s why I voted positive, but have a few thing that annoys me, and get me out of the game.I really want to like Kopanito, but no, IÂ´m done with this crap. Normal and professional difficulties are unfair:
- Controls doesnÂ´t respond the way you need in that difficulty, very slow and random
- You pick random players, making impossible to control the ball properly under pressure, you will end up throwing the ball away to nowhere.
- Enemy CPU is unfair, it can do things you can, apart from being perfect at chasing you down, they can pass the ball very quickly even when you tackle them, you hit the enemy player, but he did the pass anyway. Only beginners is playable, other difficulties seems to be unfair and lucky and not base skilled.
- Your team AI is stupid,  they gathered together, in line, filling the center of the field, everyone trying to get the ball, I got the 3 of them running to the ball, leaving the others unmarked, while CPU is always marking you, making very difficult to have a good or clear pass.
-Enemy goalkeeper is almost unbeatable at professional, he will catch the 90% of shoots, you have to be alone (which never happens) so you can score. Otherwise, you will have to be a little lucky to do it
-Long pass is very difficult to control, resulting in random actions. The only useful thing aobut it, itÂ´s trying to get a goal long pass
At the end, you will end up running and tackle and shooting fast, because otherwise you will lose the ball.
Maybe you can cope with this, you can rebind controls, and adapt it to you, but even so....

author: {'steamid': '76561198025533862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1638515407}
review:
Great arcade soccer game but with some annoying pitfalls. It's best to play it with a friend - that is where the game generates its most fun activity! Interesting graphics and good sound quality. The part I dislike is switching between players and inability to sprint while dribbling at the same time. The most annoying part is when you're tackling the offensive and then when you suddenly have the ball, you can't just time the pass to your open man (unlike in other soccer games, this is automatic). And so the ball ends up either to the opposite team or out of bounce. 

The difficulty setting needs rework. The "beginning" level (aka the lowest setting) feels like a pro because  whenever you are ahead by 2 goals, the "handicap" mode suddenly kicks in, which gives the CPU ridiculous amount of leverage to even up the score. That is not enjoyable for people who just want to relax and have fun. That would be okay if you and your partner are veteran gamers, but it won't be easy if you've partnered up with a newbie who just wants to relax and pass the time.

I had fun with this game, especially the coop part. It would be nice to be able to customize or create your own team from scratch. That would be an awesome feature! In the end, this game is not geared towards for casual people per se. The graphics may look arcady but the gameplay is not. lol If they can fine tune the difficulty to where each setting is comfortable for different skill sets, maybe i'll have more friends to play with. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198019270397', 'num_games_owned': 4179, 'num_reviews': 733, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1533425504}
review:
[h1] Points positifs : [/h1]

- Le genre arcade trÃ¨s dÃ©veloppÃ©
- La touche cartoonesque du titre et les graphismes en gÃ©nÃ©ral trÃ¨s rafraÃ®chissants
- Pas de prise de tÃªte: toutes les Ã©quipes sont Ã©gales, pas de statistiques compliquÃ©es, seuls les drapeaux des diffÃ©rents pays ajoutent une petite personnalisation aux Ã©quipes
- Les diffÃ©rences entre les personnages ne sont que d'odre cosmÃ©tique
- Les diffÃ©rents replays proposÃ©s... et pouvoir les sauvegarder en gifs ! TrÃ¨s original !
- PossibilitÃ© de jouer en multi
- Le gameplay simpliste et efficace
- La libertÃ© de mouvements et d'actions durant les matchs: possibilitÃ© de tacler Ã  outrance, pas de hors jeu, Ãªtre une vraie ordure avec le gardien, etc
- Les pouvoirs spÃ©ciaux faÃ§on "Mario Kart"...

[h1] Points nÃ©gatifs : [/h1]

- ... Bien trop peu nombreux et parfois anecdotiques !
- Le manque de diversitÃ© en gÃ©nÃ©ral
- La simplification Ã  l'extrÃªme et l'absence de statistiques assumÃ©s... cela peut Ãªtre aussi une faiblesse sur la durÃ©e !
- MalgrÃ© toute l'originalitÃ© et la qualitÃ© du titre on finit par se lasser sur le long terme... Mieux vaut jouer sur des sessions plus courtes mais autrement plus savoureuses !

[h1] En conclusion... [/h1]

Au contraire des jeux dits "sÃ©rieux" type FIFA ou PES, Kopanito All-Stars Soccer est clairement l'inverse du genre footbalistique. Avec ses graphismes cartoons, son gameplay ultra efficace et son cÃ´tÃ© dÃ©calÃ©, le titre Ã  un style bien Ã  lui et particulier qui ne plaira pas forcÃ©ment Ã  tous les joueurs, notamment Ã  ceux qui Ã©rigent en principes sacrÃ©s les rÃ¨gles du football ! Exit les hors jeu, bonjour les tacles Ã  rÃ©pÃ©tition par exemple ! Pourtant cela ne dÃ©nature pas le titre, bien au contraire, cela donne du piment et certaines situations sont parfois cocasses. Les pouvoirs spÃ©ciaux faÃ§on pur jus "Mario Kart" ajoutent encore Ã  ce titre une touche humoristique dÃ©jÃ  bien mise en avant !

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer est le genre de jeu qu'il ne faut pas prendre au sÃ©rieux, qui permet de se dÃ©fouler aprÃ¨s une dure journÃ©e de labeur et qui, selon moi, se joue par petites sessions pour Ã©viter ainsi de se lasser ! Au cours des diffÃ©rents championnats et de vos victoires, vous dÃ©bloquerez tout de mÃªme des nouveaux stades, des nouveaux modes de jeux,des ballons, etc. Cela ajoute au jeu un vÃ©ritable intÃ©rÃªt supplÃ©mentaire Ã  aller jusqu'au bout pour tenter de tout dÃ©bloquer ! Amateurs de succÃ¨s Steam vous serez Ã©galement servis !

Ce titre est une jolie trouvaille que je ne peux conseiller, notamment aux moins fÃ©rus de football, ils risqueraient d'Ãªtre trÃ¨s agrÃ©ablement surpris quand au dÃ©tour d'une session de jeu cela fait dÃ©jÃ  4 ou 5 matchs qu'ils enchaÃ®nent ! >> 17/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198009549529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1197, 'last_played': 1566430024}
review:
Played a cup on beginner... too easy. The gameplay is alot of fun and very chaotic!! I love making sick plays and scoring a rad goal! I had a few that made me jump out of my seat and run around lol. I played a professional cup and wow... i got smoked in the very first game! What the Ai were doing was insane and some moves they did I never have done before... such as a bicycle kick from an out of bounds throw! What really makes me happy is to see Republic of Ireland, my go-to team. ;)

This Sunday I'll be playing with a buddy on my big screen and I do not doubt we will have a blast!

(Edit after 17hrs) Yep, my buddy and I had a blast last weekend!! I still have fun playing by myself and especially after getting better at the game to actually start beating the "pro lvl" Ai. It's almost gotten too easy unfortunetly, but thankfully there's a Legendary lvl to unlock, so I'm aiming for that! It's been pretty rewarding unlocking these teams through winning cups and league tournaments, but one thing I kinda wish for are stats to these teams... yes it will just demoralize your want to play your favorite team if their stats are pretty bad compared to the others, but maybe they could just keep it to simple stats such as Aggressive and Defensive on a 100% scale. You could still play your favorite team and have a fair chance against all others, even if your team has like a 30%-70% aggressive to defensive stats scale.

Having a more defensive team could mean much more accurate defenders and goalies in their slide tackling/range, blocking incoming goal shots, as well as increasing their lob pass range (considering it as a clearing skill). For a more aggressive team, they'd have much faster attackers, faster goal kicks (more prone to knocking out enemy defenders as well as the goalie instead of having to hold B for longer for maximum speed), and less likely to get tripped by a slide tackle.

Just an idea, could be a bad one and hard thing to achieve for the devs, but it's worth a try to add a little more variety and spice to the games teams.

review:
This game is very good, and reminds me very much of the old school football game Nintendo World Cup, I used to play on my NES. With super powers that can be used during the matches and the characters also remind me very much of that game. although I miss following
- there is no one to play this game with online 
- there is no music 
- the game seems to be forgotten as it crashes now and then, therefore I cant recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969606968', 'num_games_owned': 4382, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1123, 'last_played': 1544200927}
review:
Un juego que de primeras puede parecer una chorrada pero que detrÃ¡s esconde un trasfondo bastante divertido y estratÃ©gico.

Para el singleplayer tienes varias copas y ligas que al terminarlas en dificultad profesional vas desbloqueando los equipos que estÃ¡n bloqueados por defecto.
Tiene muchos logros la mayorÃ­a repetidos relacionados con la dificultad con la que estas jugando.
Para jugar solo esta bien para desbloquear los equipos y sacar algÃºn logro, pero la gracia del juego es jugarlo con amigos y chat de voz a ser posible.

Como contra le pondrÃ­a que tarda un poco en cargar cuando le das a empezar a jugar, para lo que es tendrÃ­a que cargar instantÃ¡neo, por lo demÃ¡s es un juego divertido que te darÃ¡ unas cuantas horas para jugar solo y muchas mas con amigos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198445301648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1526540130}
review:
This football game is light and is great especially when played with local multiplayer. There are several game modes to choose from and the skills adds a lot more fun into the mix. The graphics as well as the sound of the game is pristine, however, the downside of this game for me is the ONLINE MATCHES. For some reason, every online match I join in has a slow connection. During an Online Match, the game is about a second delay due to these latency problems (server-side). Hope they get a fix for this, because overall, this is a solid, fun football game.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039329770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1522849214}
review:
Insanely fun. Easy to play, difficult to master.

Not much else to say - I played PES and FIFA and felt annoyed most of the time, but such a simple game had me laughing and joking with my son. I have had a rough time lately with depression so gaming is something not easy to get into and not something I can sustain for long. This game had me forgetting my problems for a couple of hours and we plan to play a hell of a lot more.

Thanks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000203126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1537758479}
review:
Mixed reviews, was this a brigade? C'mon, this game is amazing.


This is an insanely fun pick up and play arcade experience. It's actually incredibly deep too, by far more for skillful than FIFA. The only AI issue you really fight here is the player switching, but it's a ton more than fun playing soccer on scripted rails (fifa). Couldn't recommend more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050853569', 'num_games_owned': 3422, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1522292734}
review:
Thereâ€™s a category of games which try to be neither exceptional nor genre defining, not incredibly original nor reach Crysis-like graphics but be fun as they are entertaining as they are flawed. This â€œfun but flawedâ€ category is immense and gets a lot of bashing for its shortcomings, its repetitiveness, its one-dimensional story (or its no story at all) but thereâ€™s one aspect that those reviews miss and that the writers seldom getâ€¦ itâ€™s fun to play. 

The problem with sports games is that they are trying to replicate something that is repetitive in nature. How to make a futbol game NOT be repetitive when it is 22 men (or women) running after a ball in a field trying to put it between goal posts. Other sports games suffer the same innuendos but the ones that manage to get it right are special. See, as an avid player/lover of the sport, I understand this completelyâ€¦ and the people at EA understand this as well as they push out a â€œnewâ€ FIFA every year which seldom is more than graphical and squad updates but they make millions doing soâ€¦ and its quite a shame really since the games get no better (in fact they get worse) and you Call of Duty realize that youâ€™ve been doing the same maneuvers for the past six years. Still both Fifa (with its millions) and Kopanito (with its humbleness) fail in the same way, and you canâ€™t blame them: they are both trying to recreate a repetitive sport which gets its thrills and fame at a psychological level more than physical.

Understand that when Ozil makes a sexy pass when any dumb player wouldâ€™ve shot miles wide and the commentator wonders â€œhow did he do that?â€ itâ€™s about whatâ€™s going on up here in the membrane than with the legs (of course we do need them to play but hear me out). When Messi breaks Boatengs ankles and then chips Neuer, its as if heâ€™s reach a plateau mentally where there is nothing more than the ball and the opposition; no media, no fans, no camp nue, not even himself. When the ball is at his feet, Iâ€™m sure he feels the same way a pilot feels in the air, an adrenaline junkie in war, an animal lover with his dogsâ€¦.. complete.

And when youâ€™re playing in the Sunday league and are so tired from being out of shape, nauseous from the beers you had beforehand, angry that your wife makes such a fuss instead of letting you play, and the ball comes to you and without thinking, you hit it first timeâ€¦ into the stands, into the defender, or hell at least into the post, and it goes top corner and you wonderâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦. â€œhow did I do that?â€ and all your mates congratulate you at the corner flag and you see your wife jumping for joy (which is unheard of), THATâ€™S what Fifa and Kopitano are trying to recreate; everyone is already in shape, has a great touch and is a great player in the top flight (or none of that in your Sunday league jaja) but the winners are separated much more than physically but psychologically and no sports game will ever be able to replicate that with a controller in hand, maybe in vr, I donâ€™t know, but they wonâ€™t and presently, they canâ€™t. Kopanito is repetitive (nooo, really??) but its fun. Fun and flawed. Now go outside and kick the ball around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982490998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 487, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1530464391}
review:
Un gros oui!
Je cherchais un jeu de foot simpliste et drÃ´le. Je suis 100% servi.
Les commandes sont paramÃ©trables Ã  souhait, ce qui est toujours du meilleur confort de jeu.
CotÃ© gameplay, les Ã©quipes sont super drÃ´les avec des personnages farfelus mais aussi la plupart des Ã©quipes Nat. Si on trouve Vanuatu, vous trouverez forcÃ©ment votre Ã©quipe.
En jeu, aprÃ¨s 5 min d'entrainement, on se lance dans le grand bain en mode facile et on gagne plutÃ´t facilement. Au bout d'une heure de jeu, on passe en mode normal... C'est simple, fun, dynamique, bref trÃ¨s agrÃ©able a jouer.
Seul bÃ©mol pour les "power up" dont j'ai du mal a saisir le fonctionnement et la disponibilitÃ©.

L'idÃ©al reste quand mÃªme d'affronter d'autres joueurs (surtout des amis) afin de bien rigoler. Bref, une trÃ¨s bonne surprise pour moi qui avait peur de la dÃ©ception en l'achetant.
