 En resumen, El modo offline me parece bueno, divertido, entretenido. El Ã¹nico punto negativo que encuentro es el Online, de verdad espero que se solucione eso para que almenos las pocas personas que hay online intentando jugar lo puedan hacer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271941801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1547354370}
review: This game is really fun, I am just going to say that right now. There are so many things that I like in this game. When you score a goal (especially on Professional) it feels amazing. In this game all you need to do is have fun and it will be a great game. But, and there is almost always a but for most games, some things make me a little mad. For example, the player switching can be very frustrating at some points. Also CORNER KICKS. OMG, whenever I give up a corner kick on Professional difficulty I already know that they are going to score. It is a 90% chance that they will score. There are very few things that are bad about this game. The Professional difficulty is very challenging at the beginning, but once you keep playing it gets easier and easier and soon you will be really good. Overall this game is great and you should buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420790', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 399, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1514570802}
review:
This is a good arcade football game (once you've sorted out the default control scheme...) that is very SWOS like.... except for one cruical flaw that means I cannot recommend the game.

The player switching is completely brain-dead, which is incredibally frustrating when playing on professional difficulty (and above), as it's often impossible to select your defender between their attacker and your keeper -- you often end up selecting another midfielder, which means they can shoot unopposed on your goal.

If they fixed that I imagine it would be a great time-filler.

(It'd also be good if there was an option to remove the power-ups. Sometimes one team has a great one and the other team has a rubbish one and that's quite unfair!)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970938346', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 558, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1571891146}
review:
As a SP game it is one-dimensional and boring; you always score goals the exact same way by holding LB to make an advanced passing/header/kick move which is code for "just pass and kick with this button held or you won't score".

Local MP might be worth a go but I doubt it because it isn't the kind of game somebody unfamiliar can just pick up, plus the "powers" seem tacked-on when the core game is needlessly convoluted considering how simple it is under the surface.

Online MP is completely devoid of players.

Just pass on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160397589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1517051708}
review:
Fantastic game, not too difficult to get to grips with. You can choose between whether passing is assisted or not, probably best to start with that option on.

The only negative thing is that the loading screens take a while when you start the game up.

The in-game music is pretty funky too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107786050', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1537960181}
review:
This game is pretty casual and very fun, but can also become a hardcore game if you want it too. Overall I recommened this game to anyone that has that "sports itch" at the moment and is looking for something to play. I also recommend to anyone that likes sports games in general too.

From a singleplayer point of view:

I was never into sports games or watched any sports in real life, but I do enjoy playing the games from time to time. I am one of those that got the "sports itch", I looked around and saw this game. The graphics are very welcoming and fun which pushed me to buy this. When I started playing, I was amazed at how fun the game actually was, the overall mechanics are simple, but there is an underlying depth to it which makes it hard to master.
Anyone can pick up this game and play it right away with no problem. The fun factor was instant, I just wanted to play more and more.

What also appealed to me is that, there aren't any rules, except when kicking the ball out of bounds, anything goes beyond that. You can slide tackle all you want and watch your opponent eat grass all day if you want too. This to me is awesome because sports games with all these rules turn me off, I just want to play for fun, if I want rules then I'll play the other fifa games or w/e.

Overall I would recommend purchasing this game, especially if you play with friends, I can see lots of enjoyment coming out of it. If not then definitely keep an eye out.

review:
This is really nice. I do like arcade games like this. There's a curve to do it better and better as well. So I think for the less monetas it's really awesome. Reminds of Mario Soccer for the NGC. I recommend to play free without the assistant cause of the cool moves in the air to score!
If I had a wish, I'd like to create teams - customization would be great! And more statistics about the scorers and assists.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981601200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1613, 'last_played': 1615019962}
review:
... and there I was thinking "Soccer with super moves? How rediculous! It kills the realism and ruins the game."
Then I saw the game on sale and thought I'd pick it up nevertheless just to try it out -- I was hooked. 5+1 players (of which 1 to 5 human players), 6 + 6 minute matches (by default, can be adjusted), one ball, and no referee. Havoc and slide tackles soon become a norm.

The gameplay is smooth and the AI offers a pretty decent challenge for starters. A grinder like me takes on the challenge and plays only on pro level (until platinum gets unlocked). You will be crushed for a few matches but once you get the gist you'll soon become a pro yourself and winning a game becomes a walk in the park. Challenging and fun at the same time.

These super moves, there aren't that many but they add an element of surprise to the game. Your breakthrough with the ball may be short lived as your opponent just stole the ball using super magnet, and now he's ready to catapult the ball to your goalie's face! Literally, as you watch your goaltender fall back on his butt after getting hit right between the eyes by the ball that is now slowly but surely bouncing accross the goal line. So you retaliate right from the kickoff by swiftly blasting through their defences without losing the ball and launch an extremely swerved shot right past their goalie, and you do this three times in a row withing 30 seconds (realtime) -- and you get rewarded with three achievements by doing so.

The way achievements are incorporated into the game is one of the best ways I've encountered. In the beginning of each match you get a suggestion of what to do in a match to earn fame poins, like "win without using slide tackles" or "score three more goals than your opponent", and each one of these is tied to a steam achievement so gradually you end up getting them all simply by playing the game (and completing the given challenges of course). Play as a pro and you'll get the medium and easy level achievements, too.

Soundscape is good, the intro track is catchy, and the controls are pretty intuitive except that I swapped the left and right swerve buttons. This is one of those games where local co-op supports up to 5 players so you can either team up against the AI or go rogue with elbow tacktics and have fun, yet painful brawl on a virtual soccer field. Wether you win or you lose, it's still fun.

The one thing that annoys me the most in this game is tesla chopper flying sound, but this is just a personal opinion.

All in all, this game is definetly worth checking out if you're even remotely into soccer / football. It is simply fun!

One more match? :kopanitoball:

author: {'steamid': '76561198204159008', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3357, 'last_played': 1511017678}
review:
In a different review, it is said that Kopanito All Star Soccer would be a mixture of "Mario Strikers" and "Sensible Soccer". From own experience, it cannot be accounted for the first one, but for the second. Strictly speaking, what the developers might have done is commuting the x and y axis and put the Sensible Soccer AI up again. In addition, the banana shot style and GFX remind us at least a little bit of "Micro Prose Soccer". 
As so often, these impressions may be seen as a strength and also as a weakness of the game. The strength is nostalgy, the weakness lacking complexity, as it refers to 20+ years old titels. In deed, from todays perspective, it looks like an only half complete game:
-  regardless of the four difficulty levels and the teams chosen, the AI reacts always in the same way with a difference set only in attacking aggressivity depending on the difficulty level (reducing the player's time to (re)act).
- There are procedures to invoke goals regardless of difficulty (as in Sensible Soccer) that make the game (as long as the player intends to win) extremely repetitive. 
- Some parts just seem to be incomplete and terribly unnecessary, for example the "long shots": There is no chance of passing the ball over long distances, instead there are straight shots invoked in mid-air that almost cannot lead to goals (0,2% propability) as they are harmless, automatically directed towards the middle, but fill the player's skill bar for a special ability... A bit strange, this shots should be more refined such that the player can show his/her skill performing them as this game is praised as "skill based" by the developers. Since this feature is well established in Sensible Soccer, it's even a minus compared to a 22 years old game!

Since this can be, in some way, read as a comparison review to former games, we'd like to conclude it by stating that the special abilities, such as SUPER SHOT, ELECTROSHOCK, FREEZING, WIND MASHINE (behind the goal) and last but not least the BALL MAGNET can clearly be seen as inventions and novelties to improve this kind of arcade genre, but a general recommendation looks different and shall only by given for a 70%+ sale as already stated in other reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990469178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1484866373}
review:
It's just kind of dull and lacks flair to keep a lasting audience.
It's an otherwise [b]extremely[/b] competent arcadey soccer game.

I really like soccer games, but there's almost no sense of sportsmanship, hype, or excitement when you play. The crowd is lifeless, the players have little to no personality or visual distinction, and the game is just far too quiet.

What keeps a lot of people around, myself included, are usually the attachment to the characters and the tension that comes with scoring or even just running with the ball. This game doesn't really have all that.

Solid mechanics and more than decent soccer title, but very little else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141767887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1506381202}
review:
Football is one of my favourite sports, just behind motor racing, and of course I like to play "e-football".

Games like FIFA, PES or many others are good games, however, often, when you're playing it, you get so much focused in winning the matches, that you forgot the main principle of video game: to have fun. And, fortunately, "Kopanito" is all about it, having fun.

I mean, the gameplay is so easy to understand, but at the same time, so much precise that often, even when you lose the match you're with a silly smile on your face thinking "what a great match!".

The multiplayer is a great sum! Nowadays, times where we're being pushed to individual gameplays, or at most online multiplayer, "Kopanito" has still having a good local multiplayer - cooperative and competitive. Alright, FIFA and PES are just like that in this point, however "Kopanito" is more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035303725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1500538280}
review:
If I could give this game a neutral rating I would but after a slight consideration it needs to be negative. 

This game is basically a World Cup clone (from the old NES) and it's quite fun if you've got a few controllers and friends to play with locally but other than that it doesn't offer much. I've got a ton of games I'd rather play solo and I've NEVER managed to get an online game against a random person despite quite a few tries.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134315627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1500769667}
review:
Bought this a year ago. I still have some hope that this game will get better.

What I don't like about It:
The biggest issue, very poor sound ambience. International Superstar Soccer, a game released near 1995 outperforms a 2016 game in that area.

Constant changes on the gameplay. Filtering passes doesn't seem to be there again. Player receiving the ball has a slow reaction again.

Bugs that weren't there in early access are now here (just adressed one in the discussions (Issues) after 5 minutes of gameplay.

Game seems to be good for local multiplayer matches with friends. Forget about online MP, It's dead at the moment. It was a lag fest with non locals time ago and I couldnt test the performance with people in my country over LAN so I can't tell how good or bad It was.

Honestly, It has potential, but all these issues and lack of features makes hard to recommend Kopanito even on sale.

"Behold the kickmen" and Fernando Sansberro's "Pixel Cup Soccer 17" look way more promising than this one.

review:
O jogo deixa bem claro qual Ã© o seu principal objetivo: divertir o player.
Levando em consideraÃ§Ã£o isso, o jogo Ã© realmente muito bom,  tanto no quesito grÃ¡ficos,  quanto jogabilidade e atÃ© sons.
Mas vamos por partes.
-O que mais te chamou atenÃ§Ã£o nesse game?
Primeiramente o grÃ¡fico, todos os personagens caricatos e uma infinidade de personagens (todos os jogadores q eu vi atÃ© agora sÃ£o Ãºnicos, podem ser atÃ© parecidos, mas todos tem uma caracterÃ­stica que Ã© unica) isso sem contar com os times doferentes que o jogo disponibiliza,  como o time de vampiros ou o time de bonecos de neve.

-E dentro do jogo?
quando vocÃª starta o game a primeira coisa q nota Ã© q nao tem juÃ­z, ou seja, nÃ£o existe falta... exato, carrinho pra todo lado, sem dÃ³.  Os campos sÃ£o grandes, o q permite fazer diversas jogadas diferentes. Os chutes sÃ£o um show a parte, quando seu boneco vai chutar o game fica em slow motion (Ã‰ o tempo q vc tem para mirar e colocar curva caso queira), e esse efeito deu uma cara que ha tempos eu nÃ£o via em jogos de esporte (mais especificamente em jogos de futebol). Ã‰ uma emoÃ§Ã£o a parte ver seu chute em camera lenta e dar aquela sensaÃ§Ã£o de "cara... vai ser um golaÃ§o".
Tem tbm um detalhe muito bacana no campo, cada carrinho dado pelos bonecos deixa uma marca na grama (ou em algunscasos madeira/gelo, dependendo do campo que vc escolher), isso mostra que quando criaram o game pensaram em tudo.

-Sons?
Os sons sÃ£o bacanas porÃ©m poderiam ser melhores, de vez enquando acontece algum bug e o som simplesmente desaparece.

-ConsideraÃ§Ãµes finais
Vale a pena cada centavo gasto (comprei em promoÃ§Ã£o mas nao me arrependeria de pagar o preÃ§o original)
O jogo Ã© divertido, podendo ser jogado em atÃ© 10 players, Ã© um Ã³timo jogo para ser jogado com seus amigos. 
Ahh... para os fÃ£s de Fifa Street, o jogo parece de leve com ele, talvez pelo fato dos super poderes que vocÃª adquire aleatoriamente durante a partida.
Super recomendo, estÃ¡ entre meus top 3 jogos da steam.

Alguma crÃ­tica construtiva, dÃºvidas ou comentÃ¡rios? Deixe suas palavras aqui.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023441855', 'num_games_owned': 3610, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1499903836}
review:
In una galassia lontana Â©, prima che i vari FIFA e PES arrivassero a cannibalizzare il mercato e a lobotomizzare i giovani di mezzo mondo, i videogiochi di calcio si ritagliavano un seguito dedicato all'interno del grande calderone degli arcade da sala giochi, approdando in un secondo momento anche sulle maggiori console casalinghe. 

Kopanito All-Star Soccer Ã¨ sostanzialmente un omaggio ai vecchi soccer games di origine nipponica, ruspanti e genuini: in particolare non puÃ² passare inosservata la grande somiglianza con un titolo storico per Game Boy e NES, e cioÃ¨ l'indimenticato e per me indimenticabile NINTENDO World Cup di Technos (a.k.a. Nekketsu KÅkÅ Dodgeball Bu: Soccer Hen... starring Kunio-kun!).

Sulle prime, Kopanito potrebbe sembrare un gioco eccessivamente semplificato: effettivamente i controlli sono ridotti all'osso e prevedono passaggio raso-terra, pallonetto, tackle e tiro, lasciando poco spazio all'immaginazione e al genio calcistico. In realtÃ  a livelli di difficoltÃ  elevati il gioco acquista una profonditÃ  inaspettata, e la capacitÃ  di intercettare le traiettorie di passaggio, di giocare sul breve o ancora di effettuare rapidi cambi di gioco fanno spesso la differenza tra un successo e una sonora sconfitta. Badate bene, siamo ovviamente lontani anni luce dal realismo tecnico/tattico offerto delle serie citate in apertura, con i quali Ã¨ inutile fare paragoni. A rimarcare questo aspetto si aggiungono la totale assenza di sanzioni per le entrate da macellaio, oltre ai vari, improbabili power-up che potremo collezionare ed utilizzare nell'arco di un match: si va dal super-tiro in puro stile Holly & Benji fino al teletrasporto, dall'enorme ventola che respinge ogni tiro fino al magnete che ci permette di strappare la palla all'avversario senza nemmeno muoverci.

Lo stile grafico di Kopanito Ã¨ unico nel suo genere. I giocatori mostrano tratti somatici differenti a seconda del continente/nazione di provenienza, rendendo di fatto ogni singolo team unico e facilmente riconoscibile; pur non disponendo di alcun tipo di licenza e nonostante siano assenti i nomi dei calciatori, con un po' di attenzione Ã¨ possibile scovare tra le squadre piÃ¹ blasonate qualche giocatore reale (es. Zanetti ma soprattutto Messi nell'Argentina). Le uniformi si rifanno per quanto possibile all'aspetto delle casacche ufficiali delle varie federazioni, con colori sgargianti e sempre molto piacevoli; infine Ã¨ possibile scegliere la location della partita scorrendo tra un buon numero di stadi differenti, o addirittura cambiare l'aspetto del pallone da gioco.

Kopanito Ã¨ senza dubbio un gioco che non puÃ² mancare nella collezione di ogni retrogamer che si rispetti, perchÃ¨ incarna in maniera perfetta l'essenza dei soccer game classici, con un gameplay che riesce nell'impresa tutt'altro che banale di riproporre in chiave moderna l'inconfondibile fascino dell'approccio arcade old-style. Per una volta sono davvero dispiaciuto nel constatare che i server online siano praticamente semi-deserti: il multiplayer globale, con la possibilitÃ  di ospitare fino a 10 giocatori nella stessa partita (5v5), poteva essere il fiore all'occhiello di un gioco giÃ  di per se assolutamente apprezzabile per la componente single-player. 

Peccato!

[i][b]Se questa recensione ti Ã¨ piaciuta clicca "Segui" sulla [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/retrogamingcafe/curation]pagina del Curatore[/url] del mio gruppo: sarai sempre aggiornato con i miei personali consigli e le recensioni dei migliori titoli indie/retro/roguelite in circolazione![/b][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025833979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1498441603}
review:
El juego en si es muy bueno y no tengo muchas quejas, pero hay una cosa que si me molesta bastante: El hecho que la gran mayoria de los equipos nacionales estan bloqueados y que hay que jugar para desbloquerlos. Esto incluso puede tener un trasfondo cuasi-xenofobico, puesto que equipos de paises muy populares (como Mexico, Brasil, Argentina, etc) estan bloqueados y que te tengas que romper la cabeza para desbloquearlos, cuando hubiera tenido mas sentido tener como equipos ocultos a equipos ficticios o chistosos.

Cambiare mi opinion sobre el juego cuando los programadores cambien semejante ridiculez.

review:
Frustrating controls. Passing from the goalkeeper (short or long) makes no sense at all. almost impossible to perform a simple, accurate pass from goalkeeper to one of the players. Most of my game was just my goalkeeper failing do a short pass resulting in the opponent getting the ball and shooting. The goalkeeper catches the ball repeats the whole process. VERY VERY FRUSTRATING. 


Would recommend if this stupid mechanic was fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980692989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1499526196}
review:
Tryed this game for the first time with a friend.

We discovered there's no refree and there are no rules, we completely forgot about scoring goals and started playing the "break ankle game".
We discovered superpowers and air support.
We discovered that you can play a "reindeer vs santa" match.
We played more
I won

Cons: multiplayer is quite empty and netcode is crappy

author: {'steamid': '76561197978534278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1687897427}
review:
Fun and addictive at lower difficulties. Bit barebone...

Difficulty determines how much the game will either ignore your input or prolong the input so you don't only steal the ball with a sliding, but also kick it over the sideline, regardless of you releasing the key or not. Playing professional, it also tends to completely ignore your attempts to switch player to a specific player, or automatically switches you to the most useless player the moment you try to intercept, ignore the keys when you try to pass so you're almost always too late, and so it's near impossible to even defend... It feels like cheating in how REDICULOUSLY noticable this is.

Lightning powerup somehow only shoots players on the players side, regardless of who triggers it, so getting this powerup is hardly a good thing...

The teams are different in their tactics, which keeps the game interesting.

All in all, it's a fun game, but the way the difficulty affects the controls in addition to the speed, accuracy and skill of their players makes it very painful to even watch, and completely destroys the value for Professional. And since most achievements and unlocks rely on Professional, you only get to enjoy 2 3rds of the assets (shirts, ball, stadiums, etc).

author: {'steamid': '76561198037536195', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1589245168}
review:
This game is pretty awesome. I view it is a modern day Nintendo World Cup, except more fluid and faster pace and with optional super powers. If your looking for an arcade soccer/football game that's easy to pick up and play, look no further. This game is worth every penny spent, especially if it is on sale :)

Pros:

- Fairly easy to customize through local files
   - Can add teams/stadiums/balls without replacing existing items
- Controller support. It works well.
- Character design makes me smile
- Difficulty steps are consistent and fair
- Local multiplayer supports up to 5 players (full team of field players)

Cons:

- No in-game team customizer
- Not a big online community

author: {'steamid': '76561198107516348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1526600123}
review: Sin duda es el sucesor espiritual del "Sensible Soccer". Si jugaste a ese juego de los 90 este te va a ecantar. No tiene nada de serio, de hecho a parte de selecciones tiene equipos hechos por vampiros, muÃ±ecos de nieve, hombres calabazas, renos  y cosas asi. El juego es puro nervio y frenÃ©tico, no tiene penalties, ni fueras de juego y puedes hacer todas las entradas que quieras (salvo al portero). A diferencia del Sensible Soccer la  vista es lateral, y tiene diferentes botones, de pase largo, corto y tiro (el cual se ralentiza durante unos segundos para que elijas la direcciÃ³n) Tiene tambien un botÃ³n para "magias" las cuales van saliendo aleatoriamente segun la posesion de juego. En definitiva si quieres un juego para desconectar y echarte unos vicios rapidos, que incluso como te descuides pueden ser horas, este es tu juego. Con amigos no lo he probado pero online tiene que ser la risa. 100% Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982486331', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1701536193}
review:
I've only played a few matches but I already really enjoy this game.  5 player local co-op is awesome (up to 4 controllers + keyboard).

Easy to find a suitable difficulty level.  I'm only on Amateur as I've just started, but games are close.

The controls are pretty straight-forwards though you can get quite creative and skillful with only a few moves.  For example, passing the ball just ahead of yourself so you can sprint to it and slide off with it for a boost of speed.

Default game setting of a 6 minute match (3 minute halves) makes for intense amounts of fast-paced chaos, with options to shorten/extend as desired.

Super moves can make for some crazy and hilarious plays.

Goals can be quickly converted into GIFs with built-in GIF creator.  It breaks up the fast-paced intensity because it takes a few moments, but I really love it.

Got it on sale for $3.59.  Worth every penny and then some.

Definitely reminiscent of those NES World Cup days where eliminating the other team is an option.

Best part is everything is based on skill - no pre-determined animations.  Every shot, pass, slide, super-move and header is yours to control giving a high skill cap, making every goal that much more satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206571095', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1490581151}
review:
Very fun, Mario Super-Strikers-esque game with one glaring problem. The online is just nonfunctional, and there are never any players in the lobby.

If you have someone to play local co-op with or against, this game is a blast! You can slow down time and curve your shots, and there's lots of cool power-ups and such. Additionally, if you really like the single player, there's like an infinite amount of tournaments in the game, with increasing difficulty. 

No matter what you do though, probably wait till the game is on sale. $14 is a bit steep for what amounts to a pretty decent arcade-y soccer (football) game with a nonfunctional online.
7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198039463444', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1698948564}
review:
Troppo carino, troppo divertente e davvero rilassante.
Dimenticate le statistiche di Fifa e PES, dimenticate il realismo, il fuorigioco, i falli ed i cartellini.
Aggiungete colpi speciali, come il supertiro, la calamita, il satellite difensivo, il teletrasporto, e capirete la vera dimensione di questo piccolo gioiello indie.
Peccato che non ci sia nessuno a giocarlo online. Sarebbe uno sballo assoluto.

Me encanta los juegos deportivos arcade, no creo que necesiten mucho para ser juegos divertidosd. Pero a Kopanito le falta mucho contenido y mÃ¡s locura para destacar. No hay apenas power-ups y esta lleno de contenido vacÃ­o (todas las copas, mapas, equipos, meros skins tofos iguales). Me parece bien que los equipos no tengan diferencias para evitar el desbalanceo, pero mÃ¡s especiales o mapas con elementos dinÃ¡micos, asÃ­ como copas con mayor peso se echan mucho de menos. Y la ausencia de torneos con amigos en el modo online (sÃ³lo local) lo acaba de matar.

No todo es decepcionante: la fÃ³rmula es sencilla y rÃ¡pida, y el modo coop (aunque el control de los personajes sea un tanto impreciso) es curioso. Pero esperaba cansarme de Ã©l a la docena de horas, no en menos de una.  Se fija demasiado en los primeros arcades como en Nintendo World Cup y no en los sucesores espirituales como los Mario Strikers. OjalÃ¡ le vayan aÃ±adiendo contenido con el tiempo, pero a mÃ­ me ha dejado muy frÃ­o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030872772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1504719735}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel im Sale gekauft und spiele es mit einem XBox-360 Controler.
Die Steuerung ist ganz angenehm,wenn man im Ballbesitz ist.
Wenn man nicht im Ballbesitz ist,finde Ich das genaue MÃ¤nÃ¶vrieren mit dem Analogstick etwas schwierig und zudem habe Ich hÃ¤ufig das BedÃ¼rfnis,jemand entgegenlaufenden manuell zu aktivieren,als wie jemanden zu steuern,der automatisch aktiviert wurde und hinterher rennen muÃŸ..dagegen steht,das man ohne Ball mit einer Zusatztaste schneller rennen kann,man schnell und weit grÃ¤tschen kann und die Spezial-Moves benutzen kann,die einem wÃ¤hrend des Spiel zugespielt werden.Mit letzteren habe Ich mich noch nicht beschÃ¤ftigt..zmindest noch nicht so,das Ich weiÃŸ,was Ich da tue.
DafÃ¼r geht mir nach ca 90 min die Steuerung ganz gut von der Hand..anfangs noch meinen Erfolg beim Tore schieÃŸen mit frÃ¼hen undkurzen drÃ¼cken der TorschuÃŸtaste gesucht,darf es jetzt auch langes drÃ¼cken und Visierlinie einstellen sein,beim auf's Tor schieÃŸen.
Sich selbst den Ball vorlegen und den Moment zum schneller rennen benutzen.
Den Online Modus habe Ich nicht ausprobiert und gegen einen Freund habe Ich auch noch nicht gespielt..aber Ich glaube,das kÃ¶nnte ganz spaÃŸig werden.
Mal kann man auf dem Platz den Ball in das Seitenaus befÃ¶rdern und manchmal gibt es WÃ¤nde an der Seitenlinie,welche die Sicht nicht beeintrÃ¤chtigen,sondern nur dafÃ¼r sorgen,daÃŸ der Ball nicht in's Seitenaus gespielt werden kann.Farblich sind einige PlÃ¤tze etwas gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig,aber im Grunde kann Ich bis jetzt gut mit ihnen leben.
FÃ¼r ungefÃ¤hr 3,74 Euro finde Ich das Spiel zum gelegentlichen kicken ganz unterhaltsam...nach kurzer EingewÃ¶hnungsphase..von daher gebe Ich eine Empfehlung.
Im Prinzip kann sich ja jeder auf youtube ein Viedeo anschauen und dann weiÃŸ man,worauf man sich einlÃ¤ÃŸt.
Nach etwas mehr als 3 Stunden Spielzeit,habe Ich mich nun beim gedrÃ¼ckt halten der TorschuÃŸtaste und dem einstellen der Linie im slow motion modus,an das gleichzeitige benutzen einer der hinteren oberen Schultertasten gewÃ¶hnt..das macht natÃ¼rlich noch mehr SpaÃŸ..BananenschuÃŸ Ole.
Wenn man Ã¼ber die Flanke spielt und einen hohen Ball zur Mitte spielen mÃ¶chte,muss man den Spieler schon deutlich in die Richtung gedreht haben,damit der Ball auch in die richtige Richtung geht,was im Gegensatz zu anderen FuÃŸballspielen vieleicht anfangs etwas EingewÃ¶hnung braucht.Dann kann man aber mit X am Controler und je nachdem,wie lange man die Taste gedrÃ¼ckt hÃ¤lt,unterschiedlich weite PÃ¤sse schlagen.Mit der TorschuÃŸtaste B kann man schon vor  der Ballannahme dem EmpfÃ¤nger klar machen,das er beim Ersten Kontakt sofort auf das Tor halten soll..dann kommt es auch mal zum Hechtsprungkopfballtor.
Man kann also auf vielfÃ¤ltige Weise Tore schieÃŸen..manchmal denkt man vieleicht..Mist,schon wieder zuviel geschnibbelt,auf der anderen Seite war es mir bevor Ich schnibbeln/BananenschuÃŸ zu benutzen gelernt habe und das mit dem Flanken,in der Mechanik nach einiger Zeit,fast zu eintÃ¶nig.
Man kann das Spiel nicht so richtig mit zB Sensible Soccer vergleichen..mit Ball am FuÃŸ ist es hier einfacher und vor demTor fÃ¼hren Lattenabpraller oder Pfostenabpraller meistens nicht zu einer weiteren Chance..abstauber sind trotzdem gut mÃ¶glich und Ich muss sagen,so scharf bin Ich auf ein Sensible Soccer jetzt gar nicht mehr...wer hÃ¤tte das gedacht !
Wenn Ich das Spiel beende,geht an meinem XBox360 Controler das grÃ¼ne LÃ¤mpchen aus.Da Ich keine BeeintrÃ¤chtigung beim automatischen wieder aktivieren habe,finde Ich diese StromsparmaÃŸnahme vorbildlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047053023', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1531947541}
review:
I really want to like this game, and, in a way I do. I paid 3 GBP for this and after spending less than an hour playing, I already have some strong opinions about how this game needs to be improved.

Asthetically, everything holds up. The art style is consistent througout and sound effects are clean and punchy. The problem unfortunately comes from gameplay.

My first and most prominent gripe is the dribbling system, or lack thereof. Slide tackling gets old pretty fast as you get pummled from every angle and with no penalty to the opposing team. It feels impossible to manouver anywhere in which an opposing player is standing due to the risk of getting tackled by a 10 yard slide. Getting rid of the ball ASAP seems to be the name of the game.

In a previous match, a challenge encouraged me to tackle 10 players without sliding (blocking tackle). I managed to do so but immediately after completing the challenge, I went right back to using sliding as my sole means of performing a tackle. There's little argument to justify using a blocking tackle.

Power ups are pretty cool but theres only 6 and they seem pretty unbalanced. A rather infuriating one is an electrocuting drone which lasts much longer than any other power up.

The challenges add some needed variety to the game although they can go from being mildly challenging to feeling down right impossible. You can collect stars and coins but the menu options and guide don't provide any direction as to what they mean or if they can even be used.

I've complained enough so let me reassure you that there are some good points to this game. Shooting feels robust and the abilitiy to switch between manual and auto passing on the fly is great. There's plenty to like about this game but the minor annoyances mentioned above are likely to put you off playing this one often.

If you have a few controllers and like to play with friends, or maybe you're looking for a cheap and causal game to play, breaking your usual FPS routine, this might be the one for you. Just make sure you don't pay too much for it as you'll likely get bored rather quickly.

Message to devs:
This game is so close to being really well polished. Keep working on it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048161890', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1545776974}
review:
This is one game where I wish Steam didn't have a binary rating system. But it's enjoyable enough as it is. 

PROS:
Good AI System
Tons of Teams/balls/fields to choose from

Cons:
Game freezes if you pause it when the final whistle blows
Powerups are too sparse to feel relevant
No in-game music. Just grunts of players and the cheer of the crowd.

This game has a lot of potential and most of my gripes with it are minimal so I still give it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010231912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1137, 'last_played': 1513647105}
review:
Update:
The K.I. of your team and the enemy team is actively betraying you on Legend difficulty.
-> passing cross top/bottom when another player is in the middle always evolves to a mid pass- where two enemys are (obviously)
-> enemy K.I. gets ridiculously often the super shot
-> the switching problem is often a free goal for the enemy team
-> when the ball is kicked out of the field by the enemy (fieldplayer/ goalkeeper) and an other enemy player goes for it it doesn't count as out of the field
-> you hit the crossbar/ or the keeper gets the ball like nearly every time while your keeper seems to eat glue in his spare time
-> the enemy k.i. still reacts before the animation of your player begins
-> enemy players only need to be near your players to get the ball while you can run into the ememy and he has still the ball

I hoped  this game would change for good but it really doesn't.
I hope I get at least 67% of the achievements soon so I can finally abandon it....

_________________________
Only good as a coop game.

The autoselection sucks
Your keeper often doesn't catch the ball when it's facing him directly (no close combat)
Throw ins and corner balls are a shot to your own knees
The enemy definitely knows what you are doing before the character starts changing direction
Own keeper is often clued to his line even if you press "q"
Sometimes they move double with one buttonpress sometime they don't react
You can't blow out the enemy hardshot - the enemy can do it
Passing back to the Midfielder often goes straight to the defense (Keyboard)
Pressing S when the enemy has the ball often doesn't switch to the nearby player of yours
When you try to outpass the enemy with you attack and midfield they stick together like clue after the third pass...
Enemy Flash hits closesd target in the radius- you flash the furthust

Sorry but this game sucks really hard as a singleplayer game. Srsly Fuck It...

review:
Simple and fun. You will get a lot of fun playing with your friends, guaranteed. The down side: so far this game is not popular, while it has online matchmaking, I never found any one to play with.


Some little bugs in the online gaming (tried with friends) and problems with my PS4 controller, it works, but sometimes is not recognized or if I disconnect it while I'm playing, I need to restart the game, because the controller and the keyboard doesn't respond.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1456, 'last_played': 1592346002}
review:
Voi non lo sapete, ma la redazione dello Shelter segue Kopanito All-Stars Soccer dalla sua prima comparsa in early access di questa estate. La premessa era semplicemente perfetta: nessun arbitro, nessuna squadra composta da campioni o con valori da controllare, nessuna lega e nessuna differenza tra le squadreâ€¦ un gioco di calcio interamente basato sulle reali capacitÃ  del giocatore. Ai miei occhi (e non solo), Kopanito Ã¨ apparso subito come il sacro messia, la svolta, quel titolo che, infischiandosene dei nomi o delle marche, metteva sul campo ciÃ² che ha sempre contraddistinto il campione dal semplice amatore medio di calcio: il talento. E non Ã¨ un caso che, imparate le dovute basi, mi sia subito trovato a mio agio su un campo con tante sorprese in serbo.

Come ogni squadra che si rispetti, perÃ², Kopanito e i polacchi di Merixgames hanno avuto momenti di splendore e altri di sofferenza dallâ€™uscita anticipata fino alla pubblicazione, alternando stadi di euforia a sonore bestemmie. Il fulcro del gioco non Ã¨ mai stato toccato: un 5vs5 (piÃ¹ portiere) a tutto campo dove ogni scorrettezza Ã¨ permessa. Non esistono falli e non câ€™Ã¨ limite di scivolate o corse sulla fascia che potrete compiere, non esiste alcun metro di fatica, nÃ© limite se non il campo stesso (esclusione fatta per il divertentissimo campo indoor). Ma come ogni titolo indipendente, Kopanito ha dovuto scontrarsi da subito con quello che Ã¨ da sempre il piÃ¹ grande problema di questo tipo di giochi: la modalitÃ  online. Certo, lâ€™IA non Ã¨ certo delle piÃ¹ clementi, soprattutto sbloccati i livelli piÃ¹ avanzati, ma la possibilitÃ  di sfidarsi con degli amici ha da sempre spinto il gioco fin dagli inizi dellâ€™early access. Anche perchÃ©, in fondo, di contenuti non ne sono stati aggiunti da inizio 2016 ad oggi, avendo giÃ  quasi tutte le coppe e i campionati disponibili, le nazionali pronte per essere sbloccate vincendo le varie competizioni e le super mosse a disposizione durante le partite.

Queste in particolare non sono mai state particolarmente squilibrate: segnando o effettuando giocate coreografiche, faremo riempire un barra che, una volta piena, ci offrirÃ  casualmente uno tra un super tiro, una mega ventola dietro la nostra che respinge palla e avversario, il teletrasporto (utilizzato per la tecnica chiamata la â€œKelvanataâ€), unâ€™aura congelante e un magnete per recuperare la palla persa. Delle soluzioni molto carine che, combinate con lâ€™idea di un calcio spettacolare senza freni, pur rendendo il titolo piÃ¹ piccante, non risultavano mai fastidiose o tali da cambiare le sorti di una partita. Anche perchÃ©, durante lâ€™early access, a Kopanito uno scontro non Ã¨ mai terminato con meno di 10 gol, mantenendo un gameplay sempre molto dinamico per non dar mai la sensazione di essere troppo forti o troppo deboli. Anzi, sarÃ  proprio lo scarto di gol che farÃ  aumentare o diminuire la difficoltÃ  dellâ€™intelligenza artificiale, a partire dal livello scelto. Per di piÃ¹, mentre i ragazzi di Merixgames continuavano a produrre fix e bilanciamenti aggiuntivi, cercando di implementare una modalitÃ  multigiocatore online che un giorno funzionava e quello dopo (3 MB di update) faceva crashare tutto, la formula di gioco ha via via subito delle intelligentissime modifiche atte a rendere il tutto ancora piÃ¹ divertente: i passaggi manuali, ad esempio, in cui noi stessi dobbiamo rincorrere la palla o cercare di passare la sfera nella maniera piÃ¹ precisa possibile; o ancora i colpi acrobatici dopo un cross che, se effettuati in area, potevano letteralmente spiazzare ogni portiere (tecnica definita anche come la â€œMaglionataâ€). Non aveva alcuna importanza lâ€™idea di poter compiere delle giocate squilibrate, perchÃ© tanto erano a disposizioni di tutti e lâ€™unico limite era, appunto, il talento del singolo partecipante, la bravura nel saper sfruttare al meglio le proprie abilitÃ  calcistiche per dribblare e sparare in porta una cannonata, magari sfruttando lâ€™effetto e creando una parabola imprendibile.

Risultato primo tempo: Kopanito 5â€“0 Aspettative Infrante

Ma poi tutto Ã¨ cambiato: Merixgames ha deciso che Kopanito era pronto e lâ€™ha fatto uscire ufficialmente su Steam qualche settimana fa. Se ad agosto era ancora possibile compiere partite online con un leggerissimo lag, il giorno stesso di uscita non era possibile nemmeno di cambiare squadra, producendo errori sconosciuti e rendendo impossibile qualsiasi azione se non la chiusura forzata. Per fortuna, adesso Ã¨ possibile sfidarsi in un 1vs1 in maniera semplice e senza lag, ma lâ€™idea delle partite 5vs5 rimane ancora un sogno. Ma non Ã¨ tanto questo il problema, ma il fatto che, come un pessimo allenatore, gli sviluppatori polacchi abbiano deciso di cambiare totalmente assetto alla propria formazione. Il processo di â€œbilanciamentoâ€ ha infatti snaturato e violentato il nucleo che era alla base delle tante e forse troppe ore passate a tentare di giocare in compagnia: la spensieratezza. LÃ¬ dove regnavano le risate per le folli corse schivando scivolate, o gli intercettamenti al volo un secondo prima del tiro, dopo lâ€™uscita si Ã¨ deciso di eliminare tutto in favore di passaggi automatici, lâ€™eliminazione delle rovesciate su ogni cross e la risultante costrizione nel non poter muovere liberamente i propri personaggi una volta effettuato un cross: questi seguiranno pedissequamente le palla, eliminando ogni possibile acrobazia presente prima dellâ€™uscita. Se quindi prima lâ€™idea di gioco era lâ€™equivalente metaforico di un campione che supera un centrocampista lanciando la palla a destra e superandolo a sinistra, finta un difensore e fa un tunnel al secondo per poi dribblare e lasciare sul posto il portiere segnando di tacco con un doppio carpiato, adesso Kopanito si Ã¨ trasformato in un legnoso omino del calcio a molla in cui la palla segue una semplice direzione e la fantasia Ã¨ ridotta al semplice tiro ad effetto. Una scelta che nello Shelter reputiamo allâ€™unanimitÃ  come la morte del divertimento e soprattutto la perdita di qualsiasi caratterizzazione che ci ha spinto a comprare (e consigliare con forza) Kopanito in questi mesi. A questo si aggiungono anche alcune scelte piÃ¹ o meno rilevanti, come lâ€™aver modificato il tempo di pressione dei pulsanti richiesto per far compiere un tiro o un passaggio, la scelta grafica delle strisce lasciate sul campo dopo ogni scivolata, o lâ€™aver reso meno avvincenti i calci piazzati (falli laterali e angoli) con delle traiettorie esatte.

Insomma, se durante il suo stadio di sviluppo Kopanito All-Stars Soccer era a tutti gli effetti uno dei migliori titoli sportivi dellâ€™anno, adesso non vediamo piÃ¹ tanta differenza con un gioco di calcio qualsiasi. Ai ragazzi di Merixgames faremo sicuramente un commento dettagliato, perchÃ© Ã¨ davvero incredibile come non solo siano state distrutte tutte le aspettative verso quello che doveva essere la rappresentazione calcistica della locura, ma che tali scelte siano state prese nonostante il continuo feedback della community che ha alimentato e aiutato il team di sviluppo fino ad oggi. 

Risultato finale Kopanito 5â€“9 Aspettative Infrante

***Aggiornamento 26/03/2017***: incredibile ma vero, da oggi Kopanito torna a includere il passaggio manuale, aggiungendo anche altre tre modalitÃ  per gestire il lancio della palla. Che dire, una scelta che per fortuna ristabilizza tutto ciÃ² che ci aveva fatto odiare del gameplay, rincarando la dose con un multiplayer ancora piÃ¹ ottimizzato e giocabile. In questo modo ci sentiamo di consigliare di cuore questo piccolo gioiellino che vi farÃ  provare le stesse gioie e dolori che il Fantashelter sta causando a tutto lo staff!

review: This is one of those fun sports games that's easy to pick up and play casually with enough complexity to keep you coming back. The AI offers as much competition as you can handle, which is good because I have yet to find an online game. Hopefully this game can build a bigger community, as I would enjoy being able to compete against a human opponent.

review: Kopanito is a miniature football game much like fifa 16 and the best thing about it is that there are no free kicks or penalties. The gameplay is realistic and a lot like more expensive football games while the graphics are not much worse. Would reccomend 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960399224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1589845613}
review:
The game itself is great and a lot of fun.  I think this is one of the most frustrating menu systems I've seen.  I wish you could permanently disable certain controllers in the settings.  As it is, since I have a keyboard / mouse, gamepad, and X52 flight stick I need to go to the main menu and disable the flight stick and keyboard otherwise every match I play it will create 3 players for me.  No problem, disable it in the game lobby you say?  No, if you forget to manually disable a controller you join your match with multiple players, have to quit out, disable controllers again, get another invite.. etc...  It's you're playing with 4+ people watch all of them have to do this once or twice.

Were you in the game and hit Shift+Tab for Steam overlay?  Woops, now your keyboard is active again and you have to quit out, go back to the main menu, disable the controller, and get reinvited to your game.

If they can fix this it's a must buy.  If they don't I still recommend the game as it's fun and skill-based, similar to rocket league.

review: I will not recommend this game due to buying this for the online feature in the first place. I have written about it and got no reply! The online / private match has issues from the client side. You create a game and play the game with a friend on the other side, your friend commands come with a delay to your game host side. So it make the game unfair to play for your friend. And NO, it is not an lag issue because I tried swapping between Super Arcade football and this game to compare and Super Arcade Football had zero lag, the issue is in KopanitoÂ´s programming code. I will not change this review until I see the fix. VERY Disappointed...

author: {'steamid': '76561197997045080', 'num_games_owned': 2087, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1552815370}
review:
Kopanito is a fast paced arcade football game where standard football rules do not apply. On a match level the games are 5v5 with no referee, no offsides, no fouls and crazy mechanics. Tackles are brutal but harmless. There's next to no dribbling and occasional power-ups spice up the games. And above all it's simply fun to play.

The controls feel simple but in fact provide quite a few possibilities. On a basic level you've got shoot and pass buttons. But holding them longer results in a long pass, or a more powerful shot. Additionally when near the opponents goal charging the shot slows time and you're able to bend the shot. The amount of power charged defines as well how high the ball goes. This can result in quite spectacular goals. If you combine this with the cross ins and spectacular kick flip goals - well enough to say that the goals are really satisfying and fun to watch. 

Addition of power ups adds another layer to the game strategy and the fact that they're not abundant and you get just 2 or 3 per game makes them a good addition. 

Graphics are cartoon like with a distinct style. Really nice looking and fitting the game perfectly.

The only complaints I have with this one is that it gets boring playing by yourself. There's a lot to unlock - teams and arenas, but they don't add anything to the game really. The teams are always of same skill level - and same as arenas are only decoration. The multiplayer while being there at the time of me playing had around 10 players at the same time and all games I was able to play online were laggy to the point of not being fun.

I can see this game being fun playing with your friends locally with a beer or during a party. But as a single player experience - I clocked in 8 hours in it and have no desire to play it any longer. Even the hardest difficulty while challenging at first can be mastered and there is little challenge after that. 

Still a fun game worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982545223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1492204709}
review:
Good potential, a few key flaws.
The auto-steal mechanics (you only need to touch the player with the ball in order to steal it) is messy.
When the goalkeeper throws the ball, it very rarely ends up with any of his teammates. That sucks (and even the AI suffers with this)

It seems the developers were greately inspired by Mario Strikers, but didn't copy the right gameplay tricks.
Unless they fix these issues, not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975299795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1486329189}
review: Yeeeeeeeeah! Get this one. It's like the old Virtua Striker or Actua Soccer, but on steroids. It's also very skillbased gameplay, which makes this a very addictive experience, combined with the usual soccer fun. It has very few flaws if any. Power-ups are crazy, but also very rewarding. It also has plenty of additional achievements to get during any random match, which is good. It's a suprisingly easy to control game, but difficult to master. Oh and yes you can friendly-fire your own, whether through a shot or sliding. It's currently on a discount which should seriously make this an insta-buy for the money. Good online fun as well, which should be no surprise. Art style is good. It's perhaps not super detailed and such, but it has it's own style and it's fun to watch. I haven't been as excited about a soccer game since the Fifa series essentially dropped most of the skillbased control and added a lot of semi-automatic nonsense. Not the case with this game, you'll feel in control. And team AI is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198247088182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1531434831}
review:
Tons of fun for a small game like this. Recommended.

Pros:
- Excellent gameplay and very fun to play with friends
- Has the feel of an older game called GOAL.
- Funny teams + large number of national teams
- No rules
- Special powers

Cons:
- Online multiplayer is restricted to friendly games (co-op and vs)
- Choosing side in online multiplayer is automatic and not avaliable to user
- If you want to join online game (via steam) you cannot play just with joypad, there is also a keyboard added (maybe there is a solution for all of this but I didn't find it).

Other than some minor flaws, game is light and fun. Adding tournament mode for online multiplayer would be excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984776410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1485473391}
review:
I was actually just going to try the game and then probably get a refund (sorry Gabe) 'cause it looked interesting but I didn't think it would be a lot of fun in the longer run. 
Well...wtf happened? I guess it must be kinda good :D
I am hoping to get some friends together to play some matches so I can rub the GIFs  of some sweet goals in their faces, afterwards. =)
Point is: It's a nice and fun little soccer game. Especially when it's on sale (I don't think that I would recommend it for the full price).

author: {'steamid': '76561198003989601', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1502591695}
review:
wer kennt es noch - SuperSoccer auf der NES - es ist eine super Kopie davon, die genau so lustig zu spielen ist. Es gibt keine Fouls (gepfiffen wird nichts) man kann also schÃ¶n um den Ball kÃ¤mpfen und hat viele MÃ¶glichkeiten den Ball ins tor zu bekommen.

Was mich stÃ¶rt ist, das ich die AUFLÃ–SUNG NICHT UMSTELLEN kann... es ist schlicht nicht mÃ¶glich... Die AuflÃ¶sung hÃ¤ngt mit der nativen von Windwos zusammen, in meinem Fall 4K und das spiel lÃ¤sst sich nicht runter regeln auf 1920x1080 - was mir enorm helfen wÃ¼rde, da ich nicht die beste GRAKA habe und somit das spiel nicht ganz so flÃ¼ssig lÃ¤uft, wie es sein sollte.... 

Bis auf den Kritikpunkt mit der AuflÃ¶sung, gibt es natÃ¼rlich das Problem, dass das Game online so gut wie keiner zockt und es somit auf einen "Local-Multiplayer" beschrÃ¤nkt ist... Es wÃ¼rde aber gehen, nur leider findet man niemanden... Ist jetzt nicht unbedingt das problem des spieles selbst....

Ich wÃ¼rde es sofort wieder kaufen, denn zuhause mit freunden ist es der totale spaÃŸ :)
ich spiele selbst kein FIFA oder Ã¤hnliches  -  es ist das (fast) perfekte fun-football-game ;)

review:
Muy pero que muy entretenido, si estÃ¡s hasta la mismÃ­sima po*** de fifa, pro evolution y toda esa basura, este es tu juego. Es barato, facil de aprender (pero dificil de dominar) y permite partidos online de 5vs5, sin handicap, sin jugadores rotos, aqui solo vale tu habilidad.
Pros:
-Divertido y ameno
-Tiene 9 estadios, incluÃ­do uno de fÃºtbol sala en el que hay un muro que evita las fueras (como si fuera hockey) y una version de hielo del estadio de fÃºtbol sala (sin nada especial), ademÃ¡s cuenta con 25 balones distintos.
-Gana el que mÃ¡s skill tenga (o al que menos le cante el portero, porque vaya tela)
-Jugabilidad mucho mÃ¡s profunda de lo que parece, tiros de calidad, pases al hueco, balones aÃ©reos, fueras y saques de esquina, etc.)
-No hay Ã¡rbitro, puedes partir todas las piernas que quieras. Tampoco hay lesiones.
-Multiples torneos
-Muchos equipos distintos (selecciones y algunos de evento como zombies, renos, duendes de navidad etc.)
Cons:
-Se echa en falta un editor de equipos y equipaciones, espero que en un futuro lo implementen.
-Problemas con el mando de xbox one, no lo reconoce como jugador 1 y hay que desactivarlo y jugar como jugador 2, ya que el jugador 1 siempre es teclado y ratÃ³n.
-Se echa en falta poder hacer torneos online con los amigos.
-No estÃ¡ en espaÃ±ol (no es ningÃºn problema, ya que el texto es mÃ­nimo, pero puestos a pedir)
-La overlay de steam durante el juego no funciona en linux a dÃ­a 03/01/2017.

review:
I'm probably just gonna repeat what others have already said, but this game is a real gem, a fantastic tribute to the likes of Microprose Soccer (those "banana" shots!), Kick-Off and Sensible Soccer (not to mention some of the '90s side-scrolling football games at the arcades). Yeah, it's not FIFA or PES...but IMO it's actually better than both when it comes to the pure "fun" factor. 
Hopefully, it will attract more and more people to the online scene as well. DEFINITELY recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074722438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483731863}
review:
Really good game, and they're not lying about it being skill based. See this gif of a goal I scored, partly by accident - its what made me realise this game allows for some serious skill to be developed:

http://puu.sh/t13Ox/d066abd8b3.gif

I've been trying to replicate that goal ever since. You can further develop skills as well - even the AI will tend to pass the ball into space and then sprint onto it, but I kept finding that when I tried doing that against professional (i.e. hard) AI they could still slide into where you put the ball, so I started turning around quickly soon after picking up the ball again after sprinting onto it and it often means I evade their slide tackle attempt and I'm gifted a glorious chance on goal. Speaking of which, scoring is an absolute delight in this game, as it should be in any football game, especially when you get just the right amount of curve on the ball that it beats the keeper. I wish airshots were a bit more complex - its nothing more than just holding down the shoot button, but then again it does require some skill with lobbing and corners before you get a prime opportunity to airshot the ball into the net.

Gameplay is VERY fast on higher difficulty, the ball will travel a lot an utmost attention is required to keep up. The game certainly provides ample challenge for players and, as mentioned, the AI will start to show off their skill too (which I didn't expect, the hard AI in Rocket League is terrible, so I had lower standards for the AI in Kopanito).

My only issues are: no custom-made teams, the online play doesn't seem to be working (although you can still play against people on your Steam friends list, which is enough for me), there's no in-game chat, the keyboard sometimes adds itself as another player, and your friend can't personally choose their own team. Also I wish the crowds were animated (it's like playing at the Emirates Stadium) and that there were people on the subs bench - minor details that would add some nice touches. Being able to choose what colour Player 1, 2, 3, etc, is would also be really helpful - I played locally with a friend on the same team and I had pink and he had red so it was a bit confusing.

Overall I definitely recommend this game, I was already happy with my purchase only a few hours in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966913375', 'num_games_owned': 1010, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1486252533}
review:
The game features online play and a host of offline modes for cooperative and competitive play: friendlies, custom tournaments, regional cups, and full-season leagues. A typical control scheme supports passes, shots, and slide tackles; shots can be manually shaped. As an arcade sports title, games have a fast pace, with powerful slide tackles the primary means to catch up and steal the ball. In addition, randomized super moves (a ball magnet, teleportation, super shot, and wind-driven goal defense) increase scoring. The AI opponents play well at a range of difficulty settings, though friendly players donâ€™t push up the field enough (making cooperative play much more desirable). Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is an enjoyable, accessible arcade sports title.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FftNEPkWadQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198024469649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1534083239}
review:
I was looking for a relaxing game I could play to have fun.

Well, I found it in All Star Soccer.
It reminds me of my early Amiga Sensible Soccer in its friendly gameplay, with a modern cartoonish design both in graphics and gameplay.


There are lots of frustrating things though.

- the game has no fouls so it's a tackle party where no one ever gets injured, no goalies etc.
- the controls are a bit too fidgety for my taste
- the player switching is ok but not very bright and gets frustrating sometimes
- the slowdown after a kick is painfully too slow to the point of frustrating
- the game has some power ups but not quite enough.

Overall a fun game which really much lacks ambition (more powers, better controls, no team management whatsoever).

author: {'steamid': '76561197977732340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1662571295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138345485', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1503078891}
review:
This game is cheap and fun! Kudos to the devs who had such a brilliant idea!

Pros:
-No demanding system requirements
-Ability to play short/long games offline(local player with friends) or online as well and many tournaments and cups
-Intuitive and not hard to learn (but it is tricky to master all the game mechanics, which in my opinion is good)
-No referee/penalties/stamina/injuries/team tactics etc.
-Less bugs than FIFA
-Cheaper than FIFA
-Better than FIFA

Cons:
- Large room for improvement in the online multiplayer

This game should be well known in all the world because I got tired of FIFA and PES that every year change some players in the teams, polish a bit the mechanics and then sell the game for the same price of the previous year.
Devs u deserve a CAKE!
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198141777568', 'num_games_owned': 5248, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1480265366}
review:
[h1]Review powered by [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/mamilosclub]Mamilos Club Group.[/url][/h1]

O futebol sempre foi uma grande parte da minha vida, a parte que eu sempre ficava vendo meus amigos jogarem, seja no campo de futebol e tambÃ©m no mundo dos games. Meu primeiro jogo de futebol foi realmente "FIFA 95" para o Mega Drive III, eu nÃ£o era tÃ£o ruim nele. De qualquer forma, para ser um bom jogador de futebol, requer treinamento e isso inclui os videogames.

Jogar [i]Kopanito All-Stars Soccer[/i] me deixou bastante feliz, principalmente por conseguir meter uma bicuda na bola e derrubar o jogador do time adversÃ¡rio. AlÃ©m disso, os grÃ¡ficos do jogo parecem desenhos animados e os jogadores parecem que tem hidrocefalia, alÃ©m de nÃ£o parecerem humanos. Essa junÃ§Ã£o de caracterÃ­sticas deixa o jogo divertido.

Esse Ã© um jogo de futebol que permite o time obter, regalias ou poderes.... nÃ£o sei bem como chamar isso. Mas estava eu, atravessando o meio de campo, quando toco a bola pro meu atacante chutar ao gol e me deparo com um [strike]puta[/strike] ventilador atrÃ¡s do gol, meu super chute nÃ£o conseguiu nem atingir a pequena Ã¡rea... outra vez foi quando o time adversÃ¡rio utilizou um poder de imÃ£ e roubou a bola debaixo dos meus olhos, ou melhor, dos meus pÃ©s. HÃ¡ muito mais desses poderes misticos!


PrÃ³s:
+ Toneladas de realizaÃ§Ãµes e modos de jogo
+ DiversÃ£o para jogar online e offline
+ Os super-movimentos loucos
+ Trading Cards
+ Steam Achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198070549140', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 5299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4323, 'last_played': 1508561402}
review: Kopanito is another pretty funny game without players. But that's not the fault of the game. Playing Kopanito is entertaining and challenging even in single player mode. But I assume Kopanito was intended to be developed as a stunning multiplayer experience. And that's the problem, cause there are way too few players and therefore it's hard to make online-matches. Anyway, despite the stupid teammate-AI and some minor bugs, which occured while the game was in EA, you will become a well designed, well balanced and easy to learn, difficult to master experience. It's really worth a try and I wish the game would become the attention it deserves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041167170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1611382756}
review: I'm not a huge fan of Sports games and the less realist they are the better for me. Excellent game for a night of local multiplayer with your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060865977', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1480299240}
review:
If you are playing this game by yourself or with friends live it is great. Alot of fun and I could see myself playing it for hours.
However, If you intend on playing this game online, DO NOT BUY because it is impossible to play with friends do to input delays.

Would not recommend if you want to play online.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993629552', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1480299230}
review:
This game is completely unplayable online due to terrible input lag if you don't host.

Not bad single player but do not buy this is you want to play online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331924803', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1602391162}
review:
Awesome and fun game. Takes a few games to really get into it and to see the depth of it and how much skill it can take to play it. Tons of offline gaming content such as tournaments etc. Just wish there were more people playing the online multiplayer. I've come across a few bugs already, but nothing that completely messed the game up. Definitely well worth the money and you can spend hours playing this.

*UPDATE: After writing this review and playing countless more hours, i haven't come across any bugs after their new update. Game works sock solid. I love this game and play it for a little bit almost evry day. Definitely get it. It's a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061095129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 3686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2822, 'last_played': 1625514278}
review: Dritti al punto: ad oggi, [b]Kopanito Ã¨ il miglior gioco di calcio in vendita su Steam[/b]. Veloce, violento, illogico e con un'i.a. dalla forza proibitiva Kopanito Ã¨ un serio tributo ai videogiochi di calcio di una volta. Un titolo fortemente ispirato ad arcade gloriosi come Super Sidekicks, Nintendo World Cup e Microprose Soccer, offre una sfida notevolissima: calcio arcade duro e puro, senza falli e fronzoli tattici 6 vs 6, in cui la curva di apprendimento Ã¨ ripida, ma la scalata alla vetta non Ã¨ quasi mai frustrante (almeno nelle prime 10 ore di gioco, quelle necessarie per sbloccare un numero decente di squadre e competizioni). In men che non si dica troverete soddisfazione nel vincere il mondiale con Vanuatu, o nel tentare le imprese piÃ¹ assurde per sbloccare altri elementi o nel segnare gol di tacco in rovesciata nella coppa indoor. In parole povere poche mosse, dribbling infiniti, palle lunghissime, per poi appostarsi al limite dell'area o sulla trequarti e far partire tiro violentissimo da â€œswervareâ€ al massimo coi tasti dorsali RB e LB del pad Xbox 360. La fase di tiro Ã¨ il momento topico del gioco: appena premerete il tasto X il gioco entrerÃ  in un bullet time che farÃ  rallentare l'azione in corso fino al rilascio del tasto. In questo tempo potrete mirare alla porta con una specie di puntatore che vi permette di scegliere l'angolino piÃ¹ preciso in cui scodellare il pallone con una legnata, ma attenti, dovrete essere veloci: basta prolungare la pressione per piÃ¹ di tre secondi e la vostra sassata finirÃ  invariabilmente sulla traversa, provocando gragnuolate di bestemmie specialmente alle difficoltÃ  piÃ¹ alte. Giocare bene, vincere contrasti e segnare farÃ  riempire la barra a lato della HUD, che porterÃ  all'attivazione di un power-up da usare nei momenti piÃ¹ infami per sbilanciare la partita a nostro favore. Il titolo ha perso un po' dell'immediatezza primigenia con l'introduzione dei passaggi manuali: ho dovuto rigiocarlo un po' prima di prendere perfettamente il controllo di questa nuova feature che lo rende meno "semplice" e piÃ¹ profondo, ma alla fine si Ã¨ trattato di una novitÃ  piacevole, che consente di dare varietÃ  e creativitÃ  al gioco in campo. Tuttavia Kopanito non Ã¨ esente da difetti: l'online Ã¨ semideserto e malfunzionante, la localizzazione Ã¨ molto mediocre, l'i.a. alle difficoltÃ  piÃ¹ alte Ã¨ piuttosto scorretta e spesso si ha l'impressione che un certo script aleggi sul gameplay (certe partite sembrano impossibili da vincere per quanto uno si sforzi anche a suon di bestemmie). Inoltre sarebbe bello avere delle opzioni tattiche, per gestire meglio il risultato senza perdere la connotazione fortissimamente arcade del titolo e per leggere meglio gli incontri piÃ¹ complicati: l'ideale sarebbe un comando per cambiare l'atteggiamento del centrocampo a seconda delle nostre necessitÃ , un po' come accade in FootLOL. Al di lÃ  di ciÃ², giÃ  cosÃ¬ Kopanito Ã¨ un must per gli appassionati dei giochi di calcio e degli arcade veloci e brutali, ha una community molto attiva con degli sviluppatori sempre attenti alle issues del pubblico. Dopo un solo anno sul mercato ha giÃ  un promettente futuro come pietra miliare dei videogiochi sportivi indipendenti. "Chi non lo compra Ã¨ un burfaldino!" (cit.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034977092', 'num_games_owned': 1686, 'num_reviews': 375, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1495833075}
review:
Il gioco del calcio ignorante: Controlli semplici, nessun fallo, nessun fuorigioco, prendi il pad e randella gli avversari come se non ci fosse un domani!

La grafica Ã¨ molto pulita, adatta al contesto e fa il suo dovere.
L'audio risulta essere coinvolgente, avrei preferito sentire cori personalizzati ed altre chicche simili ma siamo comunque sul buon livello qualitativo.
I controlli sono perfetti, sai sempre ciÃ² che sta facendo, se sbagli Ã¨ demerito tuo e mai colpa di qualcosa che Ã¨ andato storto, si lascia giocare che Ã¨ una bellezza!

Hanno da poco anche inserito l'online, che era l'unica reale assenza del titolo. Nonostante sia un accesso anticipato, ora possiede sia una discreta quantitÃ  di trofei offline che un comparto online (sicuramente da miglirorare, ci mancherebbe!)

A mio avviso, se amate il genere vale i soldi spesi, se invece siete indecisi dategli una possibilitÃ  in saldo, non ve ne pentirete!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011205411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1517895351}
review: This game is fun but also very frustrating. The keyboard controls are awful when it comes to passing and your own AI on your team are brainless when it comes to chasing down balls etc. For example the AI controlled player on your team will just continue to run forward as the ball moves beside them.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974307656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1535972084}
review:
This used to be a lot of fun until an update changed the way ball passing works. Passing used to work well where you press A to pass the ball to another player in your direction. Now, pressing A basically shoots the ball, so to pass the ball you have to basically aim your shoot on your team mate, which is stupid and makes the playbility bad and difficult.

Not recommended anymore.
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for feedback. We've updated the passing system and added many more improvements. Passes can now be automatic or manual.

Read more: http://steamcommunity.com/games/399820/announcements/detail/841438213217447176

author: {'steamid': '76561198032132431', 'num_games_owned': 4806, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 3240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1715, 'last_played': 1584650845}
review:
My bro and I really loved the couch co-op experience for this game. Resulted in a lot of screaming and some solid high fives.


 Pros
-Fast-paced intense arcade sports game play.
-Lots of tournaments and unlockable teams.
-Fun couch co-op for up to 5 players.

Cons
-I have an error where the match will crash if my controller disconnects for some reason, or you'll no longer able to rejoin if the controller disconnects.
-I have yet to find any online matches, although I've only tried a few times.
