review: Es un gran juego, te mantiene entretenido durante varias horas, y los torneos tambien estÃ¡n genial. Solo pedirÃ­a varias cosas a este juego: Que se puedan hacer regates con el balÃ³n, que aÃ±adan equipos ( no tienen porque ser todas las ligas, ni los nombres oficiales, pero por lo menos el nombre de la ciudad de la que es el equipo, y que tuviese comentaristas, con esto, serÃ­a mi juego favorito, pero, aun asÃ­, lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096888128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1692124001}
review:
Kopanito ist super! 
Warum? 
Es ist ein FuÃŸballspiel, dass einfach SpaÃŸ macht. Es kann grafisch und spielerisch nicht mit den Schwergewichten FIFA oder PES mithalten - wer eine realistische FuÃŸball-Simulation sucht, ist hier absolut falsch!
Es gibt keine filigranen SpielzÃ¼ge, keine ausgeklÃ¼gelte Taktik, keine Topspieler mit besonderen FÃ¤higkeiten.
Es ist ein frÃ¶hliches Gebolze, dass mich fast ein wenig an die C64-Zeiten mit "Superstar Soccer" erinnert. Grafisch natÃ¼rlich wesentlich besser als dieses.
Aber es ist nicht umsonst eine Steam-Errungenschaft, wenn man es schafft, den Ball lÃ¤nger als 15 Sekunden am FuÃŸ zu behalten, ohne umgegrÃ¤tscht zu werden.

Was genau macht also SpaÃŸ?
Das Spiel ist im GroÃŸen und Ganzen immer ein Kick'n'Rush und - was das Tollste ist - das mit Abstand wichtigste Feature ist GRÃ„TSCHEN! Es gibt nicht nur keinen Schiedsrichter, der als Spielverderber den GrÃ¤tschenden bestraft, sondern es ist auch die effektivste MÃ¶glichkeit, Gegner zu stoppen. 
"Leider" kann man auch die eigenen Spieler umgrÃ¤tschen, was vor allem im Mehrspieler-Modus zu heftigen Wortgefechten vor dem Bildschirm fÃ¼hren kann.
Dsa Spiel selbst ist durch die fehlenden taktischen MÃ¶glichkeiten teilweise recht hektisch, was sich aber eher positiv auswirkt.
Kommt ein Spieler in TornÃ¤he, kann ein SchuÃŸ abgegeben werden, bei gedrÃ¼ckter Controller-Taste wird der Spielablauf verlangsamt und es kann mit einer Zielvorrichtung ein mehr oder weniger genauer Schuss abgegeben werden.

Ein weiteres lustiges Feature sind die "Power Ups" - durch "intensivere Spielweise" erhÃ¤lt eine Mannschaft zum Beispiel einen Superschuss, der wie eine Kanone Ã¼ber das ganze Spielfeld Richtung Tor abgegeben werden kann. Die Flugbahn des Balls kann wÃ¤hrend des Schusses noch gelenkt werden, was auch nÃ¶tig ist, denn wird ein Mitspieler oder der Torwart getroffen, geht der zwar zu Boden, aber ein Tor zu erzielen ist dann eben schwierig.
Andere Power Ups sind zum Beispiel ein Riesen-Ventilator, der TorschÃ¼sse vom Tor weg weht, eine Eis-Attacke, die umstehende Gegner und Mitspieler kurzfristig einfriert, ein Magnet, der dem Spieler schnell den Ball quer Ã¼bers Feld vor die eigenen FÃ¼ÃŸe saugt oder ein Teleporter, der den Spieler Ã¼ber einige Meter auf dem Feld voran bringt.

Hier wÃ¼rde ich mir noch mehr Power Ups wÃ¼nschen, da ginge sicherlich noch viel mehr.

Allein ist das Spiel eine ganz nette Unterhaltung zwischendurch, richtig spaÃŸig wird es aber erst im Mehrspieler-Modus.
Ich spiele meist zusammen mit meinem 6-jÃ¤hrigen Sohn, dem vor allem das GrÃ¤tschen mÃ¤chtig SpaÃŸ macht (weshalb er PES nicht so sehr mag, weil er da dauernd gelbe und rote Karten bekommt).
Bis zu fÃ¼nf Spieler (4x Pad, 1x Tastatur) kÃ¶nnen gleichzeitig agieren.
Da eine Mannschaft aus jeweils 5 Feldspielern besteht, kann so also ein ganzes Team gesteuert werden.
Die Torwarte agieren nicht allzu clever, was allerdings beide Seiten betrifft - es ist also ein halbwegs fairer "Mangel".

Ein weiterer groÃŸer Motivationsfaktor sind die viiiiiiiiielen Errungenschaften, die man erreichen kann - zu Beginn stehen nur wenige Teams und wenige Turniere/Ligen zur VerfÃ¼gung. Den Rest kann man nach und nach freispielen.

Ich habe das Spiel im Sale geholt und bereue keine Minute Spielzeit, denn der SpaÃŸ, den ich mit Junior damit habe, rechtfertigt jeden Cent!

Wer also realistisch FuÃŸball spielen will - HÃ¤nde weg!
Wer aber was Lustiges fÃ¼r zwischendurch oder SpaÃŸ beim Bolzen sucht - vor allem mit mindestens einem Mitspieler, der sollte zugreifen.

[b]Hat Dir das Review gefallen? 
Unter [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/germanicusreviewius]GERMAN REVIEWS[/url] gibt es eine wachsende Datenbank mit noch mehr deutschsprachigen Reviews zu vielen Spielen, erstellt von Gamern fÃ¼r Gamer![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198111942178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1470574407}
review: This is a ton of simple fun. I don't even care about soccer, it's a fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005130329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1473520509}
review:
Saw this on sale and bought it on impulse as I didn't have any kind of football game in my collection.  What followed was a few hrs of fun for a couple of pounds spent.  

Don't expect propper football, this isn't the game for that... What it is a funny and yet simple to master football game that can be played by up to 5 people at the same time... either on the same team (each player controls a single on screen player) or against each other on opposite teams. The 4 basic super powers add an element of fun and frustration to the game... having the ball snatched away from you as you line up your shot by the magnet power for example, or freezing the defense/keeper to allow you to stroll the ball over the line... It's all good fun that can and will have you and your friends screaming and cursing at each other in some good natured rivalry.

It's definitely worth a couple of pounds... even if only played on game nights with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257154210', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1655030043}
review:
The game is so fun for casual play. Real passing controls makes it competitive and powerups add exitement. Best thing is I can enjoy football with my friends on couch and dont need a powerful system, supports upto 5 players. There is no foul or offside rule, no referee, just kick off ! 
Looking forward to see more powerups and skid kick balance in game

author: {'steamid': '76561198306866064', 'num_games_owned': 765, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1038, 'last_played': 1475576979}
review:
Kopanito lo definirÃ­a como un recuerdo nostÃ¡lgico de los juegos de fÃºtbol arcade de la Ã©poca de los salones recreativos, es decir una jugabilidad simple pero muy adictiva junto con una escasa presencia de reglas de juego, solo existe el saque de meta, banda y esquina; las faltas y el fuera de juego han desaparecido, lo cual te permite dar mucha leÃ±a.
El juego carece de historia, Â¿quÃ© esperabas? No habÃ­a historias en los salones recreativos y aquÃ­ no va a ser menos, esto es un partido de 6 contra 6 y para ganar tienes que marcar mÃ¡s goles que el rival, para anotar goles te puedes ayudar de sÃºper poderes que consigues al llenar una barra de poder (la barra se llena haciendo entradas, tiros a puerta, goles, etc.). Actualmente solo hay 5 sÃºper poderes:
-	SÃºper tiro: Pues eso, un tiro con mucha fuerza que noquea al portero si lo intenta parar.
-	Ventilador: Un ventilador enorme se coloca detrÃ¡s de la porterÃ­a y evita que entren balones, excepto el sÃºper tiro.
-	Teletransporte: El jugador (con o sin balÃ³n) se teleporta a otra zona del campo.
-	ImÃ¡n: El jugador sin balÃ³n que lo usa harÃ¡ que el balÃ³n vaya hacia Ã©l, pudiendo cortar una contra o ponerte solo de cara a porterÃ­a.
-	Congelador: Congelas a los jugadores rivales y compaÃ±eros en el radio marcado.
Los controles son muy sencillos, aunque al principio pueden confundirte un poco si eres un asiduo de los PES (como es mi caso), yo lo he jugado con mando de Xbox 360 y me he adaptado muy rÃ¡pido. La IA presenta diferentes dificultades las cuales estÃ¡n muy cuidadas pues el salto de una a otra se nota claramente, y ademÃ¡s destacar que la Ãºltima dificultad (Legendario) no te darÃ¡ tregua, debo destacar que esta dificultad me lo ha puesto mÃ¡s difÃ­cil que cualquier jugador online. Esto Ãºltimo nos lleva al online, aquÃ­ estÃ¡ el talÃ³n de Aquiles del juego pues, aunque los partidos que he jugado ninguno ha tenido lags por contra la acciÃ³n de encontrar un oponente puede llevarte una espera de 5 minutos o mÃ¡s fÃ¡cilmente. Desde el punto de vista grÃ¡fico se nos presenta un juego de muy bajos requisitos que de vez en cuando al principio del partido y tras marcar un gol suele dar un micro tirÃ³n, pero nada que estropee la experiencia de juego. Kopanito se caracteriza por un aspecto visual donde todo estÃ¡ dibujado de forma caricaturesca lo cual yo no habÃ­a visto en un juego de fÃºtbol antes y le sienta muy bien. Con respecto a la mÃºsica decir que es amena, pero nada destacable. Algunos detalles a destacar son:
-	Puedes guardar las repeticiones de gol en formato .gif lo cual facilita enormemente el compartirla con amigos.
-	La cantidad de torneos offline que tiene el juego es bastante grande lo cual te asegura muchas horas de juego.
-	El juego incluye 224 logros lo cual es una pasada y para los â€œlogrerosâ€ (personas que buscan sacar todos los logros) son muchas horas de juego.
-	Puedes jugar numerosos torneos, ligas y partidos offline con amigos, hasta 5 jugadores.
-	Presenta traducciÃ³n parcial al espaÃ±ol ya que algunas cosas se mantienen en inglÃ©s.
Y poco mÃ¡s que decir, Kopanito es un juego muy adictivo de fÃºtbol, con aspecto visual cuidado y con el que podrÃ¡s soltar tensiÃ³n derribando jugadores cada 2 segundos y si el rival es un amigo mÃ¡s tensiÃ³n liberaras, en conclusiÃ³n, Kopanito es esencial en la biblioteca de los amantes de juegos de fÃºtbol y por tanto mÃ¡s que recomendado, por 12â‚¬ es un precio justo a la cantidad de horas que le puedes echar, aun asÃ­ puedes esperar a rebajas que yo lo adquirÃ­ por 3,5â‚¬ y ahÃ­ sÃ­ que no tienes excusa para no comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087165951', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1594408975}
review:
8/10

Pros: Great arcade style football game, reminds me of Dino Dini's Soccer on Mega Drive. Entertainly chaotic in co-op!

Cons: Bit of a grind to unlock the hardest difficulty level, still a few matches to play despite winning most of my games by a 5+ goal margin now...

Suggestions: Some sort of injuries system might add to the chaotic hilarity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062232099', 'num_games_owned': 5821, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1473478870}
review:
[h1]What is Kopanito All-Stars Soccer?[/h1]

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a fast-paced action soccer game that has been in development by Merixgame since September 2015. Throughout this development timeline they have continued to make regular updates to the game. They have also, at all times, communicated openly and quickly with their fans.

In fact, because of their consistent development and their great communication with their community it wouldnâ€™t be out of place to consider them an Early Access role model. I honestly believe that indie developers would do well to look at the way in which they have gone through the early access pipeline.

The developers have openly claimed to have been inspired by some of the greatest soccer games in gaming history. These include Kick Off, Sensible Soccer and Nintendo World Cup. These games provided gamers around the world thousands of hours of entertainment. I believe that Kopanito fits that niche rather nicely.

[h1]Easy to Learn but Depth for Strategy[/h1]

The gameplay has been designed so that it is easy for gamers to jump into and play immediately. However, it is frenetic and challenging enough that it is a beast to master. There have been numerous times throughout the time that I have cursed at missed opportunities and even more when Iâ€™ve learned a new tactic or strategy that was previously unknown to me.

This is perhaps the biggest surprise to me. The game appears to be very simple. Players donâ€™t need to worry about the general rules of soccer. There are no offside calls, fouls, etc. Yet the depth of the game to include strategy is deeper than it first appears to be.

[h1]Tournaments[/h1]

There are 16 different tournaments to play in. Some of them need to be unlocked by winning certain tournaments in various game modes. A nice feature of tournaments is that each game of the tournament can be played with up to five players and it isnâ€™t dependent upon the number of players you began the tournament with. Therefore, if you have friends or family members come to your house and youâ€™d like them to join you they can easily do so.

There is also an option for players to create their own tournament.

[h1]Teams[/h1]

There are a whopping 114 teams within the game. These represent countries from around the world.

I do have two minor sticking points with these teams. Firstly, I donâ€™t believe that players have unique modifiers or attributes. If they are there then they are not necessarily clear. Each team plays the same as any other. While this ensures a level playing field with games determined purely by skill it doesnâ€™t provide any point of difference on any of the teams. Youâ€™re not going to pick a South American team (e.g. Brazil) and expect to be able to play with more floor and pizazz.

Secondly, do not expect to be able to play as your favourite countries right away. The majority of the major countries are locked. They unlock when you complete a set task. For example, to unlock my native Australia I need to win the Oceania Cup on professional difficulty. To unlock England, you need to win the World League on Professional difficulty. This is intended to be motivating but when every team seemingly plays the same as any other the primary motivation may not be as high as anticipated.

[h1]Super-moves[/h1]

A significant part of the gameâ€™s enjoyment comes in the is the â€˜super-movesâ€™ feature. There are a number of super-moves. You gain one super-move for filling up the super bar. To fill up the super bar players have to do successful things in the field of play (e.g. a successful tackle, pass, score, etc.). These Super-moves can often prove to be match winners on both ends of the field.


I was playing a tournament game as Tonga against New Zealand and was 2-1 up late in the game. I unlocked a super-move which turned out to be a wind move. New Zealand had the ball late in the game and my last defender had unsuccessfully slide tackled the Kiwi striker. I quickly used my super-move just as he was about to slot the game-tying goal. The ball proceeded to be blown back out of the penalty area. New Zealand pounced on the ball and passed it back to the striker who again was met with the wind. My super-move saved the game for me. 

Conversely, in the final against Australia I was tied late in the game when I unleashed my power shot super-move. The keeper deflected it but it dazed him which opened up the goal completely for my rebounding striker who slotted in the game winner.

[h1]Is it Steamified?[/h1]

My word is this game Steamified. There are over 200 achievements. They unlock frequently enough that youâ€™ll want to continue playing more and more. Yet there are enough achievements that are a challenge to unlock that perfect game does not feel cheap. It will take even the most skilled players many hours of play before they unlock every achievement.

The game also has a set of six trading cards. The developers are working on implementing Steam Workshop features into the game. Players can already create stadiums, balls and teams for modding. This should prove

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

If youâ€™re looking for a casual soccer experience that provides entertainment and challenge, then look no further than Kopanito All-Star Soccer. Itâ€™s as enjoyable as any casual soccer game has been in years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198270030992', 'num_games_owned': 863, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1500816125}
review:
Even though this game is in Early Access, there are really few mentionable flaws that could restrain someone from buying it in this phase of game development, like the fact that online mode is still in its early stage, or some AI flaws still persisting when it comes to picking up a passed ball.

Anyway, the game is very fun and playable, with an easy start in the Beginner AI modes and becoming very challenging when climbing the skill ladder. The developers look closely to comments and involve and let participate the KAS community in selecting the next enhancements to where the game should be developed to.

What I especially like about Kopanito is the simplicity of controls compared to other high class (AAA) football games like the FIFA (tm) series e.g.. In Kopanito, one does not need a long learning curve to become familiar with the controls and can start playing at an instant. Still one can do some really nice (trick-)shots, and especially playing local multiplayer gains a lot of Schadenfreude, e.g. when kicking the ball with an overhead kick into the opponent's goal (including their goalkeeper), or smashing the forward just before the shot with the goalie and a defender in synchronicity...

Keeping away no-fun rules (like offsides, yellow and red cards) and plainly focusing on game flow, Kopanito reminds me on the goody old times when a friend of mine and I played Sensible Soccer on the Amiga for hours and hours (he won most of the time ;-) ). 

Taking into account the absolutely fair game price, I believe that no one will make a mistake in buying this game who likes casual sports games that suddenly evolve into a family affair... :-)

I'd like to give two thumbs up to this game. Unfortunately, Steam does only allow for one :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198292721048', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1474743755}
review:
Pretty entertaining game overall with relatively easy controls, consistant action, and satisfying goals. Local co-op is definitely a plus as well! However, there are two major improvements that will convince me to give this a thumbs up:

- Improved netcode: I have a fast internet connection and decent setup but the responsiveness in an online game is miserable. I noticed that my opponent was having the same problems. Everything from switching characters in the timely manner, tackling when actually pressing the button, and passing was affected

- Information about how many players are in each online game mode: There is a count in the bottom-left of the mode select screen that says how many players are online and how many are waiting for a game. However, with so many game types (5 or 6, iirc) it would be a huge help to see what modes people are waiting to play. Its great to see that 2 people are in the game lobby waiting to play but it would save a lot of trial and error to just tell me what game I should select so I can play with them. Likewise, if I'd like to play 3v3 with randoms, it'll increase their chances of finding me in that lobby if that lobby notated that there is somebody waiting in it.

This is a fun game but these are areas that need improvement to make it fun to play online.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081090947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1497978115}
review:
1.5 Hours into the game
2/5 familiar with the controls
10/10 fun ! 

Holy shit, this game takes you back to the era of the early fifas.
Fast-paced, Addictive, Challenging, great sense of humour.
Doesn't really matter if you play online or offline (online lobbys are lacking some pop)
You can play with 4 of your friends anyway.

Old generations of gamers will understand.

Totally worth the money.
Will play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007874063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1557454950}
review:
8/10 Will go all Zidane again and again

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a great arcade soccer game to waste a few minutes when you only have only a little free time.  The game is simple but still is has enough play to not get old.  The best is the ability to slide tackle and not worry about a red card. 

Pros-
Fun arcade style soccer
Slide tackles for defense and offense
Power attacks are great but not unbeatable
bending better than Beckham


Cons-
Not much as far as rewards
No Customizing players: it would be nice to make an avatar to throw on the team.

----UPDATE-----

Pro
Corners are alot better with the new changes and adds a higher level of skill to the action

Con
The new automatic passing/passing modifier throws off the timing to where it actually affects the amount of time I play this game due to frustration.  Mental for bringing this back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091297992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1560816070}
review:
This game is fun and simple, as others have said. It's a good game to play with people who maybe aren't into games like fifa which are more complex (as much as a football game can be). 

There are however clear problems with the game that need to be fixed before the game is something I would recommend. 

CONS:
The AI man the AI. The AI really really needs to be fixed. On any difficulty the AI will always have perfect aim with its slide tackles, which you'll soon realize are the key meta to the game. 
This wouldn't really be a problem if slide tackling wasn't so difficult for human player. Sure you get better as you play but forget playing with your girlfriend when the AI never misses a slide (unless you juke, but thats a whole other thing). The AI also passes and shoots stupidly fast. It just looks like the developers added no margin of error for the AI. Its like fifa if all the sliders were at 100. 

The game can be fun and rewarding but its quiet annoying when the AI has pixle perfect slides and passes that will never ever miss. And of course the AI can gage the slide distance perfectly so be prepared to be tackled at the max distance you can be tackled from.

I hope the game does well and gets the updates it needs but in its current state, you'll be left shaking your head. That said, none of that will really make you lose. Shooting is fun and quick to learn so youll soon be scoring from 40 yards. But the fun times are really limited when you have to dance around the perfect AI all game. 

TLDR: Just make it so the AI can miss sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986385440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1472593355}
review:
Fun little arcade soccer game with great potential, perfect for a quick match or longer sessions in cups & leagues.

I hope they can improve online game (I haven't had any problems but some people report latency issues) and add more features such as:

Custom online leagues/cups
Team and player stats tracking
Team and player customization (names, faces, flags, team name...)
Better leaderboards/ranked online play.

Overall, great value especially if bought during a big sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111648545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1472038687}
review:
Comprato a 3,59â‚¬ il gioco allo stato attuale non ne vale nemmeno la metÃ .
Eppure il concept di base sarebbe anche interessante: niente arbitro, niente falli, un gameplay molto manuale tra passaggi e conclusioni a rete, con boost vari che si attivano in base alle azioni svolte in campo come tiri, parate e scivolate.
La grafica risulta gradevole e molto fluida tranne alcuni rarissimi cali di frames poco spiegabili e di breve durata.
A guastare nettamente l'esperienza di gioco arriva la finalizzazione a rete che, a mio modo di vedere, Ã¨ completamente rotta allo stato attuale del gioco (early access): tiri sul primo palo che entrano praticamente sempre, cosÃ¬ come i calci d'angolo con palla verso il giocatore posizionato sul secondo palo.
Il multiplayer Ã¨ scarsamente popolato se non dall'incessante e persistente lag.
Confido poco che tali e gravi errori possano essere risolti per l'uscita della release ufficiale prevista per settembre, perciÃ² per me Ã¨ una netta bocciatura.

4.5 / 10

review: This is a great little soccer game. It's strongly reminiscent of the classic Sensible Soccer, with economical button usage that's sensitive to length of press and the stick's position. You can pull of some crazy skillful moves once you become comfortable with the controls. I haven't tried the online multiplayer yet but local mp and vs AI are both a lot of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005270445', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1554929543}
review:
after update its working now

i can recommend the game now, although it still needs some work
did not have much time to test but it looks it will be fun

the network code needs some improvement though, even with low ping there is significant delay

it looks like client sends info, then hosts receives data, does code and then sends back data to player,, so player will see his display updated after hosts resends new data to client

it believe this is like an arcade game and it does need that display to be updated immidiately and then to check it with server if it's synchronized 

keep it up guys


--------------------------- @before update


sick netcode...
me and my friend bought this game for multiplayer, but it just doesnt work - characters keep teleporting like crazy

for now it's not worth it's price

maybe they will fix that somewhen

author: {'steamid': '76561198219222067', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 445, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1689080293}
review:
Tutto cominciÃ² da 2 fuoriclasse giapponesi (portiere e attaccante) e la loro squadra (mi sa dopata a loro insaputa perchÃ¨ i controlli antidoping non esistevano) che correvano in un campo lungo diversi chilometri percorrendo 100 metri in 2 secondi (per poi chiedersi come mai Julian Ross fosse malato di cuore),e con quel povero arbitro che era costretto a muoversi in motorino per seguire l'azione.poi fu il periodo di FIFA e PES,giochi che hanno fatto la storia,fino ad arrivare a Kopanito All-Star Soccer.consiglio (vivamente) di prenderlo,chi fosse interessato,in offerta (come ho fatto io.perchÃ¨ spendere 11,99 per un giochino ad accesso anticipato che occupa 500MB e che verrÃ  completato in seguito mi sembra leggermente eccessivo).riguarda solo le nazionali,alcune giÃ  disponibili e alcune che si possono sbloccare finendo i vari tornei e in varie difficoltÃ .la cosa che mi piace troppo Ã¨ la palla a rallentatore,in stile matrix.NO falli (puoi anche atterrare i tuoi compagni se ti va male),NO fuorigioco,NO giocatori reali.possibilitÃ  di usare degli "special",tipo:
1-Ghiaccio:per congelare momentaneamente gli aversari (e anche i tuoi compagni se si trovano nel raggio di azione),ma in un limitato raggio di azione
2-super tiro:il classico super tiro alla Holly & Benji
3-calamita:ruberai la palla agli avversari anche a grandi distanze
4-ventilatore:si,avete capito bene,una volta attivato,alle spalle del vostro portiere,apparirÃ  un grande ventilatore che il 99% del casi eviterÃ  il gol degli avversari
5-teletrasporto:in caso di necessitÃ  puoi teletrasportarti poco piÃ¹ in la,ma in un raggio di azione limitato (come lo special del ghiaccio)
il gioco in sÃ¨ bellino e piuttosto divertente,modalitÃ  single player e multiplayer online,il multiplayer online direi NO COMMENT per la troppa attesa nel giocarci e per le pochissime persone disponibili.ultima cosa,desidero che i piani alti che sviluppano il gioco tenessero conto di cose che ora non ci sono e che si potrebbero mettere (si spera) in futuro,tipo:
1-personalizzare le maglie
2-personalizzare i giocatori:sia di faccia,sia di nome (per non vederli chiamati "player 1")
3-possibilitÃ  di aggiungere,se possibile,anche squadre di club e tornei tipo la champions league

review:
Parmis la ribambelle de jeux indÃ©s dont est truffÃ© le magasin Steam, on peut pas dire que des alternatives aux jeux de foot "classiques" se bousculent au portillon.

Kopanito pour Ã§a fait bien le taff sans prises de tÃªte inutiles.
Si vous cherchez le fun, l'arcade, et les tacles Ã  tout va vous Ãªtes au bon endroit.

Le contenu solo est dÃ©jÃ  bien riche et le multijoueur local fonctionnel comme on est en droit de s'y attendre.

Le multi en ligne lui se laisse dÃ©sirer, prÃ©vu d'ici quelques mises Ã  jour il devrait apporter une solution efficace pour ceux qui prÃ©fÃ¨rent rester chez eux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990630473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1677096595}
review: Fantastic little game. Best Indie football game on Steam. The clever slow mo shooting system and easy curved shot controls means you're spend plenty of time watching your amazing goal replays. The slide tackles are particularly satisfying, especially as there are no fouls. Revenge is openly encouraged. Considering this is still in early access, there's a good amount of content to enjoy. It's just a fun to play football arcade game. A hidden gem.

review: I think this game is very fun and once you get used to manual passing the game is much more enjoyable. If you're used to FIFA's auto passing this may prove to be challenging at first, but eventually becomes manageable. Love the Super Moves and the fact that there are no red cards. Let the tackles begin! Fun, silly soccer game. I'm able to play it with my PS3 and Xbox One controllers with no problems.

review:
Kopanito es un sÃºper prometedor tÃ­tulo de fÃºtbol arcade. ya en estado jugable y disfrutable desde el primer minuto.

Como fan de los "Sensible Soccer", "Soccer Superstars" y demÃ¡s arcades del estilo, creo que Kopanito, si consigue convencer a la gente suficiente con un buen desarrollo final, serÃ¡ un clÃ¡sico total en sus futuros modos online. Mucho potencial, gran control y humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036470535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1469289822}
review:
Un jeu qui parait fun au premier abord mais qui se rÃ©vÃ¨le vite injouable.
_ SÃ©lection des personnages alÃ©atoire sur le terrain, il arrive qu'on fasse une passe Ã  un autre joueur et que l'on ne puisse pas contrÃ´ler le destinataire avant qu'il ait le ballon dans les pieds
_ Tacles qui exigent une trop grande prÃ©cision, on en vient souvent Ã  se dire "mais j'Ã©tais dessus"
_ Objets bonus carrÃ©ment abusÃ©s qui permettent Ã  une IA dÃ©jÃ  surpuissante d'Ã©craser le score
_ DifficultÃ© mal calibrÃ©e avec un mode "Beginner" presque trop faible (mais qui ne permet pas de dÃ©bloquer de nouvelles Ã©quipes ou terrains), un mode "Amateur" juste au-dessus qui lui devient subitement trÃ¨s difficile Ã  jouer et on ne parle pas du niveau inhumain des suivants
_ Pas de musique pendant le match, juste le nÃ©ant total
_ Peu de modes de jeux
_ En multijoueurs, on a accÃ¨s qu'Ã  peu d'options mais Ã§a reste lÃ  que le jeu est le plus amusant

Parce que oui, le gros point fort de ce jeu pourrait Ãªtre le mode multijoueur. Les graphismes sont marrants, les objets bonus auraient besoin d'un lÃ©ger recalibrage dans leur puissance et distribution. Mais quand on voit que pour pouvoir choisir autre chose que des toutes petites Ã©quipes ocÃ©aniennes, il faut se faire prÃ¨s d'une centaine de matchs contre une IA imbouffable, Ã§a coupe vite l'appÃ©tit.

A ne rÃ©server qu'aux vrais mordus de foot. Il est dommage que l'on ne puisse pas bÃ©nÃ©ficier des progrÃ¨s de gameplay de gros titres comme FIFA en version 2D cartoon comme ce que l'on pouvait espÃ©rer ici.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079940835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1482250892}
review:
Kopanito Ã¨ un gioco di calcio diverso dal solito; le squadre a nostra disposizione sono tutte uguali dal punto di vista della forza e non come in altri giochi dove alcune sono piÃ¹ forti di altre.
Nel gioco, quindi, non conta la forza della squadra ma la bravura del giocatore o del gioco di squadra (se giocato con amici).
Dalle immagini o dai video, Kopanito puÃ² sembrare infantile e semplice ma in realtÃ  Ã¨ tutto il contrario; bisogna gestire correttamente i passaggi ai nostri compagni per arrivare nellâ€™area di tiro avversaria.
Nel gioco, controlliamo un calciatore mentre il resto della squadra viene gestito dal computer. Una volta che passiamo la palla ad un calciatore (della nostra squadra) controllato dal computer, ne assumiamo poi il controllo diretto.
Infine câ€™Ã¨ la possibilitÃ , una volta che la nostra barra rossa si Ã¨ caricata al massimo, di usare un potere speciale: il super-calcio, il ventilatore gigante dietro la porta, il teletrasporto e altri.
Per ora Ã¨ possibile giocare in offline e multiplayer locale ma il multiplayer online sta per arrivare cosÃ¬ come la fine dellâ€™ EA.
Allâ€™inizio potrÃ  sembrare difficile ma con un poâ€™ di pratica vedrete che riuscirete a giocare meglio e a tenere testa ai vari livelli di difficoltÃ  del computer.
In conclusione, se volete giocare con la voglia di divertirvi e in compagnia degli amici, Kopanito Ã¨ una buon titolo da avere in libreria.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969239853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1579127248}
review:
[u]Game reviewed before online multiplayer is available.[/u]

Some people may think that because a football game isn't "serious", it can be sloppy. These people are wrong, IMO. Games like Rocket League or Mario Strikers on Wii are perfect examples of well-oiled games of this genre. Kopanito fits within this category too. It looks a lot like World Cup on the NES for those who are young enough to have played it but with a serious update.

PROS:
- Good controls/dynamics
- Lots of ways to approach this game. Many options to score goals
- Surprisingly fair
- Easy/fun to play but room for competitive games, I think (we'll see once the online multi is available)

CONS:
- It says "soccer" in the title. Guys: it's called football! (sarcasm) (or not!)
- Could be tedious on the long run vs. computer. Guess online multi will solve the issue.

Conclusion: funnier to play compared to "realistic" games like FIFA or PES. Worth the price tag but grab it while it's on sale a get 2-3 copies for your friends. Fun should ensue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997693934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1472640781}
review:
Kopanito is the kind of game you didn't realize you needed until you play your first match.  

If you're itching to return to the FIFA games of the SNES era, Kopanito is a charming mix of nostalgic arcade-y action and modern features you'd expect in a newer title.  

Great fun in single-player.  Haven't tried multiplayer yet, but imagine it will feel like NBA Jam, or NFL blitz.  

Get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027876618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1597376437}
review:
I bought the game after the update people are complaining about. They say this new feature of manual passes makes the game hard to play.

I have played for 2 days and I won South America's cup in pro and European in amateur. I score more than 2 goals average and I found manual passes a great opportunity of avoiding enemies. With manual passes you can make depth passes not viable with auto passes.

The game is fun. Enemies starts being nice but as soon as you make 2, 3 or more goals (depends on the team) they start playing harder and passing the ball a lot. That makes the gameplay funny and not so repetitive.

It would be great to have more options of gameplay. Not sure what, but I'm affraid to get bored of playing it. Taunts, fights, reactions or another feature other than tackling and shooting. I'm not the creative guy, sry. Maybe a precise pass just like precise shot will also be another fun feature. A referee to kick (?) and who knows what another bizarre gameplay feature could be added to make it even more funny :)

I think it needs some work on ambience and emotions. When you win, your team leaves the field just like they enter at the beggining of the match. 

To be honest, I bought the game because it's on sale. I think I wouldn't pay $12 in its current state.

You can score pretty nice goals once you get the hang of it, and the power moves are a great idea. Multiplayer is coming along which is very exciting. You should definitely give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178705519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1468381386}
review:
I purchased this game in a whim, and it has turned out to be one of the best Soccer games I have played in a long time. I am enjoying it much better than the Fifa amd PES series games.

Pros:
-Fun and quirky, not super serious but also very competitive.
-Game runs well
-Great for short bursts of play time (for people who don't have a lot of free time for gaming)
-Online is coming soon
- AI is pretty good

Cons:
-Lack of customization options
-Would like a "create a characte" or "create a team" option

Overall, this game is a ton of fun, and definitely worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143098456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1478025962}
review: If there are no refs, who is blowing the whistle?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003884281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1638934039}
review:
A challenging, but rewarding and fun, arcade soccer game. 

The only complaints that I have are that you can't customize the teams and that you have to grind to get the good teams. You should be able to play as whoever you want from the start. It's absurd that you have to go through hoops to unlock the well-established teams, and for what? Just the name of the team?

author: {'steamid': '76561198110634170', 'num_games_owned': 6510, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1477780024}
review:
Great fun, even in early access. 
If you want a quick, arcade footy game where you still get real satisfaction from scoring a good goal, you need to try this.

If this is early access, I look forward to what the final version will bring!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998696364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1709927360}
review:
Great game - damn awful controls (360 controller).

Player switch works very poorly, not accurate switches with directional input as stated from menu, switching time laggy and non responsive at times. Passes from a goal kick go out for a corner, even when aiming up pitch. Ball glitches from goalkeeper save into goal, arieal shots do not work at all (following gameplay instructions). Can not switch player when AI shoots. AI with no margin of error. Tackles ineffective against AI (ball snatch). Quick shot controls non functional. 

I'd love to play more if it wasn't such a disaster. This is a fundemental basic of a game, yet I can't believe how non functional they are.

Edit: Original post from 2016

Needless to say the game is still a piece of shit. Not really much different from the original post. Don't buy this garbage. Brilliant concept, so fucking poorly executed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002189495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1467681808}
review:
Wow, awesome game. :) I can confirm this game works with a Dual Action Logitech controller very nicely as well (mine might be an older model). 

The game is fun to play number one. The slide tackles, passing, shooting.. are all nice. The controls are nice as well on the keyboard, and are configurable. Some of the default keys are the arrow keys to move, and d and s for passing. I've been using the contoller mostly, but the keyboard is easy as well.

The league I tried is nice so far as well. I'm 2-4 so far, but won my last 2 games. It was hard to score at first as I didn't know the score button (button 3 on my controller). I'm looking forward to seeing this game develop, but a blast to play now as well.

review:
The most fun i have had playing football in years...

When i first got this game every time i got to the end of a tournament it would crash but since the Manual passes 2.0 update i no longer have any issues. The game play seems a lot better passing, shooting and air shots, in my personal opinion. I cant wait for online Multiplayer it will make this game brilliant.

review:
New Update is garbage:

The ability to pass to a player by tapping A seems to no longer work so every pass is a through ball, this would be fine if it wasn't so hard to make a player take control of a loose ball. The new way to enter a game is a bit messy say the least and needs improving but mostly the passing issue needs fixing. 

Also the power shot special has gone from being a certain goal to very diificult to get on target.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085611889', 'num_games_owned': 2286, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1561237378}
review:
Playing this Early-Access Sports-Game with the family is a great fun. It's really simple and the teamplays are so satisfying (just as much as the multiple tackles on a single player...)

Pros:
+ Good Teamplay possibilites (seriously high pass + volley shots are just so fun to do)
+ Aerial Shots are well executed and look great
+ Works well and efficient on the Controller
+ Shots can be curved and adjusted in hight/strength (in slowmotion too)
+ Super Moves give it a bit of strategy; a really fun addition
+ Lots of Leagues and Cups to play (tons of achievements)
+ Gameplay is mostly fluent and fast paced
+ Gif-generator and Recap for your favorite goal moments
+ Fun Character motions and Victory Moves (getting hit by Super Shot looks great)
+ Pretty much all the Nations to choose from (once you've unlocked them)
+ Lots of skins for the balls and stadiums
+ You can attack your own teammates (yap for us this is was a big pro)
+ Tackle, tackle, tackle...no penalty

Cons:
- Some Super Moves are so stronk ...
- Losing ball when not moving
- Goalkeeper can be tackled WITH the ball into the goal... (this could be pro too ...heh)
- Enemy players can stand in front of your goal and wait for a pass without penalty
- NPC Goalkeeper sometimes messes up a lot (runs away from the ball...)
- Sometimes Slow motion takes a bit to run out
- Tackle, tackle, tackle... no penalty

Waiting for:
- Online Mode
- More Super Moves
- Custom made Teams

Gotta say though - as the Developers are working and improving on the game, I think Kopanito might be a great game to play with (and against) friends, family, onliners and aliens... oh yeah - one day maybe alien teams please !

author: {'steamid': '76561198002060322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1546, 'last_played': 1612034702}
review:
Nintendo World Cup, Version 2.0

Bislang habe ich nur den Singleplayer gezockt. Fazit: Sehr sehr gut! Der Sprung vom ersten zum zweiten Schwierigkeitsgrad ist enorm... und 2 weitere sind ja noch darÃ¼ber. Das Spiel ist schwer, insbesondere das Tackeln muss sehr genau ausgefÃ¼hrt sein. Auch das genaue SchieÃŸen muss erstmal gelernt sein. Aber sobald man es halbswegs beherrscht hat macht es richtig Laune. Superschuss und Spezialfertigkeiten sind auch vorhanden. Das man animierte GIFs von seinen Toren machen kann ist auch eine witzige Idee.

Der Online-Multiplayer soll ja mit dem nÃ¤chsten Update kommen, ich sehe jetzt schon dreistellig Stunden ins Land gehen.

Wer World Cup mag wird dieses Spiel lieben! Unbedingt zuschlagen, im Summer Sale wird es sicher wieder einen guten Discount geben.

vorlÃ¤ufige Wertung: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198082779889', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1533859778}
review:
My friend recommended this game to me. At first it appears really fun. But there're 3 problems really makes me sick:
1. If you got kicked out during a tournament, then the game is dead: mucis is playing, screen is frozen, no button pressing is working any more. I believe this is a bug.
2. The AI really makes me frustrated: I choose the beginner AI level( the easiest one I suppose), then during the game I saw AI players pass the ball from their penalty area to my penalty area without any dribble, literally without any dribble! And then AI scores and this happens all the time during my game experience. So you tell me this is the easiest AI?
3. The game control is really uncomprehensible to me. For example, in practice mode, I passed to my teammate. He caught the ball and then ran WITHOUT it. I got a really hard time trying to dribble.
In conclusion, either this game really have these problems or maybe I'm just really bad at this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999384308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1526929733}
review:
Edit: my negative review was based on a very poor 0.7 patch. Developers have obviously recognized their mistakes, and things have greatly improved in 0.7.2. The tweaks and new features add to the game depth, big props to the devolpment team for their fast and appropriate reaction.
In its current state, I can recommend the game again, fun and totally worth its price.

When I bought this game, I had a very pleasant surprise. A fun & fast paced arcade soccer game filled with good ideas which I would play casually and enjoy quite a bit.
Well, that was a few patches ago. Now everything feels unreliable : the (new) manual passing, the air play, your players movements and AI... + the game often randomly hangs after some matches. My last sessions of play were pretty much only frustration, and made me want to forget this game for good. While I appreciate the developers efforts to improve and spice their game, I cannot enjoy anymore a game that makes me want to throw my controller away every 5 minutes, and I certainly do not want to spend a hundred hours mastering a broken gameplay just to be able to play decently.
A few months ago this game was immediate fun, now it is endless frustration.
developer_response:
Most of the issues you are describing have been fixed, please give the game another chance.

http://steamcommunity.com/games/399820/announcements/detail/876328740924842267

review:

-Dans son genre, la DA est trÃ¨s maitrisÃ©e, fonctionnelle, marrante et rafraÃ®chissante, et si le jeu affiche clairement un dÃ©corum "footballistique", il me semble pourtant plus proche de l'esprit d'un "rocket league" en 2D que d'un jeu de foot lambda!
-Pas de stats, d'Ã©quipes, de tronches, ou d'enrobage "sÃ©rieux" ni "officiel" : Les diffÃ©rences entre les 5 joueurs de chaque Ã©quipe semblent uniquement cosmÃ©tiques et c'est tant mieux, puisque Ã§a Ã©vite d'avoir des matchs opposant des "nuls" Ã  des "balÃ¨zes" de la "vraie vie" : Ici, chaque camp part Ã  Ã©galitÃ©. Et j'adhÃ¨re assez Ã  cette ambiance dessin-animÃ© trÃ¨s plaisante et "second degrÃ©".
-Une autre chose d'agrÃ©able, c'est le gameplay! TrÃ¨s basique, mais fluide, prÃ©cis dans les tirs (un poil plus approximatif dans les passes), relativement bien Ã©quilibrÃ©, et mÃªme potentiellement exigeant.
-Outre les traditionnels "replay" des buts, le jeu propose de les sauvegarder en gif... Option toujours sympa.
-Le jeu sait se rendre rapidement addictif, et les trÃ¨s courts matchs s'enchainent vite et avec plaisir! On peut en paramÃ©trer la durÃ©e si on aime jouer plus longtemps.
-Pas mal de contenu Ã  dÃ©bloquer : beaucoup d'Ã©quipes / pays, des ballons, et aussi quelques stades... Un mode "entrainement", un mode "match amical", un tournoi "custom", et divers championnats (qui se dÃ©bloqueront les uns Ã  la suite des autres - sachant que chacun de ces tournois propose 3 niveaux de difficultÃ©). Plus de 200 succÃ¨s pour les amateurs(trices). De plus, chaque match propose un "dÃ©fi" facultatif Ã  relever.
-Un mode online est apparemment prÃ©vu, mais pas encore implantÃ©; cependant il est d'ores et dÃ©jÃ  possible de jouer en multi local, en PVP ou en coopÃ©ration jusqu'Ã  5, et Ã§a fonctionne parfaitement : l'action reste lisible grÃ¢ce aux pastilles de couleurs nettement diffÃ©rentes sous les joueurs contrÃ´lÃ©s, et le fun est dÃ©cuplÃ©!
-J'ai l'impression que les rÃ¨gles du foot [i](que je ne connais pas spÃ©cialement bien - je prÃ©cise)[/i], sont sans doute ici fort malmenÃ©es : possibilitÃ© de tacler en boucle et n'importe oÃ¹, pas de jauge d'endurance, possibilitÃ© de shooter dans le goal pour rentrer le ballon qu'il vient d'arrÃªter et marquer "en traitre"... J'imagine qu'on a pas le droit de faire Ã§a normalement? Ben ici on peut, et c'est cool! ^^
-Les pouvoirs spÃ©ciaux sont plutÃ´t sympas et donnent un petit cÃ´tÃ© "Mario Kart" ou plutÃ´t "Olive et Tom" Ã  l'ensemble... Dommage qu'il y en ait si peu et qu'ils soient finalement si anecdotiques pour le moment, (et non paramÃ©trables), puisque c'est clairement la grosse valeur ajoutÃ©e de ce jeu...

Quand je l'ai vu Ã  3,5â‚¬, j'avoue m'Ãªtre prÃ©cipitÃ©e dessus, et je ne regrette pas mon achat!
En revanche, Ã  10â‚¬, j'Ã©tais beaucoup plus rÃ©ticente, et Ã  raison ; car le jeu n'est pas exempt de quelques problÃ¨mes trÃ¨s gÃªnants en l'Ã©tat:

-Le jeu crash / freeze assez rÃ©guliÃ¨rement. Cela survient lorsqu'on perd en championnat, ou parfois (pire) quand on gagne, et aussi quand on tente d'annuler la sauvegarde d'un but en gif. Ces problÃ¨mes de stabilitÃ© bien trop rÃ©currents sont Ã  mes yeux LE plus gros souci du jeu - et mÃªme si il est naturellement "couvert" par l'habituel [i]alibi[/i] d'Ãªtre en accÃ¨s anticipÃ©, Ã§a n'excuse pas tout. C'est trÃ¨s bien que les devs bossent actuellement sur un mode online, mais il me semble que rÃ©gler ces soucis serait nettement plus prioritaire!
-De lÃ©gÃ¨res baisses de framerate surviennent par moment - Ã©trange pour un jeu en 2D pas super impressionnant techniquement.
-Lors des championnats, les joueurs peuvent se retrouver avec des maillots de couleurs diffÃ©rentes d'un match Ã  l'autre. (TrÃ¨s bien, Ã§a varie un peu). Mais pourquoi dans ce cas choisir une couleur parfois presque identiques Ã  celles de l'adversaire? Mais finalement, Ã§a n'a que peu d'incidence sur la frÃ©quence Ã  laquelle ces bonus sont distribuÃ©s. Pour donner une idÃ©e, les matchs de base durent 4 minutes. Et lors d'un tel match, si les Ã©quipes se partagent Ã  peu prÃ¨s Ã©quitablement le temps de possession du ballon, chacune n'aura gÃ©nÃ©ralement accÃ¨s qu'une seule fois Ã  un seul "pouvoir" alÃ©atoire ("mieux jouer que l'autre" permettra juste d'obtenir son pouvoir [i]en premier[/i] alors que les autres obtiendront eux aussi un pouvoir au hazard ; mais simplement un peu plus tard).

author: {'steamid': '76561198070763912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1465729553}
review:
[b]Gameplay[/b]
The gameplay isnâ€™t bad, but itâ€™s not great either.  However, after the most recent patch it has become frustrating.    Passing use to be direct, but now you have to chase after passes-typically by backtracking.  When you get to the ball you may have to circle back to it once or twice to even pick it up, but by then the AI will have picked it up in one swoop.

[b]Play as your favorite team?[/b]
I have played 4 hours in and havenâ€™t even unlocked any European teams, so I do not know how hard it is to unlock them.  However, if you want to play your home country and it happens to be Japan, Australia, Mexico, Canada, the US to name a few, then good luck.  You will have to win a specific tournament on Professional (hard).  For the US, you have to beat 5 tournaments to even unlock the specific tournament.  So if you can get good enough, by the time you do, you may be tired of the game.

[b]Bugs[/b]
My keeper has gotten caught multiple times behind his own net during corner kicks, where I have to go in and out of menus to try to get him unstuck (then I often give up a goal because of it).  My keeper has run off the screen with the ball until the half ended.  My keeper has kicked balls backwards on goal kicks and passes, once scoring an own goal (since the last update), and that is not counting the time he leaps out of bounds with the ballâ€¦or leaps with the ball into his own net.  On low difficulties this is forgivable, but on higher difficulties it is infuriating.

[b]Overall[/b]
This game has potential, and I would consider changing my review if they fixed two big issues: allow players to unlock everything from easy modes and remove the new passing update.  However, I canâ€™t recommend it in its current as I feel it has strayed too far from being an arcade-style soccer game.
developer_response:
Most of the issues you are describing have been fixed, please give the game another chance.

http://steamcommunity.com/games/399820/announcements/detail/876328740924842267

author: {'steamid': '76561198107472532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1670818237}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999636061', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1583856613}
review:
EDIT: I should have updated this sooner but they put the automatic passes back in - the game is fun again!

I never expected to be giving this game a negative review, but the latest patch has ruined the flow of the game completely. What was a fast-paced, arcadey game now inexplicably has a manual passing mechanic - something that absolutely does not fit. I'm not sure what they were thinking.... hopefully they can remove this sooner rather than later but for now I can no longer recommend.
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for feedback. With the new update automatic passes are back, give the game another chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986420642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 133, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1651098545}
review: This is a perfect game for someone that wants to experience the simple fun of the old fifa games (fifa98) with a modern twist.  The Graphics are nothing to brag about but they match the game accordingly. Its all about fun the inputs and controls feel perfect when mastered. Has a bit of a learning curve when it comes to mastering it but easy to pick up and play. Just can't wait for the multiplayer to be ready and then this game will shine...

author: {'steamid': '76561197987893525', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1478356295}
review:
When I was a child, me and my cousin would love to play Nekketsu Soccer (Goal3).
Even now I have its emulated version and sometimes I'm playing it with the same joy.
And I searched an alternative\better version of Nekketsu for a long long time. Years later I found "Lego Soccermania" wich was 3D and super fun to play. Today I found this gem and I'm so goddamn happy.

First you are starting with an easy practice mode, controls are so easy and consistant if you ever played fifa or pes at least once. And then jumping in a tournament with AI. Difficulties are selectable. And I have to say AI is really good. 
You have to start at Oceania Cup.. So you cant just pick the most powerful european teams. They are locked. You have to win the tournament and unlock them. And this is really nice to me. We got stadiums, footballs, teams to unlock. 
We got tons of achivements. I really liked it. 
Online matchmaking is coming. This will be great.
Really nice and cute graphics.
Mayyybe sounds would be better.. But its enough for now.

So.. I really liked this game. It remainded me the good old times that I was spent with my cousin.. 
I will never quit playing Nekketsu but I think I'll be busy with this game for a while.

Muzlu ApprovesÂ®

author: {'steamid': '76561197998542600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1472067249}
review:
[UPDATE 24/08/2016 - after Online Multiplayer patch]
As I promised, I want to update my review by including a feedback about Online Multiplayer.
My overall opinion is Online Multiplayer is badly implemented, plain and simple.
Nice to choose the different modes, too bad you click on 2v2 and you get put in a 1v1 match.
This would be solved easily by introducing a lobby before the match start, so players can join and wait for the game to be filled with enough players to have a 2v2(3v3,4v4 etc.) or quit before the match starts, no?
You can't choose the teams, you can't switch sides if you end up 3v1, you can't do nothing.
Very meh.
Another issue is ping.
This game heavily depends on a good ping to be decent, otherwise it's a torture.
Sadly you can't see your or other players' ping, you only find out while playing and that's not really fun.
I think the Online Multiplayer can be improved A LOT with some little changes here and there, sadly this game has a little online community (I've seen 50 to 70 players online).

The game sometimes randomly freeze, btw.
And players don't hook correctly the ball even if you run over it, that's very annoying.

I recommend this game only if you buy it with some friends to play together, otherwise it may not be the best purchase of your life.

[EDIT: 10/06/2016 after patch, I will probably update it again after the Online Multiplayer patch]

I tried this game and I'm honest: it would be fun if played with/against other humans. Very fun.
Sad thing is: this game has only singleplayer and local multiplayer.
The problem is that playing in singleplayer made me notice many annoying faults this game has:
- Controls [EDITED] -> after the change of passes and the aerial moves, now it's better and even the CPU has to deal with the no-auto passes, giving you room for intercepts.
I still think the slides could be more accurate.
- Gameplay is fun, but repetitive against CPU.
- Difficulty not quite balanced.
- The shooting mechanic is slow to react to inputs and can't be canceled by a pass, annoying.
- Powers are fun but they charge too slow to really be enjoyed and they are random.
- a bug stuck the GK and the match couldn't go on, I lost all the tournament because of that.. not cool.

Another major issue is the lack of online multiplayer and who knows when this game will have it.
Is it a problem to buy a game at 3,50â‚¬ and hope to play it online, one day?
I think it's wiser to wait for this game to have more features and some mechanics rebalanced, before buying it.
The singleplayer isn't very fun but the multiplayer may have some potential, in future.
I hope to change my mind about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077643114', 'num_games_owned': 2952, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1478258328}
review:
[h1]Review[/h1]

If you don't want to worry about team formation, tatics and you want to play quick and short soccer games, this game was made for you.

Kopanito is a soccer game on Early Access that already has a lot of content:
-16 tournaments and cups to play, but you can also create your own tournament.
-100+ teams from all over the world.
-4 AI difficulty levels
-Super-moves
-Achievements
-Leaderboards
-Controller support

It's an extremely simple soccer game. You pick your team (5 players + 1 goal keeper) and you can play a friendly match or try to win a tournament or cup.
There are no fouls, no referees, no team formation, no tatics, no stamina.
The game has a smooth gameplay, you can tackle as much as you want, but that doesn't mean you're going to easily steal the ball.
When you press and hold the kick button the game slows down and you can change the ball direction, making the goal keeper's life difficult.
The super-moves are a nice addition to the game: you can freeze your opponent, you can use a magnet to pull the ball, you can teleport to another region of the field, you can perform a super shot or use a windmaker to blow the ball away from your goal.
You can play locally with your friends: up to 5 local players, using gamepads and a keyboard.
In the beginning you can play just one tournament. You need to win it on the Beginner level to unlock another tournament and so on.
Even though the game has 100+ teams you can pick just a few in the beginning and you need to unlock the other teams.

[h1]Rating:[/h1]

9/10

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[olist] 
[*]Cartoony and cute graphics.
[*]Simple gameplay.
[*]Nice tutorial.
[*]Achievements.
[*]Short games.
[*]Fast pace.
[*]You can generate GIF from your goals. 
[/olist]

Cons:
[olist]
[*]The team supporters are too quiet.
[*]The AI difficult needs balancing. From the Beginner to the Amateur level it gets way too difficult. The devs are already working on it.
[*]The ball rebounds needs improvement. It's hard control your player.
[*]Lack of multiplayer online, but the devs are already working on it.
[/olist]

For similar reviews and great giveaways please visit [url=www.steamified.com]Steamified[/url]

review:
Remind my a favourite soccer game in PS1, Super Shoot Soccer
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xrfmWDtSRl4

Overall game is smooth and fun, anyway here are some features i wish:
- Commentary
- Celebration after win, where all the players not just walk away.
- Player creation and predetermined virtual players with name.
- Player Stats (Stamina, Speed, Shooting Strength etc)
- Player HP (Will be deduct upon tackled, so other player will be sub in if hurt, team with not enough player auto lose)
- Unique team ultimate skill

*BOUGHT A WEEK OR LESS AND IT DISCOUNT 70% !!!!!

I highly recommend if they are able to add online multiplayer..  I feel like there's a big chunk of mechanics missing as well, like the x button should do something on defense.  Arial plays; headers, chest traps, and bicycle kicks are completely absent.  one-timers need to be smoothed a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060476101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1645920290}
review:
I stopped playing football games a long time ago because the simulated realism was taking over the arcade fun of the genre. I can't stand the sport as a real thing but casual arcade fun is great so I saw this and thought "hmm this looks like jokes" The thing that got me is that it is both fun and serious which is fantastic. I don't have to watch stupid transfers and training; I can just play but I have to play well. There's a lot of skill involved in playing this but not necessarily at the start which is good. It gives you time to warm to the controls and play around with the super skills - which are hilarious.

Overall, the game may look silly but it's a real football game. The one thing that threw me off was that I had hoped it was an online multiplayer but unfortunately not. Seeing as it is still in Early Access, hopefully that is something on the developers list for later. Either way, it's a great game with loads of content and local multiplayer is possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972781905', 'num_games_owned': 2809, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1666170794}
review:
unlike FIFA where I rage when the ball gets stolen and I have absolutely no idea why, Kopanito makes it very clear what happened

I got laid the f%^& out and my eyes turned into Xs

Short, fast, high intensity games, with a satisfying slide tackle/steal ball mechanic.

Enjoying this immensely, and it has meant I haven't missed PES and FIFA not being on SteamOS yet.

One gripe which I hope the devs fix as the game proceeds through early access, is the lack of control you have over other players on your team after you've taken a shot and bullet time starts, it's pretty much impossible to control what happens if the ball rebounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289041559', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1514641207}
review:
I love the game. I highly recommend this for ALL kinds of gamers.
The controls are fully customizable and the gameplay is outstanding.

But I feel like the teams aren't UNIQUE enough. I think you should make them have their own unique super move. So it's like this: 75% chance to get your team's supermove and 25% chance of getting the other supermoves. Something like that.

Also the Keeper AI isn't as good as most football/soccer games. You should improve that.

Also please make the amateur difficulty just slightly easier.

Edit: Where have the developers gone to? It seems that since they added translations they've disappeared from the face of the Earth. I think that's quite sad, it would be awesome if they were to add more updates to this awesome game.

review:
Wer kennt es nicht....das Soccer Game auf dem Gameboy? Genau World Soccer (so hiess es glaube ich)
Kein Schiri, grÃ¤tschen was da zeug hÃ¤llt und sobald der Powerschuss aufgeladen ist, Schuss und Tor :)
Wenn wir ehrlich sind, es hat absolute Laune gemacht. Wer dieses StÃ¼ck Kindheitserrinerung wiederhaben will, ist bei Kopanito All-Stars Soccer genau richtig. Es macht einfach nur Laune.

Allerdings gibt es auch einige negative Punkte, die den Langzeitspielspass etwas trÃ¼ben. 
Allen voran der Rasenhintergrund. Ich mein ein tÃ¼rkisfarbendes Spielfeld hat schon was, allerdings wird es nach 20 Minuten doch schwer mal ne andere Farbe in den Kopf zu bekommen. 
Und fÃ¼r die ehrgeizigen unter uns wird es bestimmt die ein oder andere Frustsituation geben, wenn die Archivements nicht erreicht werden. Ich mein in 30sek 5 Gegner umtackeln...da verliert man das Tore schiessen doch etwas aus dem Sinn :D

Aber dennoch definitiv eine Empfehlung wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994454134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1683427217}
review: Pretty fun game! I've currently only got two hours of play time, but I can say the game is a blast. It's a simplistic soccer game, no fouls or refs which is nice, allows for constant game play (like rocket league). Controls were a bit odd for me at first, took a couple of games to get used to it but now its comfortable. Even though the game is in early access, I've only had one crash on me in those two hours, and the game had kept my progress so when it wasn't an issue. Fun game with tons to unlock, for $12 why the hell not?

author: {'steamid': '76561198108526639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1535224195}
review:
Nice game to play together when you have people over. The funny visuals, lack of rules and super moves makes it really fun.

For single player there is currently too little content. Having so many teams to choose from is great, but I would appreciate a greater variability in game mechanics (more super moves, combos activated by multiple players or the like).

I wouldn't buy it for full price, in its current state, but wit the -70% sale it's absolutely worth it.

review:

Ao segurar o botÃ£o para chutar ao gol por exemplo, vocÃª ativa o chute de precisÃ£o, onde tudo fica em cÃ¢mera lenta e vocÃª pode mirar o chute e atÃ© mesmo colocar efeito para a bola fazer curva.

Temos tambÃ©m a mecÃ¢nica de "superpoderes" que no momento em que escrevo esta anÃ¡lise nÃ£o sÃ£o muito numerosos (4 no total), porÃ©m sÃ£o criativos e podem mudar as partidas quando bem utilizados.

Os grÃ¡ficos sÃ£o muito bem feitos e animados, com destaque para o trabalho que fizeram nos jogadores: mesmo que vez ou outra alguns sejam parecidos, foi feito um grande esforÃ§o para que cada jogador tenha algo Ãºnico.

Os jogadores nÃ£o se cansam, vocÃª pode dar carrinhos Ã  vontade que nÃ£o terÃ¡ falta e a diferenÃ§a dos times Ã© meramente visual, todos tÃªm o mesmo desempenho, aqui nÃ£o existe o clÃ¡ssico sistema de barrinhas indicando que o time Ã© bom no ataque, na defesa e etc.
Isto Ã© Ã³timo pois cabe muito bem na proposta do jogo, que nÃ£o tem compromisso com a realidade, e tambÃ©m te possibilita ser crianÃ§a novamente escolhendo um time simplesmente porque achou a bandeira dele e o uniforme mais legais, alÃ©m de enriquecer muito o jogo ao fazer que nÃ£o existam aqueles times que ficam encostados por serem muito piores que outros.

Paguei preÃ§o promocional mas certamente valeria atÃ© mesmo o preÃ§o cheio, apesar de estar em Early Access jÃ¡ Ã© um jogo muito bem feito e plenamente jogÃ¡vel e bastante maduro, realmente vale a pena abrir uma exceÃ§Ã£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020087176', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1472357645}
review:
Esto es Jogo Bonito: Kopanito

Juegos como FIFA y PES se van a los puÃ±os en sus intentos de ser el mejor simulador de fÃºtbol, fallando de vez en cuando en sus intentos pues no logran ser lo esperado y se vuelven todo menos divertidos. Pero Kopanito All-Stars Soccer no es un simulador, es un arcade total, solo te preocupas por pasar la bola, disparar y barrerte, no hay truquitos ni jugadas de pared, esto es una legitima mejenga de barrio, sin arbitro y en eso es que brilla Kopanito.

Las fÃ­sicas, los grÃ¡ficos de lujo y jugaditas a los Neymar se dejan de lado en Kopanito, siendo reemplazadas por risas, barridas al hueso, tiros especiales, con un estilo grÃ¡fico muy ameno â€“Algo parecido a SouthPark, y llamativo que incluso niÃ±os pequeÃ±os encuentran super divertido. En Kopanito todo es diversiÃ³n y aunque no logremos ganar, nos vamos con una sonrisa en el rostro pues el juego es pura loquera y no hay absolutamente nada malo en Ã©l.

El juego es fÃ¡cil de aprender a controlar, como ya mencionamos antes, es super arcade, y mÃ¡s si usas un mando de Xbox, pasas el balÃ³n con A, disparas con X, centras con B al atacar, al defender lo Ãºnico que tienes que hacer es usar B para barrerte y eso es todo. TambiÃ©n tiene alguno que otro truco muy divertido como tiros especiales, tele-transportaciones (si, eso que hace Goku), hasta un abanico gigante nos ayudara a evitar que nos anoten.

Es muy entretenido hacer barridas como desquiciado por todo el campo de juego, tanto que habÃ­a momentos en los partidos que solo me concentraba en intentar barrer a los contrarios en lugar de tratar de anotar, y fue divertidÃ­simo, pues para lograr hacer contacto con los jugadores del otro equipo tambiÃ©n hay que tener pulso, pero valiÃ³ la pena ja, ja.

El juego es en 2D, acompaÃ±ando su estilo arcade â€œsemi-retroâ€ de una manera excelente, su atractivo estÃ©tico es su segunda mejor virtud, los detalles en los jugadores los hacen muy graciosos, nos harÃ¡n reÃ­r a montones y mÃ¡s si jugamos acompaÃ±ados en linea o de manera local, con jugadas increÃ­bles y tarjetas rojas que nunca veremos llegar.

AÃºn en Early Access, Kopanito All-Stars Soccer viene con un sin fin de selecciones nacionales, muchas deberÃ¡n ser desbloqueadas al jugar distintas copas o campeonatos de selecciones,  con posibilidad de hasta 5 controles a la vez de manera local (4 mandos y 1 teclado), con dificultades que incluso los niÃ±os pueden probar sin problemas hasta el mÃ¡s difÃ­cil que nos harÃ¡ intentar romper el control.

Kopanito es divertido, rÃ¡pido y  sencillo, los juegos de fÃºtbol ya no te hacen reÃ­r, Kopanito All-Stars Soccer lo harÃ¡ de sobra.
MÃ¡s de 100 equipos nacionales, 16 torneos, 7 estadios y hasta 600+ jugadores Ãºnicos no son suficientes, pues tambiÃ©n tenemos la posibilidad de crear nuestros propios equipos, estadios y balones. Los desarrolladores han incluido 4 distintas ligas por medio de Steam Leaderboards, empezaremos en la Liga Bronce donde conforme ganemos partidos de torneo (solos o co-op) obtendremos puntos de fama, lo cuales necesitamos para avanzar a las ligas mas altas.

Kopanito es divertido, rÃ¡pido y  sencillo, si los juegos de fÃºtbol ya no te hacen reÃ­r, Kopanito All-Stars Soccer lo harÃ¡ de sobra. No me reÃ­a tanto al jugar un juego de fÃºtbol desdeâ€¦ Bueno, es la primera vez que me rÃ­o demasiado jugando un titulo de fÃºtbol, no sabia que podÃ­a haber â€œfriendly fireâ€ en un juego de soccer, ja ja. Incluso si no te gustase el deporte practicado en Kopanito, te puede gustar demasiado jugarlo con amigos.

Pros:

+DivertidÃ­simo

+Jugabilidad arcade buenÃ­sima

+No hay arbitro!

+Hasta 5 personas local

+Desarrolladores activos

Cons:

â€“El precio regular esta un poquito alto

â€“Los equipos iniciales son muy limitados (Pero se desbloquean conforme ganas torneos)

author: {'steamid': '76561198279348206', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1461013071}
review:
I did not want to give a negative review for this game as it is in early access, and the developer does seem to listen to the gamers and work hard, but after only few hours playing, I feel it was more negative then positive at this stage, even though there is a bit of potential in the game as well as an arcade football game.

However, the way the game is right now, all be it in early access, it is very tedious and frustrating and gets boring quite quickly.

The difficulty jump between each setting is quite high I found, and even on amateur was a challenge because the computer AI tends to be able time things very well indeed when for the player it is much more of a challenge, this is ok, but does get frustrating.

There also is not a lot to the gameplay, it gets very samey with so little options and things going on, you tend to get very bored quite quickly. pass, shoot, pass, shoot, pass, shoot with the odd sliding tackle now and again when you can time it right, and trust me, it's more difficult then you think.

As I say, I reluctantly make this a negative review, I wish there was an option for 'neutral' or 'mixed' as I did not hate it, but it did get tedious.

But I will still be following the progress of the game, and see where it goes as there is potential, but it does need a lot more things added to it because even as an arcade game there isn't much to it, obviously we don't expect Fifa options, but basic things like heading aren't even in the game, which while isn't a gamechanger, put ten or so little things like that to the game and it becomes better, The developer does seem to take notice of the feedback and I applaud him, but right now I won't be playing it again for a bit, but will still follow its progress.

Also PLEASE DO NOT listen to people saying it is a sensible soccer or kick off successor, it really isn't at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997988763', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1461026097}
review:
A great sensible soccer spiritual successor (of which there are a few here on steam, I think this may be the best) that does enough with its art design and gameplay tweaks to make things interesting. The cutesy graphics may steer some away but it really allows for smooth animations which is a must in this fast paced game. 

The lack of online multiplayer (which the devs are apparently working on, so bravo, look forward to it) is the only thing I see holding this back from being the top sensible-like on steam. Local is a blast so it should be a home run when they are able to get it up and running. 

I will disclaimer this with I did buy it when it was on sale below 5 dollars and I am not sure i would have paid full price or been as satisfied if I had. Grab it on a sale unless you are dying for this kind of gameplay (cause it certainly delivers)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964566827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1479948254}
review:
WTF?!
I cant play this game with the Steam Controller.
No Support at all?!
developer_response:
Which OS do you have? Steam Controller doesn't work because Steam Overlay is not working, it's a known issue.

There is a workaround to enable Steam Controller in the game: you need to find a file named "gamepad_generic.vdf" somewhere in your Steam directory and copy it to the "Steam/userdata/4301099/399820/remote/controller_config/" directory inside Steam. Missing directories can be created.

4301099 - this is your Steam Id and 399820 is game's id.
