author: {'steamid': '76561198116969026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1460722082}
review:
Ok so this game here is a prime example of why Steam should allow users to have an 'its ok' button with which to review things, because thats exactly what this game is: its ok, its right smack dab in the middle of whether i could reccomend it or not. However, thats not to say that its a bad game, quite the opposite; it runs smoothly, the controls are intuitive, and the art style and graphics are fine at the very least.

But it is limited. If you get this game then dont really expect anything more than a time waster, a good time waster mind you, but thats about it. The simplicity of the game is also it downfall, making it very hard to play for advanced tactics, as you can LITERALLY run circles around the opponent and win.

It may also dissapoint anyone whos a fan of the more serious football games e.g. FIFA, because some basic game mechanics that you would expect to see are nowhere to be found. For example I will constantly pass to my team mate and start running with him, only to find that HE LEFT THE STUPID BALL BEHIND!!! And that was from a pass directly to him! So, yeh, players wont always latch onto the ball if you pass to them, also your friendly AI can be so stupid and not auto-run onto the ball if its landed right near them.

Dont be put off though, it still has some great mechanics which it utilises perfectly: for one, the slow-mo precision shots are great and pulling off a shot curved right around the keeper feels fantastic! Furthermore the power up system is a nice touch and all the power ups tend to balance out nicely, with some being more O.P than others but never to an unfair extent - yes im looking at you Blue Shell    >:(

I picked this game up on sale so really I'm quite pleased, but looking at its current full release price it would be hard to make a case for buying it, especially as its currently single player and local co-op only, though the developers are quite active and have said that theyre working on an online multiplayer feature, which honestly it really needs as the AI can be laughable at times, and ridiculously skilled at others, basically seems a little unbalanced.

If you do pick this up then I would strongly recommend playing with a controller, makes the game way more friendly for new players, however be aware that if you pause a match using the controller, you will have to press A/X (xbox/ps) to resume the match which, because of the button mapping, will make your player pass the ball unintentionally, or just change players all together - Very Annoying so try and remember to use the mouse to close the pause menu.

In summary, yes definitely pick this game up on sale, but give it a little thought before purchasing at full price. However you can completely ignore me on that one if the devs have added in more features, because online multiplayer would definitely make the price tag more appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996382739', 'num_games_owned': 1574, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1675820639}
review: Most fun I've had playing soccer in a game since the NES.   The aim system is fast and efficient.  Friendly fire is sort of hilarious.  I don't get a lot about it still, but I cannot wit to get some peeps over to play me!  I can't wait to see what else this game has to offer.  My only lame request, that impacts the game none whatsoever, is I wish I could design my jersey.  =P  Seriously well made Soccer sim that fun instead of technical.  The game plays as fast as the real thing.  Great Early Access entry.  Even if you don't enjoy soccer, this one might get your heart racing once you start playing.  A good game for beginners and long time players alike.  I've been waiting for years for something like this..

review: I was hoping this would be an improvement over games like Fifa which require ridiculous commands to be able to play. The learning curve from beginner to amateur level is immense and seemingly insurmountable. Things that would let the computer take the ball from the player have no result when the player attempts them against the computer. Maybe if a player learned the secret commands the computer seemingly has access to (as well as instant knowledge of all actions taken without consideration for human reaction time) the playing field would be more level.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966108426', 'num_games_owned': 641, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1623983992}
review:
This is the closest I've come to finding something like Nintendo World Cup/Nekketsu High School Dodgeball Club: Soccer on the PC.

I generally don't buy early access games, but this game was on sale for $3.59 and is scheduled to exit early access in July 2016.  Single player and local multiplayer with controller and keyboard support are implemented, and generally work well.  XBox 360/XBox One controllers should work out of the box.  Other controllers should work through X360CE, and oddly enough, my DualShock 2 through a USB adaptor worked, though I did have to remap the buttons.

The downside is that there is no network multiplayer support - only local multiplayer support.  The developers have stated that they're working on adding the support before the game exits early access, and I hope that they do because this game is seriously fun.

I wouldn't suggest buying this game for full price right now, at least until it exits early access.  Pick it up while it's on sale and have a grand old time re-living working through Nintendo World Cup at the age of 8!

author: {'steamid': '76561197979750959', 'num_games_owned': 7168, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1462549284}
review:
I don't recommend this game at the moment and I doubt all these faults will be fixed until the final release. 

Cons:
- The performance is worse than most AAA games and the FPS oscillation is a very annoying thing that overly affects gameplay
- Sometimes match crashes for no reason and you must restart the match
- AI is a big problem in this game. It cheats many times and do the same movement every time
- The shot without precise shot is a shit and go anywhere instead where you aim. Almost impossible to make a goal without precise shot.
- The impossibility of head the ball makes corner kicks a key of sucess to make goals, mainly for AI

Pros:
- Many achievements.
- Rebind controls, even on xbox controller (there is a bug to rebind B button, but if you hold it, you can bypass the "return to the previous menu")

author: {'steamid': '76561198017368580', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1492963579}
review:
It's a really funny game but at the moment it has a lot of annoying bugs.
- I spent some time to understand how start a match (don't know why the players didn't join the field alone! I had to figure out which buttons allow you to start it)
- I had some visual lag during the game (and I have 2 970GTX)
- After a goal sometimes the camera get stucked in a super zoom mode that makes the game unplayable (this zoom is removed only when the opponent scores... not if you score...)

As I sayd this game it's really fun and if the fix those bugs will worth the buy absolutly! But at the moment it's a NO, also because of the price of 12â‚¬! Keep work on it and add the multiplayer with more players also online :)

review:
"Kopanito All-Stars Soccer" ist wirklich ein tolles Arcade-FuÃŸballspiel. Wer "Sensible Soccer" oder Ã¤hnliches mochte, wird dieses Spiel auch mÃ¶gen. 
Ich habe bisher nur das Singleplayer-Modus gespielt und es macht schon wahnsinnig SpaÃŸ. Wenn man bedenkt, dass es sich noch immer im Early Access-Status befindet, ist es schon unheimlich ausgereift. Bis auf einen Absturz, lief das Spiel tadelos auf meinem Linux-Distribution "Manjaro". Die Grafik finde ich, dass es einfach richtig schnuckelig aussieht. Animationen sind gut gemacht.

Pro:
+ Ãœber 100 Nationalmannschaften + 16 Meisterschaften
+ Viele Teams und Meisterschaften zum Freispielen
+ Alle Teams sind ausgelichen
+ Einsatz der Super-Move sind nicht Ã¼bertrieben.
+ â€œNintendo World Cupâ€ und â€œSensible Soccerâ€

Cons:
- Steuerung teilweise schwammig
- Die Renngeschwindigkeit beim gedrÃ¼ckter Lauftaste fÃ¼hlt sich wie die Normaler Laufgeschwindigkeit ohne diese Taste an

Fazit:

Aufgrund der noch fehlender Steuerung-PrÃ¤zision und das Hardcore-Feeling auf einem zweit-niedrigster-Schwierigkeitsstufe, leider nur 7 von 10 Punkten.

absolt einsteiger unfreundlich ....... schon beim ersten turnier sind die gegner so Ã¼berkrass das man kaum aus seiner hÃ¤lfte des spielfelds rauskommt ...... und kommt man mal aus seiner hÃ¤lfte raus dann hÃ¤lt der gegnerische towart alles was man ihm entgegenschiesst (selbst en superschuss ging bei dem net rein) und der eigene torwart hÃ¤lt garnichts ..... die gegner stehn direkt vor ihm und schiessen direkt auf ihn drauf und der ball geht an ihm vorbei ins tor

hab mir das spiel eigentlich geholt weil sie meinen damit die nostalgie von nintendo worldcup und anderen solcher spiele wieder aufleben lassen zu wollen aber das is der letzte reinfall ...... keinen einzigen cent ist das spiel wert nur rausgeschmissenes geld

author: {'steamid': '76561197971561879', 'num_games_owned': 12356, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1459589853}
review:
Ein wirklich tolles Arcade-Fussballspiel. NatÃ¼rlich nicht mit PES oder FIFA zu vergleichen. Hier geht es um unrealistischen SpaÃŸ, fast alles ist erlaubt. Das Spiel erinnert mich ziemlich an das Spiel, welches mich in meinen Jugendtagen Monate lang vorm Amiga 500 gefesselt hat: Sensible Soccer. Sensible Soccer auf Anabolika. Das Spiel macht mit Xbox-Gamepad einfach wahnsinnig SpaÃŸ, sowohl im Singleplayer- als auch im Multiplayer-Modus. Wenn man bedenkt, dass es sich noch immer im Early Access-Status befindet, ist es schon unheimlich ausgereift. Die Grafik in 1080pp sieht auch einfach richtig schnuckelig aus. Dazu wirklich viele Achievements und sogar schon Trading Cards. Was will man denn mehr?

Ãœber dieses tolle Spiel kann ich wirklich nur positives sagen. Danke an Merixgames.

{'steamid': '76561197991629941', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1477405641}
review:
great great great game, remembers me a bit of sensible soccer from 20 years ago, i was a bit skeptical because of the additional features like teleport etc but they dont unbalance the game, its just a nice feature to make it more interesting. I just installed it now and i couldnt stop to play (ADDICTION ALARM) even if it was only vs bots (i play only multiplayer games)

This game is very very great and has big potential, if the multiplayer will be added and if REALLY its possible to play 5vs5 then this game will be my next favorite game for playing a small round with less time. 

A Multiplayer world championship would be so nice, i cant wait for the multiplayer feature yet.

The game is not finished but it has 0 bugs, its worth to buy, and it has a HUUUUGE fun and addiction factor...i catched myself few times laughing because of the animations ingame and after you shot a goal.

Lateron the "after shooting a goal" animation gets a little bit annoying but i start loving this game...GOOD WORK

author: {'steamid': '76561198008737053', 'num_games_owned': 5218, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1457557892}
review:
Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a funny skill based football game. Game mostly based on you fast reaction.

In the game you will find in one team of 6 players, your main goal , is should be obviously, because this is a football game, so you should win a match. Beside this you will get for every match different goals like do clean sheet etc. Here to play you can pick a various national teams, but at the start only a few available, other ones you will unlock them when you win a different tournaments in different difficulty level. The basic is a football, but here you will not find too many rules, only some basic like a corned kick, throw in. Also here you will found some special skills what you get randomly after some time and can use it, for example super shoot or teleport.
Here you will find besides a single player tournaments a local multiplayer mode and in future also an online multiplayer.
The game controls are very simple , you can easily learn a basic element, they are well presented in a text with picture, also you can do practice.
The game style well fit to the game style, all characters looks a bit funny, but nice. There you will not find to much sounds, but they are good.

So my verdict:

+enjoyable gameplay
+some unusual in football games
+nice style
+leaderboards 
+local multiplayer up to 5 player
+different difficulty levels
+steam cards and achievements

-at the moment no online multiplayer (will come in future)
-in some moments can be frustrating

Well i think this game you should try out even if you are not a football fan. This game looks fun and can bring enjoyable moments for all age players. Gameplay is based in you skills and fast reaction, but after some practice this shouldnÂ´t be a problem for you. So if you want to get some fresh experiences and try out your skills, this game is for you. Game still in early access, but the announced future updates should do this game even more funny and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968632222', 'num_games_owned': 1660, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1456020000}
review:
To say the game isn't fun for an hour or two would be a lie. But at a price point of 10.99 (CDN) there just is zero meat on the bone to want to keep playing. It took about 4 hours to play all the tournements on the beginner level to unlock the other ones. Then you are to move up to the next difficulty to again, unlock the next tiers of tournements. 

In lies the rub, there is no variety in the games. Yes, it's soccer. But all it is as simply put is; slide tackle, run for 5 feet and then start spinning with the ball and hope the never missing AI might miss a tackle. Then use the sniper mode to aim for one of the corners..... Rinse repeat. That is the whole game. None of the teams have any 'differnce' other then the colours of their shirts/player faces. No team is better then the other and you can NEVER outrun a defender. If you have the ball you run at 75% speed any defenseman can run down forwards. It's just a little silly.

If it's on sale, grab it for a few hours of something sports on Steam. Don't expect it to hold your attention for long once you are past the first few games and your doing the exact thing every game.

review:

Lorsque le multijoueur en ligne sortira, la popularitÃ© et la soliditÃ© de celui-ci sera dÃ©terminante pour l'avenir du jeu, car pour l'instant en solo, le jeu peut devenir vite lassant.

Les + :
- Il n'y pas d'arbitre, du coup, tacler les autres joueurs est assez amusant et mÃªme utile du fait qu'ils restent KO quelques instants.

- Graphiquement le jeu est plutÃ´t joli et les animations des joueurs sont correctes.

Les - :

author: {'steamid': '76561198019156789', 'num_games_owned': 2408, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1494028595}
review:
Do you wanna play FIFA, with realistic ball physics and ultra crisp 3d models?  Then step away and go jump on origins.  Do you want to get a couple of firneds together and jump into a simplified soccer game that has old school charm with modern accessibility?  Then you've found your hiddne gem.

This game is quite simple to play.  Essentially pass,shoot and turbo buttons.  You also get the ability to slow-mo bend the ball every tiume you shoot.  This allows you to pull off some amazing "banana" kicks in your first game.  It's just good arcade sports game fun that reminds why I loved games like NHL 94 so much back in the day.

You can check out some game footage here.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aWXeuZbMGmQ

author: {'steamid': '76561198090267127', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1519360772}
review:
Kopanito es simple de aprender, dificil de masterizar. Despues de casi 10 horas jugadas y 4 campeonatos ganados en la maxima dificultad puedo decir que he completado mi entrenamiento ninja.

Kopanito es rapido, vertiginoso y sumamente adictivo, recuerda al viejo juego de famicon Goal 3. 

Lo unico que se extraÃ±a es el online, ya que una vez que se le toma la mano a la maquina es muy sencillo hacer los goles y evitarlos. 

Miles de selecciones y jugadores, campeonatos y desafios abundantes.

Nota 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198016859026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1479309872}
review:
Genialne !!! pogralem kilka meczy i juz nie moge doczekac sie trybu online...
Brakuje druzyk klubowych i jakiegos trybu kariery lub rozwoju druzyny.

Fajnie sie gra puchary jednak na poziomie amator komputer prawie w ogole nie strzela bramek.
Przydaly by sie jakies kiwki oraz strzelanie z glowki lub szczupaka ...

Ciesze sie ze mam pelna wersje i powoli odkrywam wszyskie pozostale rozgrywki kontynentalne !!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081232637', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1458645135}
review:
Por fin un juego arcade de fÃºtbol divertido y frenÃ©tico. Los que echÃ¡bamos de menos un juego simple pero adictivo a tope desde los clÃ¡sicos Sensible Soccer o juegos de las recreativas estamos de suerte.

Vamos a las caracterÃ­sticas. 5 jugadores por equipo en un campo pequeÃ±ito... el balÃ³n estÃ¡ constantemente en posiciones de peligro. Concepto clÃ¡sico de balÃ³n pegadito a los pies, no tendrÃ¡s problemas para manejarlo. El juego se basa en pases cortos o largos, mientras el rival intenta interceptarlo poniÃ©ndose delante del balÃ³n o del pase, o a travÃ©s de una entrada en plancha. Faltas permitidÃ­simas y la defensa tiene la ventaja de poder correr mÃ¡s. No siempre es muy sencillo encontrar una buena posiciÃ³n de disparo, la IA tapa bien los huecos y hay que caracolear bastante hasta poder tirar. El tiro es el elemento mÃ¡s novedoso, ya que si mantienes pulsado el tiempo se deforma como en Matrix y se vuelve a cÃ¡mara lenta, momento que se puede aprovechar para modificar la direcciÃ³n o darle algo de efecto. En seguida le pillas el truco. Hay que buscar el lugar menos cubierto por el portero y suele ser mÃ¡s fÃ¡cil de encontrar desde la diagonal que desde el centro.

Despues de practicar un poquito sin equipo y un par de partidos en el nivel fÃ¡cil, se puede pasar al intermedio, aunque al principio es difÃ­cil ganar pero lo recomiendo para ir practicando jeje. PuÃ±etera mÃ¡quina!!! AÃºn tengo pendiente probar a jugar contra algÃºn humano malo.

QuÃ© echo de menos? Pues poder personalizar los equipos. Crear equipos personalizados como en el Sensible Soccer (Solteros de MondoÃ±edo, SelecciÃ³n Galega, Amigos de copichuelas, etc), y que los jugadores tengan nombres que tambiÃ©n se puedan personalizar. Si ademÃ¡s hay editor de caras ya serÃ­a genial.

A falta de ese nuevo Sensible Soccer que prometÃ­an en Kickstarter y quedÃ³ en el tintero, bueno es Kopanito Soccer. Si eres de los que echa de menos tener en Steam juegos adictivos y sencillos, con los que echar partiditas cortas de 10 minutos sin mayor complicaciÃ³n, este es tu juego. Y que vengan mÃ¡s!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003030375', 'num_games_owned': 3129, 'num_reviews': 773, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1455279042}
review:
Kopanito All-Stars Soccer:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

â€œWhat a superb pass from the midfielder to the winger - he beat the defender fair and square, he is going to score without a doubt! What a move, Ladies and Gentlemen. Exceptional talent displayed from this player but . . . Hold on, WHAT A CRASHIIIING TACKLE from the second defender, so hard that his boots are the only remains on the pitch! Did you see where he landed, guys?â€ I love commentating Kopanito All-Stars Soccer matches; we see great moves, great tackles and no dives! Plenty of boots here and there but definitely no dives.

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a fast paced arcade-ish sports game. As per the intro, this sports game is absolutely frantic, to say the least! Well, there are no referees on the pitch and we do not care about this silly offside rule. All we have is two teams of six players each who go in to battle fiercely to win the match.  You will be able to use super moves when you fill the energy bar (I call it that), every successful pass, tackle, shot and goal will help you to increase your charge bar. Then you might get the super shot and score; you might get the magnet to pull the ball back to you (this is what Germany used in the Semi-final against Brazil in the latest World cup, for sure); you might teleport a player up field, or even get a massive ventilator behind the net so the ball canâ€™t cross the line! JUST FUN!

16 tournaments and leagues to play either solo or with friends on local multiplayer which supports up to five players (four on gamepads and one at the keyboard) and four levels of difficulty. I would recommend that you start playing on the beginner level for a while and familiarise yourself with the gameplay. As soon as you move up to the amateur, the difficulty increases dramatically. 

During each match, you will be given a challenge - if you manage to succeed you will receive points and in-game achievements. 114 national teams to choose from but a large number of them need to be unlocked. 

I really like the cartoonish graphics; the game is very well balanced and the controls very responsive. 

Positives:
~~~~~~~  

-	Really fun gameplay
-	Great cartoon graphics
-	100â€™s of national teams to play
-	Great number of tournaments and leagues to play (including custom ones)
-	Local multiplayer
-	Trading cards
-	Stacks of achievements

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~   

-	The levels of difficulty increase rather steeply

It is fast, fun, competitive and even frustrating at times. Kopanito All-Stars Soccer is a must-have!

9/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

review:
Great little game. There's room for improvement with move sets and special powers, if they would add more to make it slightly more dynamic and interesting at times, but it's an arcade soccer game. Once online gets implemented I imagine this might become a lot more popular. Especially if they flesh out the core gameplay slightly more.

As it stands, it's still a lot of fun for what it currently is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044853825', 'num_games_owned': 1314, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1455125836}
review:
Imagine a game where your team only consists of O. Khan, Pepe, J. Barton, Gattuso, R. Keane and Diego costa.
And essentially just let them loose because this time there is no ref to sent them off.

The game sounds simple enough, all you got to do is score and everything is legal.
But its alot more challanging then it sounds. Well placed curlers, slide tackles to reach a pass that was a little off, and correctly timed interceptions is pretty much key in this game, aswell as obviously passing, crosses etc. 
There is pretty much no time to rest or think of a strategy since its extremely fast paced.

Itll take quite some time befor unlocking every team/tournament, especially on harder difficulties.

Oh and playing this game as a local co-op with friends is def. recommended. Especially local 2vs2 is alot of fun. You will also learn too hate them every time they use a special power.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184688773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1669243557}
review:
7 Feb 16: Being that it is still in early access, I'll give the devs the benefit of the doubt on this one. I really enjoy soccer games overall, especially ones that don't take it too seriously. Mario Strikers Charged was one of my all-time favorites and the existing reviews, when I bought Kopantio, reflected the same love for the Wii title.

What I love about this one are:
-The number of teams and tournaments available
-The fact that the teams are small. Five a side plus keeps is perfect. 
-Trick shots and trick defence.
-The price is not unreasonable at all

That said, what I find troubling:
-The fact that a majority of the teams and tournaments need to be unlocked and the easier difficulties may still too hard to unlock the things you want to unlock
-The slide-tackling mechanic needs work. Missing a slide tackle is fun when your opponent jukes you, but not when you were a micrometer off on your analog joystick
-My plug in controllers were garbage in Practice mode, but somehow work in other modes

One more troubling thing I should mention:
I have a 10 minute rule, where if I can't have a meaningful game play experience in 10 minutes, I ask for a refund. I did this with Crusader Kings II, as I didn't have a clue of what I was doing. Anyway, It took me a good 20 minutes to figure out the plug in controller situation (I broke my own rule because I wanted to like this game so much). My advice to devs is this: Make this bug your highest priority. People like me don't have too much patience for this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035508167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1493490165}
review:
This is the product of what would happen if the fast-paced and wacky world of Super Mario Strikers met the charming and intense world of Sensible Soccer. Sprinkle some unforgettable scenes from Shaolin Soccer and you have Kopanito All-Stars Soccer. 

[b]Impressions[/b]
+ I have never had so much fun slide tackling in to opponents. Modern grassroot rules of the sport do not apply, so get out there and break those legs!
+ Gameplay is solid and fully responsive between keyboard and gamepad. There is a learning curve involved, but once you discover the importance of team work, dribbling and tackling, everything feels a lot friendlier. 
+ Visually a very charming game. The cartoony art direction is certainly a good call and works well. Player animations are solid. Goal celebrations are... ahem... animated. 
+ Not a lot to offer in terms of sound effects and soundtrack, but the current offering delivers to a satisfactory standard.
+ A large assortment of competitions to unlock and play through including custom tournaments, practice and friendly matches.
+ Powers can be huge game changers and injects new life to the sport. There are four powers in total with individual strengths and weaknesses.
+ Support for up to four additional local players. Grab your friend(s) and charge through various tournaments as a team.
+ Full keyboard + mouse and gamepad support. Keys can be configured to your heartâ€™s content.
+ The greater the goal difference, the more resilient and alert the AI becomes to your tackles and dribbles. Something I have not seen before, but it's a mechanic which works extremely well in an attempt to avoid further catastrophes. 
+ Leaderboard and fame points work really well side by side. Adds a whole different layer of depth for players to continue playing and reach the Platinum League.
+ 225 achievements and in-game trophies. Thatâ€™s 225 individual pieces of effort and excruciating dedication to unlock.
+ Match challenges offer objectives for players in search of small modifiers (ie. avoid using powers, score three goals in 30 seconds, and so on). You gain fame points in return for your efforts.
+ Friendly user interface with all the standard options you would expect from a PC title.
+ Online multiplayer is planned for release with the final version of the game.

[b]Early access consideration and dev feedback[/b]
- A friendly warning: The AI will torture you during your first few sessions/hours until you figure out how everything works. You may even grow suspicious of cheating AI. I most certainly did. The important thing is to try and play as much as you can to get to grips with the gameplay.
- Slight overkill with AI catch up speed compared to player catch up. I don't feel like the sprint button does anything when chasing the AI.
- The need for more power ups or other methods of scoring (ie. volley or header) is great.
- There is an audio balancing issue. Almost all audio during play comes through the right speaker/headphone. I have tried using two perfectly functional headsets and a speaker to cancel any malfunctions on my end.
- Only international teams are playable. It would be great to be able to play in a league filled with fictional teams/players, just to shrug off the feeling of international play. Pro Evolution Soccer has done this for many years with great success (ie. North London: Arsenal; Hampshire Red: Southampton; Merseyside Blue: Everton). 
- It would be an even greater feature to allow players the freedom to create their own teams, team names, players and kits from pre-made designs, then to incorporate this team to a randomly generated and fictional league.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025387388', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2083, 'last_played': 1549923338}
review:
I find Kopanito as a great entertainment. It has even better playability than SWOS. It's a great achievment, because it's much more advanced than Sensible Software masterwork. As in SWOS you used one key to any action (passing, lobing striking, tackling) - here you have 5-6. But do not worry - difficulty levels will help you to advance (or you can still have lot of fun on the easiest difficulty setting). 

Creative and dynamic game, lot of fun (e.g. super powers) - the all you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009355370', 'num_games_owned': 1491, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1451442937}
review: Controller support is broken. So local multiplayer is not possible.
developer_response:
Few hints on using gamepads with Kopanito:
 * While in main menu, you need to press any of the face buttons (A, B, X, Y) on the gamepad to "activate" it "in-game". One or more color shirts in the bottom right corner of the screen should appear.
 * To navigate in menu you need to use left stick, D-pad won't work for now

author: {'steamid': '76561198089986307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 4615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2865, 'last_played': 1561653869}
review:
AWESOME game! Even in Early Access!

Are you a soccer games fan? Do you like to play football?
So this game is ABSOLUTELY for you!

The game is as simple as possible (simplified rules).
At the same time it is as hard as it needed.
The game mechanic is really uncommon and unique!

You may play it with only two buttons.
But if you want to win you HAVE TO use 4-5 more buttons.

It also has some super abilities that add charm to this game.

Moreover the game supports 5 (!) local co-op players.
It is absolutely the case for home parties with friends.
Playing for the same team or organizing home tourney.

Online multiplayer (the key to future success) is coming!
After its implementationt the game will blow the STEAM up!
I'm bet on this!

Can hardly wait when it will finally happen! It would be really GREAT!

P.S.: Responsive developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042443763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1614714380}
review:
I bought the game on the winter sale for 5.-

And after one exciting hour of gameplay I would have paid the full price. I totally love the cartoon-look of the game and the more or less easy controls. I can't really fit my thoughts into sentences so here is a little list of what I liked and what I missed:

+ Cartoon-looks (also the very simple menu)
+ Easy-Controls
+ cool Idea of slowmotion when shooting
+ one Challenge in each match (for example: Dribble the ball for 20 seconds)

- many frameratedrops (I have quite a very good PC)
- The practice wasn't playable for me with gamepad. Keyboard always was Player 1. (maybe I did miss how to change that)
- Some translation-mistakes (german)
- After selecting a team, I couldn't press "Start Match" with gamepad. Had to do it with Keyboard
- Slowmotion effect didn't really brought action to me (Maybe adding a zoom or something? 0.4 sec of slowmotion didn't really made me "fear" if the ball is going in or not)
- Some Challenges were little bit too hard (Scoring 3 goals in 25 seconds)
- too few Power-ups in 4 minutes of gameplay

What I'm missing in the game and is probably going to come:
- Character (+Ball) customization
- Replays
- Selectable Celebrations
- Harder Challenges get rewarded more
- Online-matches
- Some more crazyness (chaotic gamemodes, ((((playing as animals :D)))))
       --> more powerups in 4 minute matches


I definitly will write another review of this game in some months, when development is more advanced.
I also can't wait to play this game with a group of friends (5 Player can play local).

The developer Merixgames did a very good joob for this point.

Hope the review is helping you to buy this cool game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009618833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1482113947}
review: no players show up in any match games. I give the developers the benefit of the doubt that this issue will be fixed by the next patch. I am looking forward to playing the game. I wonder what happenned? The game looks promissing, but I only wish I could play it in its present release.
developer_response: Press the spacebar key to spawn a keyboard-controlled player. Press the BACK button on a gamepad to spawn a gamepad-controlled player. Note also, that a gamepad must be "activated" first in the game by pressing any of the face buttons (X, Y, A, B), preferably in a menu screen - a color shirt at the bottom of the screen will appear.

Kopanito All-Stars Soccer ist ein nettes Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch, der vor allem zusammen mit Freunden an einem gemÃ¼tlichen Abend auf der Couch funktioniert. Echte FuÃŸballfans bzw. Fifa und PES Zocker, werden kaum auf dieses kleine Projekt umsatteln, dafÃ¼r lÃ¤sst das Spiel auch FuÃŸballmuffel dem Ball hinterherrennen und sorgt mit dem leichten Einstieg und einer steilen Lernkurve fÃ¼r Motivation. Der lokale Koop ist super, kÃ¶nnte jedoch ausgebaut werden. Die Ligen und zahlreichen Mannschaften (die man sich freispielen muss) sind vielfÃ¤ltig und bereichern das Spiel. Kein Spiel fÃ¼r lange Zocker-NÃ¤chte, aber fÃ¼r zwischendurch durchaus geeignet. Der Preis der Early Access Version liegt bei knapp 10 Euro, was nicht wirklich zu viel ist, aber durchaus niedriger sein kÃ¶nnte, so lange es sich um eine Early Access Version handelt. Teurer sollte die fertige Version dann auch nicht mehr werden, sonst wÃ¤re mit der Titel etwas zu teuer.
